Francis is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past five years, Francis has operated a tailoring business; his potential customers are neighbors and passersby. His faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Francis dreams of establishing a tailoring school in the future.

Francis plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase cloth materials and renovate his business premises. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to improve the business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She works hard to support her family. 
Corazon has requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.
In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales se hallan cursando la educación secundaria. Ella se define como una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora, comenta que todo lo que realiza es por el bien de sus hijos y por darles un mejor futuro.
Ella tiene una despensa hace aproximadamente 10 años. De a poco y con mucho sacrificio ha logrado ir creciendo con su negocio. Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes, en especial los fines de semana, que es cuando tiene más demanda.
Trabaja de forma conjunta con su marido, por lo que el negocio es un poco más ameno. Sueña con poder seguir creciendo y poder tener una tienda más amplia donde pueda ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra carnes, lácteos, hortalizas, panificados y demás para el abastecimiento de su local de bebidas. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. She is 49 years old, married, and has two children who are finishing high school. Teresa defines herself as a determined and hardworking woman. She says that everything she does is geared toward providing for her children’s welfare and giving them a better future.

Teresa has managed a food pantry for approximately 10 years. Gradually over time and with great sacrifice, she was able to grow her business. She says that she has a good number of customers, especially on the weekends when there is more demand.

Teresa and her husband work together, which makes managing their business a bit more fun. She dreams of continuing to grow and having a larger store where her customers are more comfortable.

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy meats, dairy products, vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other items to restock her shop. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy meats, dairy products, vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year.  She is 33 years old, married to Kajiwe, and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She has been loaned KES 40,000. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow and sell the milk to the local processing farm.

In future, Susan hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus is a married man with 3 children. He sells new garments like trousers, shirts and shoes in Bushenyi, which is in the west of Uganda. From this business, Deus generates profits of about 300,000 UGX per month. He established this business 3 years ago. He also sells coffee which earns him additional income. Before this, Deus was involved in the sale of agricultural produce. He plans to use this Kiva loan to purchase more garments to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more garments for resale

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is 27 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a truck driver at the Tavan Tolgoi LLC. Her daughter is a high school student. Her son goes to the kindergarten. 

She started her business in 2009 by selling clothes at the local market. Starting from this year, she changed her place to the Buyan market and is now selling clothes there. She has already gained several years of practical experience. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She is an open-minded person who says, "This new market is more profitable and there are many customers. I want to expand my business." 

She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to buy winter clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is from the village of Bugallon. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a retail store in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 18 years.

She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, biscuits and other ingredients to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase grocery items such as canned goods, biscuits and other ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
Doña  Maria tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la Aldea el Zapote y se dedica a la cria de cerdos, su negocio lo  tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, Maria desea estar preparada para la epoca de navidad que es cuando mas se venden los cerdos enteros, desea comprar cerdos para tenernos bien gorditos y asi dentro de dos meses venderlos y obtener buenas ganancias.
Maria en sus tiempos libres  visita la iglesia de su comunidad.
texts.en:
María, 41, lives in Aldea El Zapote and works raising pigs.  Her business is at her house.

María wants to be prepared for the Christmas season, which is when whole pigs are most in demand.  She wants to buy pigs to have them really fat and sell them within two months to make a good profit.

María likes to visit the church in her community in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be hardworking and determined. He operates a shoe sales business, where he sells shoes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more shoes to meet demand, especially during this festive season. His business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years.

loans.use: To add stock of shoes.

loans.name: Adilaida

texts.en:
Adilaida is 53 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with 7 children. 
Adilaida has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
Adilaida has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and blessed with two school age children. 

For the last five years, he has sold sand to make a living.  He also rents houses to generate more income. 

Francis has been able to retain his business because he has a good reputation with his customers.  

He has employed two people.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.  In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. 

Francis has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more sand for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sand for resale.

loans.name: Tongnooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOMPASSEKDE  est la représentante du groupe TONGNOOMA. Elle est mariée  et n’a pas d’enfant. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des  vêtements prêt à porter pour  femmes, filles et garçons depuis  03ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10 en ville .Ses clients sont  les femmes, les filles et les enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02douzaines de hauts pour femmes et filles et 10 complets de tenus pour enfants.

 Elle épargne  ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne  acquérir un motocycle et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: SOMPASSEDKE is the facilitator of the TONGNOOMA group.  She is married and has no children.  Although she does not have school-age children she financially supports one person.  She has been selling clothes for women, girls and boys for 3 years.  She buys her merchandise at the 10th district market, in town.  Her customers are women, girls and children.  She would like to buy 2 dozen tops for women and girls and 10 complete outfits for children.  She is saving her profits in order to increase the size of her business.  Her goal is to buy a motorized bicycle and to help pay for her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy 2 dozen tops for women and girls and 10 complete outfits for children.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.  Nida has a shop that sells used clothing like shirts, blouses and jeans. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of used clothing.

Nida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: To

texts.en:
To is a 44-year-old married woman with three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

To and her husband have been running a business for nearly twenty years that makes the paper ornaments that are burnt as offerings on religious and ceremonial occasions in Vietnam. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials, papers and glues to make a larger number of ornaments. She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and meet the higher level of demand that occurs at the end of the year. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials, paper and glues to make ornaments

loans.name: Dagbessi Blandine

texts.fr: Dagbessi Blandine est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un certain Soubérou. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants de Dagbessi Blandine sont scolarisés. Dagbessi Blandine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants, et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Dagbessi Blandine a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Dagbessi Blandine mène comme activité depuis cinq ans environs, la vente de boissons à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Dagbessi Blandine vend des tissus. Dagbessi Blandine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Dagbessi Blandine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédit reçu antérieurement par Dagbessi Blandine a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Dagbessi Blandine is 27 and is married to a man named Soubérou. They have 3 dependent children, 2 of whom are their own. All of Dagbessi Blandine's children go to school. Dagbessi Blandine and her husband live with their children. They both take care of the family financially. She quit school at the secondary level. To meet the financial needs of her family, Dagbessi Blandine has been selling drinks at home for about 5 years. In addition to that, she sells fabrics. Dagbessi Blandine buys her supplies from Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Dagbessi Blandine is applying for a second loan from ALIDÉ. Her previous loan has been paid back.

loans.use: to buy drinks and fabrics.

loans.name: Akol

texts.en:
Akol is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan. 

Akol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and beans. She will use the extra income she generates as a result of this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Moises Walter

texts.es:
Moises tiene 36 años de edad, es un hombre que a pesar de las adversidades por las cuales ha pasado sigue luchando día a día para salir adelante, sobre todo porque con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. La vivienda de Moises se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy calido y acogedor, asimismo  se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, entre otros.
 
Desde muy temprano por las mañanas Moises sale a trabaja en una mototaxi, ya que el ofrece sus servicios de transporte por las calles de la ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; el cree que esta saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es amable con los clientes y porque conduce de manera responsable.

Moises está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y también un reforzamiento de puertas ya que de esta manera las puertas estarán bien aseguradas y dará mas seguridad a los clientes, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Moises is 36 years old. In spite of the adversity he has passed through, he is a man that continues fighting to get ahead, day after day, above all because with the fruit of his labor he supports his parents with their living expenses. Moises's home is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized by having a very warm and cozy climate.  It is also an area where a lot of agriculture is developed, especially the cultivation of grapes and asparagus, among other things.
 
Moises goes out to work in a motortaxi very early in the mornings, offering his transport services in the streets of the city. He works about 8 hours a day and can attend to up to 20 clients each day; he believes that he is getting ahead with his work because he is friendly with the clients and because he drives in a responsible manner.

Moises is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their great help he will be able to perform general maintenance of his vehicle and also the reinforcement of the doors, as this way the doors will be very secure and will be safer for the clients. In this way he will be able to improve his income and keep fighting to make his greatest dream a reality: "To own his own house."

loans.use: to perform general vehicle maintenance and reinforcement of the doors.

loans.name: Mahouna Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUNA est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier et mènent des activités complémentaires. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mélanie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a très peu fréquentée l’école. Mélanie est âgée de 24 ans et vit au Bénin. Mélanie est mariée a un certain Fatai. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Mélanie vend depuis sept ans de l’amidon. Mélanie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mélanie ensemble avec les membres du  groupe MAHOUNA, sollicite un premier crédit.

loans.use: Acheter de l'amidon.

loans.name: Kassandra

texts.en:
Kassandra has had a small diner for over 8 years. She and her husband started off by selling “empanadas” (beef and chicken turnovers) and they progressively grew from there. Kassandra’s husband worked as an electrician and a handy man but is now fully dedicated to the restaurant. He built the grill they use to cook their meats himself and has also made other physical improvements to the location on his own.

They run their operation out of their home and offer a variety of typical Ecuadorian foods including barbecued meats. They are seeking this loan in order to invest in raw ingredients and foods. Kassandra is 27 years old and does not have any children. She aspires to make improvements to her home and the business with the extra profits.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Kassandra wants to make improvements to her small restaurant

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Eli is 23 year old. She has been working on her bamboo hat weaving business for a long time. However, in the past she had to borrow money to buy raw materials. With a loan from MBK, she could purchase more bamboo using cash than she can now. From MBK, she has requested $50 working capital, part of which was will be used for her hat weaving business. She will use the rest as a farming fund to plant cassava. She sells her finished products once a week to a collector that comes to her home.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to buy more bamboos

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina used to work at the local TV station. She is lively and likes to communicate with people. After her marriage, her husband did not allow her to work there anymore. Now she works at the local market and sells perfume. But Zarrina wants to work in Russia. The reason is that she cannot have children, and Zarrina is very sad due to this. She wants to save money for her health, and thinks that only in Russia can she get the right treatment. Her next loan will be used for increasing her assortment of perfumes. During this season she could make more money.

loans.use: Increase her stock of perfumes

loans.name: Romao Casimiro

texts.pt:
Romão Casimiro T. is a fisherman and a cattle farmer. He was born on January 1st 1956, in the city of CaT. in Maputo. His father was a carpenter and his mother a mais who also worked with Liquor retail. He lost his father at an early age. Romao then went to live with his uncle who was a shoe repairer. There Romao learned the trade from his uncle and made a living reparing shoes until he became interested in the selling of sodas, which were scarce in CaT.. Later, he also worked as a street vendor. In 2002, by recommendation of his friends, he began to work with frozen chicken from the neighboring country of South Africa. Romao encountered financial difficulties, he then took out a loan of 6.000,00 through Hluvuku to expand his business.

Latter he requested 3 more loans of 8.000,00, 1.250,00 and 15.000,00 which enabled him to expand and strengthen his business, stat construction of his house and buy a fishing boat. With the 6th loans he bought fishing nets. Romao currently employs 6 people. He intends to buy a motor for the fishing boat and buy more cattle.

His activities have a positive impact in his community in that it brings sea food to his community, generates employment and increases the cattle number in his community.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Romão Casimiro T. Actividade: Pesca Valor do emprestimo: 30.000,00MT (1,200.00US$) Aplicação do emprestimo: Redes de pesca Início: 10/07/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Romão Casimiro T., pescador e criador de gado bovino, nasceu aos 1 de Janeiro de 1956, em CaT. Cidade de Maputo, filho de pai Carpinteiro e mãe doméstica que se dedicava també ao fabrico e comercialização de bebidas alcoolicas em pequena escala. Perdeu o pai muito cedo, facto que lhe levou a viver com um padrasto que era sapateiro, aproveitando assim a aprender um ofício que lhe ajudou a auto sustentar-se até ao momento em que interessou-se pela comercialização de refrigerantes, produtos que escasseavam na CaT. e mais tarde vendia também o açucar, embora de forma ambulante. Por influência de amigos, em 2002 iniciou o negócio de frangos congelados que adquiria na vizinha República da Africa do Sul, tendo enfrentado algumas dificuldades financeiras e recorrendo assim a um empréstimo de 6.000,00mt na Hluvuku para reforçar o seu negócio. Recoreu a mais 3 emprestimos sucessivos de 8.000,00mt, 10.250,00mte 15.000,00mt, para fortificar o seu negócio que era segundo ele bem sucedido, o que lhe permitiu acomular alguns fundos para construção da sua casa e ainda para comprar um barco e redes, iniciando assim o investimento na pesca. Com o sexto e ultimo empréstimo de 30.000,00mt comprou redes para pesca. Tem actualmente 11 pessoas na sua responsabilidade, e como perspectiva pretende comprar um motor para barco de modo a rentabilizar cada vez mais a sua actividade e ainda aumentar o numero de cabeças de gado bovino de modo a ter seu próprio cural ja que de momento deixou em no cural de um amigo. As actividades por ele abraçadas são de grande impacto pois para além de abastecer o mercado de mariscos, garantem postos de trabalho e por outro lado aumenta a população de bovinos que constituem a melhor forma de poupança para as comunidades rurais.

loans.use: To buy nets

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Rosa is 35 years old, she completed high school, and she is the mother of 4 children. She lives in the Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department. Ms. Rosa was a Community Health Promoter with the Reproductive Health Project of the Manuela Ramos Movement, and she used all her persistence to form the Communal Bank "Women of the Morning" in her community. She received her first loan of approximately $96, which she used to buy some guinea pigs and chickens, and in that way she started her business raising and seliing animals. At present she raises and sells not just guinea pigs and chickens, but also pigs, sheep, and cattle. In the afternoons, she weaves sweaters, shawls, key rings, etc. - whatever is requested by her customers in the city of Trujillo.

With the loan approved by Manuela Ramos for approximately $477, she purchased sheep and pigs, because she wants to fatten them to sell during the festival of the Virgen de La Puerta in the city of Otuzco, which is celebrated in the month of December.

Ms. Rosa hopes that her children will be professionals and that she and her husband will have enough resources so that he can open a carpentry workshop.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, es madre de 4 niños y vive en el distrito de Agallpampa, de la Provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Rosa fue promotora comunitaria de salud del Proyecto Reprosalud del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y puso todo el empeño para formar en su comunidad el Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Mañana”, recibió un primer préstamo de S/.300 ($ 96 aprox.) y con él compró unos cuanto cuyes y gallinas e inicia así su negocio de crianza y venta de animales. Actualmente cría y vende no solo cuyes y gallinas sino también cerdos, ovejas y ganado vacuno; Por las tardes teje chompas, chalinas, llaveros, etc. De acuerdo a lo que pidan sus clientes generalmente de la ciudad de Trujillo.

Con el préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.1,500 ($.477 aprox.) compró ovejas y cerdos porque quiere engordarlos para venderlos en la Fiesta de La Virgen de La Puerta de ciudad de Otuzco que se celebra en el mes de diciembre.

La señora Rosa sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y con tener los recursos suficiente para que su esposo pueda implementar su taller de carpintería.

loans.use: Compra de ganado (ovejas, cerdos).

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 and married with five children. Her business is a roadside produce stand. She smiles easily, has a wonderful sense of humor, and welcomes all who pass her stand, located in front of her home. She has had this stand for four years and has been a member of her lending group for ten years.

Today she is selling bunches of onions, cabbage, eggplant, chapatas, avocado, eggs and popcorn. With her loan, she will buy more produce for her stand and pay school fees for her children. Alice dreams of one day opening a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her stand and to pay school fees

loans.name: Kubirat

texts.en: Kubirat I. is happily married with four children. She is 38 years old and comes from Oshodin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells plywood. She has been in her business since 1993. She is the leader of her Union and needs the loan to buy more plywood for sale

loans.use: To buy more plywood for sale

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Team work undoubtedly is one of the keys to obtain a positive fruit at the end of the day and this is what Frida does every day when working with her loved husband who has a wonderful skill to repair devices. This has long ago turned into the main economic activity of her family. This is how Frida and her husband decided to sell second-hand gadgets. They mainly repair TV sets and radios, occasionally other devices like blenders, calculators, etc. Frida knows that sometimes sales are low but her saving skills help them for these difficult moments. Now they commercialize these goods in the streets; nevertheless their desire is to be able to establish in a place. Frida is requesting a loan to acquire a bigger quantity of non-working devices in order to repair them and to sell them to the public in general. Let's support a close family and compromised with her development.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El trabajo en equipo sin duda es una de las llaves para obtener un fruto positivo al término de la jornada y eso es lo que aplica Frida cada día en la labor diaria de su querido esposo que tiene una maravillosa habilidad para la reparación de artefactos; ésta desde hace mucho tiempo se ha convertido en la principal actividad económica de su familia, fue así que Frida y su esposo decidieron dedicarse a la venta de artefactos eléctricos de segunda. Reparan en mayor cantidad televisores y radios, ocasionalmente otros artefactos como licuadoras, calculadoras, etc. Frida es consciente que a veces las ventas son bajas pero se compensan con otras y su habilidad de ahorro le sirven para estos momentos difíciles, por el momento comercializan estos bienes de manera ambulante; sin embargo su deseo es poder establecerse en un local. Frida hace lo solicitud de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de artefactos en desuso a fin de repararlas y venderlas al público en general que solicita estos bienes. Apoyemos a una familia unida y comprometida con su desarrollo.

loans.use: Buy a bigger quantity of non-working devices in order to repair them and to sell them.

loans.name: Azis

texts.id:
Azis is a collector, his daily activity is finding used goods. He lives in Padang Sambian with a rental of 150.000 a month. With his modified motorcycle which included extra two boxes at the rear, he drive thru hosing areas market and warehouse to collect the use goods. Most of the time he buy them from house wifes, and he price them according to good's condition and weight. Financial help from Dinari will be use as a capital to buy more goods. He and his family hopes that their economic condition will improve in the future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Azis adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Padang Sambian dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya yang dipasang kotak di kedua sisi belakang motornya Azis menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Azis membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: buying used goods - untuk membeli barang-barang bekas

loans.name: Sayda Virginia

texts.es:
Three years ago, Sayda started selling ice cream and candy. Her husband was out of work at the time and could only find a job as a taxi driver, but his income was insufficient. Wanting to help with the household expenses, Sayda decided to start her business. Many children currently know about her establishment.

However, she does not have enough products to meet the children’s demands. For this reason, Sayda is requesting a loan of $475.00, which she is willing to repay back in 6 monthly installments, in order to purchase more products to offer to her customers. Furthermore, with her earnings, she will be able to move her family forward with the help of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace tres años que Sayda comenzó a vender helados y dulces. Puesto que su esposo se quedó sin trabajo y lo que pudo conseguir fue como taxista. Sin embargo como con lo que gana no es suficiente. Fue por lo que Sayda con la voluntad para ayudar en los gastos de su casa, fue que comenzó con el negocio. Actualmente muchos niños conocen el establecimiento.

Sin embargo no cuenta con mercancía suficiente que demandan los niños. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Sayda podrá comprar más mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Además de que con las ganancias podrá sacar adelante a su familia con la ayuda de su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Vicki

texts.es:
Vicki is a happy mother with a generous heart. Despite her economic condition she has always tried to help her family get ahead and improve their quality of life. She is originally from Cuzco but for family reasons now lives in Juliaca. Since she moved to Juliaca she has worked as a vendor of seasonal items. A few months ago Vicki started selling wholesale Christmas cards and postcards. She is very proud and satisfied with her success. During the coming school year she would like to sell books to students in primary and secondary schools. She is sure she can achieve her goal with hard work and dedication.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Vicki, es una alegre madre con un generoso corazón, pese a su condición económica siempre trata de apoyar a los suyos a salir adelante y mejorar su condición de vida. Ella es natural del departamento de Cuzco y por cuestiones familiares radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que vive en dicha ciudad se dedica a la venta de artículos por campañas y hace algunos meses atrás se ha dedicado a la venta de tarjetas y postales navideñas al por mayor, se siente muy orgullosa y contenta por los resultados que ha obtenido con su desempeño.Ahora por esta temporada escolar desea ofertar libros para estudiantes de nivel primario y secundario, está segura que con voluntad y mucha dedicación conseguirá su propósito.

loans.use: Injection of capital to sell books in the school fair

loans.name: Hadia's Bora Utu Group

texts.en:
Hadia, age 24, is single and takes care of 3 others (ages 20, 12, and 3). She sells sarongs and clothes door-to-door to make a living. She works from 7 A.M. to 2 P.M. daily and started this work 3 years ago. From this business, she makes a monthly profit of about $30.

Hadia hopes for a loan to purchase more sarongs and clothing to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members belong to group Bora Utu. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sarongs and clothing

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: K. Gulchehra is 30-years old. She is married with two school-aged sons. Gulchehra has been selling women's clothing in the local market for 8 years. Her husband help her get started by providing the initial funds. Because she is hard working and polite, she has attracted loyal customers that return to buy from her. This business generates astable income for her family. Gulchehra is requesting a loan of $600 for the term of 6 months. She will use the loan to upgarde her stock and buy summer season clothes. Gulchehra is counting on your help. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To upgrade stock of women's clothing

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en:
Latifat M. owns a fish pond in which she rears fingerlings into adult fish for sale. She studied this business for one year and has been operating her pond since 2006. Latifat is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Egan, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Latifat has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more fingerlings and feed, which she says will enable her to produce more fish for sale.

loans.use: To stock a fish pond

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a 48-year-old, married woman with 4 children who are 23, 20, 14, and 12 years old. She began selling clothes in 1998. Every day, she works extremely hard from 10 am to 3 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $40 from her sales.

Ester now requests a loan in order to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Saada's Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.en:
Saada is 30 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 13, 12, 8 and 6 years old. She has been a firewood seller since 2004. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Saada is now requesting a loan to buy more firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mtumwa, Asha, Christina and Kesi.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her businesss.

loans.name: Fanáticas Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Los Andes esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a éste  pertenece la asociación “fanáticas ” que trabaja junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace  un año aproximadamente , demostrando gratitud y lealtad a dicha institución.
Existen diversas actividades dentro la asociación, por ejemplo se dedican a la confección y venta de zapatos y al tejido de mantas de vicuña, productos que los comercializan en principales mercados de la ciudad.
 Para ampliar su producción necesitan comprar materia prima, es decir cuero de vaca y/o cuerina, y fibra de vicuña, para el tejido de las mantas y mantillas, tienen el sueño de formar una empresa grande, que genere mayores ingresos para sus familias y además pueda dar oportunidad de trabajo a otros.
texts.en:
The town center Los Andes is located in the city of El Alto, where exists the association "Fanáticas," which has worked together with the group Pro-Mujer for approximately one year, showing gratitude and loyalty to the group. Various activities exist within the association. For example, some are dedicated to the construction and sales of shoes, and some are dedicated to the weaving of vicuna (a llama-like animal of the central Andes that yields a soft wool) blankets, which they sell in the city markets. To increase their production, they need to buy more raw materials, such as cow leather and vicuna wool for weaving blankets. Their dream is to form a large business that will generate greater incomes for their families and provide work opportunities to others.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather and vicuna wool

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam has been selling firewood in Zanzibar for three years. She works from 7:00am to 8:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $35 each month. She is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she may buy more inventory to increase her sales and profit.

Maryam is 35 years old, married, and has four chidlren, aged 1, 4, 13, and 14.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Golib

texts.en: Golib U. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Spitamen in Tajikistan.  He supports his family by raising cattle, which he sells to a butcher shop in the local market after fattening them to a desirable size over the course of eight or nine months.  Golib recently realized that his business has the potential for significant growth, and has decided to purchase two more calves each season that usual.  In order to achieve this goal, which will allow him to earn more profit and better support his family, Golib is requesting a loan of $750.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Mrs. Yi Y., 35, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She catches fish and makes fishing tools, earning $5 a day. Her husband, Yi Seng, makes $1 a day as a rice farmer. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have caused a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Yi Seng included.

Mrs. Yi Y. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike and fish. They will use the bike to transport fish to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to bring fish to market to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Diana M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child who is three years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants who depend on her because they are orphans. Diana has been running a cafe business since 2005. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), and plantain (a cooked savory banana) all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Asha currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 525 USD in order to purchase wheat and maize flour, cooking oil, and rice. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Diana thanks you for your support. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase wheat and maize flour, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: San Juana Milagros

texts.es:
La señora San Juana Milagros acaba de adquirir su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le esta haciendo falta las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas también algunos acabados del interior de la casa.
 Doña San Juana no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder realizar la mejora, para poder habitar la vivienda. Entre la señora San Juana y su esposo el señor Juan José planean pagar el préstamo con los ingresos de su trabaja como chofer de camión de carga.
(En la foto no aparece la señora San Juana sino su esposo Don Juan José).
texts.en:
San Juana Milagros has just acquired her home through a government loan but her home lacks the protection of windows and doors as well as some interior finishes. San Juana does not have the necessary capital to make these improvements in order to occupy her home. San Juana and her husband Juan Jose plan on paying this loan with the income her makes as a truck driver. (Juan Jose appears in the picture - San Juana is not pictured).

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase windows and doors and some interior finishes for her home.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine D. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, beans and fish at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Christine is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a secretary in UNDP Sudan. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Las Cariñosa Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las Cariñosas" esta representado por la señora Petrona y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales se dedican en su mayoría a la venta de pan, ropa y a la elaboración de prendas de vestir. La competencia dentro de este ámbito es dura pero gracias a que ya tienen clientes fijos de tiendas se acaba el producto diariamente. El crédito esta destinado al incremento de materiales, insumos y a la adquisición de mercadería que facilite y mejore la producción y por ende sus ingresos los cuales son el sustento de sus familias. A pesar de que es un grupo relativamente nuevo se ve que son gente responsable y con ganas de salir adelante para mejor la calida de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Las Cariñosas” communal bank is represented by Petrona and is made up of 15 members, most of whom work selling bread, clothing, and making clothing. The competition in this line of work is tough, but thanks to the fact that they already have steady customers, they sell out of the products daily. The loan will be used to purchase materials, ingredients, and merchandise, which facilitate and improve production and therefore their incomes, which support their families. Despite the fact that they are a relatively new group, they are responsible and with a great desire to get ahead and improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de operaciones

loans.name: Maria Jessica

texts.es:
La señora M. Jessica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias” vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru – Psje. Nº 27 de Octubre, del Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente y tiene 31 años; es madre de 01 hijo.

Se inicio con S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, vendiendo prendas de vestir. Tiene 06 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, los mismos que ofrece a sus clientes y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,100.00 que será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará ropas interiores de todas las tallas, modelos y colores en docenas, de tal manera que pueda tener variedad para ofertar a su clientela, también invirtió comprando cosméticos de diferentes líneas.

M. Jessica, refiere que el Banco Comunal es una excelente propuesta para las mujeres que desean trabajar y progresar.
texts.en:
M. Jessica is a member of the "Victories" Communal Bank. She lives in the Jr. Tupac Amaru, Juanjui District, Department of San Martín. She is 31, the mother of one son, and lives with her partner. She began her business with a small sum of her own money, selling items of clothing. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 6 years. She is currently in the same line of business, offering her services to clients and friends. With this loan of $375 to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy underwear in all sizes, styles and colors by the dozen so that she will be able to offer a variety to her clients. She will also invest in the purchase of different lines of cosmetics. M. Jessica notes that the Communal Bank, a partner of Kiva, is an excellent vehicle for allowing women to work and to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of underwear at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Reynita De Belen De Ccorao Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “REYNITA D. BELEN D. CCORAO”, tiene fundado 6 años, y se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Corroa, ubicada a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios, tienen todos como principal actividad la agricultura, alternando está y en época D. secas, la gran mayoría D. socios se dedican a la venta D. artesanía, por ser Corroa una parada obligada a la ruta del complejo turístico D. Pisac, Corroa es tierra D. artesanos, allí hay talleres enteros D. producción D. artesanías y tejidos en lanas D. alpaca y oveja D. mantillas, gorros para el frío, guantes, ponchos, chalinas, chompas y mucho más; por lo que casi toda la población vive D. la venta D. sus artesanías, otro sector minorista tiene tiendas pequeñas en la que venden agua mineral, galletas, gaseosas, chocolates y alternan con su artesanía, para lo cual los socios requieren el préstamo, ellos necesitan reinvertir en su mercadería, por que la temporada alta del turismo ya empezó.

Los socios se encuentran sumamente agradecidos y valoran el préstamo que se les otorga debido a que en su localidad no encuentran la presencia D. una banca financiera, por lo que ellos se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total D. su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The community bank “Reynita D. Belen D. Ccorao" was founded 6 years ago and is located in the Corroa community in the city of Cusco.

Our members are all involved in agriculture, and during the dry season, the vast majority of the members sell artwork, as Corroa is an obligatory stop in the touristic route through Pisac. Corroa is a land of artisans. There are entire workshops of handicrafts and Alpaca wool fabrics, laces, hats for the cold weather, gloves, ponchos, scarves, sweaters and much more. Almost everyone in the village lives off of the sales of their handicrafts. A minority sector has small shops which sell mineral water, cookies, soft drinks, chocolates, and alternate this activity with their crafts. The loan is needed to invest in merchandise, as the high season for tourists has already begun.

The group members are extremely thankful for the loan they will be granted, as in their area they have not been able to find a financing institution. They promise to repay the entire loan amount on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for their handiwork and to buy seeds and dry grains

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.en:
Thái Nguyễn Thị (1036061070) is a 32 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has 2 infant children. To making a living, Thái owns & operates a business raising livestock. The focus of this business is raising cattle for sale. Thái has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Thái joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Thái has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. Her previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Thái is now requesting a loan of 12,000,000 VND. These funds will be used to expand the shelter for her livestock. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Thái from TYM Fund.  Thái plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the shelter for the livestock.

loans.name: Angela Teodora

texts.es: Ángela Teodora S. Vanegasno tiene la edad de 68 años, es una madre soltera. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadearía en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Ángela inicio este negocio por la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella tiene los propósitos de seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es el único que le ayudo salir adelante. Últimamente ha tenido que viajar a muchos departamentos porque algunos clientes les gusta la buena atención que ella brinda. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo  para la compra de bolsos, calzado, ropa interior y cosméticos. E sueño de Ángela de establecer un negocio en su casa de habitación y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela Teodora S. Vanegasno is 68, and she is a single mother. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than four years. Ángela started this business because she needed to increase her income. She plans to keep running this business since it is the only thing that helps her get ahead. Lately she has had to travel to a lot of departments because some of her customers like the good attention that she offers. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy bags, footwear, underwear, and cosmetics. Angela’s dream is to set up a business in her house and improve the family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es casado, se dedica a prestar sus servicios en el transporte público como taxista con su vehiculo propio, la esposa posee una tienda de abarrotes con un punto de llamadas. Ambos tienen un hijo el mismo que vive con ellos. Poseen una tienda de barrio donde venden productos de la canasta familiar básica, (picadillo, viandadas, sardinas y otros), además de pan, harina, fideos, azúcar, aceite. La competencia es alta, pero cuentan con clientela fija de la misma zona y el barrio, la cual demanda los productos que oferta. Francisco surtirá su tienda con nuevos productos consistentes conservas de diferentes tipos, así como productos básicos de la canasta familiar (venta al raleo). Sexto crédito al que accede Francisco. Ha demostrado permanentemente buen cumplimiento y pago oportuno de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Francisco is married. He is a taxi driver, and he drives his own vehicle. His wife has a grocery store with a call center. They have a son, and he lives with them. They have a neighborhood store selling common products for families (ground meat, delicacies, sardines, and others) in addition to bread, flour, noodles, sugar, and oil. There is a lot of competition, but they have a fixed customer base from the same zone and neighborhood. These customers want the products that they sell. Francisco will stock his store with new products like different canned goods and basic needs items for families (sell at retail). This is Francisco’s sixth loan. He has shown consistently good completion of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, actualmente vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde las 4 de la mañana se levanta para preparar los alimentos, mientras que su esposo se adelanta a trabajar en sus cultivos de papa o arvejas y a eso de las 8 de la mañana ella se incorpora hasta las 6 de la tarde. Trabajar de este modo le agrada mucho a Ofelia, no siente cansancio ni pesadez en su cuerpo, ya que esta actividad la realizó desde niña; pero lo que más la llena de regocijo es comercializar sus productos en el mercado de Tarma, ya que en la mayoría de las veces llega a venderlos a buen precio. Pero últimamente los está enviando directamente al mercado de la ciudad de Lima por generarle mayores ganancias, es así que le alcanza cubrir la educación de sus hijos, asimismo le sirve de capital para volver a sembrar. Para más adelante, Ofelia quiere comenzar a sembrar hortalizas porque son productos muy rentables. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, durante estos ciclos ha demostrado pagar fielmente cada una de sus cuotas, del mismo modo asiste a todas las reuniones de mes, ya que se siente muy cómoda con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado lo piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de papas y de flores.
texts.en:
38-year old Ofelia is a hardworking woman who lives with her partner and their two children in their own home. She gets up at 4 am to prepare food while her husband sets off to work in their fields of potatoes or peas. She joins him at 8 am and they work till 6 at night. Ofelia enjoys agricultural work—she doesn’t feel tired or get worn out by the hard work as she has been doing this since was a little girl. What really delights her is selling their products in the Tarma market since most of the time she gets a good price for them. Recently she started sending them directly to the market in Lima as she earns more money that way. The profits will be used to cover the cost of educating her children and as capital to buy more seeds. In the future Ofelia wants to grow vegetables which are very profitable. This is her tenth loan with Kiva partner, MFP, and she has clearly demonstrated that she will repay her loan faithfully. She also attends all the monthly meetings as she feels very comfortable with the other members of the community bank. She is planning to use the loan to buy chemical fertilizer to spread on her potato and flower fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi G. is married and has 5 dependents. He has received schooling through primary school. Kofi has been selling spare car parts and operating a corn mill in Bantoma since 1994. His wife is a fishmonger. Kofi uses his income to pay school fees and other bills. Kofi will use the loan to purchase spare parts. He plans to reinvest the new profits from his expanded business.

loans.use: Kofi will use the loan to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.pt:
Raquel M. nasceu na cidade de maputo tem 50 anos de idade e é mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 9 e 19 anos todos freqüentam escola.
Raquel estudou ate 4 classe tendo parado devido à fraca condição financeira que os pais enfrentaram na era do colonialismo português.

Raquel passou a viver com seu marido quando tinha 24 anos de idade, no distrito de boane. Desde que saiu de maputo para este distrito nunca saiu para outra zona do pais, seu trabalho é de comercio (venda de refeições) no mercado central de Boane desde o remoto ano de 1986.

Aprendeu a fazer esta actividade de sua mãe. Não tem empregados, conta com ajuda das suas filhas que são também estudantes em turnos diferentes.
O seu prato do dia é carne de vaca com xima (massa de farinha de milho) que vende a 35,00MT cada refeição. O seu rendimento mensal é de 4.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e às vezes consegue poupar algum dinheiro na sua conta num banco comercial que opera no distrito de boane.

Raquel nunca teve empréstimos coom outros Bancos. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas, logo após a abertura da sucursal de Boane, tendo solicitado o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 8.000,00MT e outros subseqüentes nos valores de 10.000,00MT; 15.000,00MT e 20.000,00MT respectivamente para o exercício da mesma actividade.
Com o presente empréstimo de 25.000,00MT pretende comprar alimentos para confecionar e reforçar o negocio para poder responder a demanda cada vês mais exigente e crescente.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos coom finalidade de criação de frangos de corte.
texts.en:
Raquel M. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 50 years old and has four children between the ages of 9 and 19. They all attend school. Raquel went to school until the fourth grade and then had to stop because of the difficult financial situation her parents faced when Mozambique was still a Portuguese colony. Raquel went to live with her husband in the Boane district when she was 24 years old. She hasn't been anywhere else in the country since she left Maputo. She's worked selling meals in Boane's central market since 1986. She learned the business from her mother. She doesn't have any employees, and depends on her daughters for assistance. They alternate shifts when they're not in school. She serves beef with xima (a type of Mozambican corncake or polenta), which she sells for 35 meticals a meal. Her monthly income is 4000 meticals, which she uses to support her family, and sometimes manages to save a little money in a local bank account. Raquel has never received loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends. After the Boane office opened, she requested a loan in the amount of 8000 meticals, and further additional loans in the amounts of 10,000; 15,000; and 20,000 meticals, respectively. All of her loans have been used for the same purpose. Raquel will use this loan of 25,000 meticals to purchase ingredients for her meals and expand her business to respond to growing demand. She intends to pay off the loan in full without difficulty so she can request other loans that she will use to begin raising chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for prepared meals

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 34 year old father of 3 who lives and runs his tailoring business in Mukuru slums of Nairobi. He has been in this business for the last five years after four years in employment. He has requested his third loan of Ksh. 20,000 after successfully repaying two loans. He intends to buy additional sewing machines and add stock of materials (fabric) with the loan money. He hopes to educate his children, start a business for his wife and start a tailoring school. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock & Buy additional sewing machines

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is 23-year-old Elizabeth M. from Mbozi. She is married and responsible for supporting two orphans. Elizabeth has been running a shoe shop since 2007. This involves purchasing shoes on a wholesale basis and reselling at retail. She works at the business for nine to twelve hours per day, six days a week, assisted by one employee. Elizabeth currently earns about $120 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more shoes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her products. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: God Is Wonderful Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five borrowers led by Jartu R., 48 years old. She is married with seven children aged 16-30 years old. Their educational levels are 10th grade through college student. Jartu is illiterate due to lack of financial support from her parents. She lives in Virginia, northern Monrovia, Liberia.

Jartu's business is buying fish wholesale and selling at retail in the Virginia market. She has been running this business for four years and is doing well.
The difficulty Jartu faces is when goods are bought, and then immediately the market price changes. It causes a loss in the business.
The good approach and affordable price she gives her customers makes her business go on fine. Jartu needs this loan in order to purchase more goods to expand her business. She dreams of improving her business so that she can educate her children the best way.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to expand her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells clothes and jewelry to earn a living. She is a 46-year-old married woman with 6 children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for 10 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more jewelry and clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa; sus cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 7 y 3 años de edad; su madre y su sobrino en el sector Cruz del Médano, perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, ubicado una hora al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de animales menores. Empezó trabajando como agricultor pero los continuos problemas de escasez de agua para la irrigación de los sembríos en la zona hizo que poco a poco dejara de sembrar y que le dedicara más tiempo a la crianza y venta de animales.

Jorge compra animales para luego criarlos y venderlos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Usualmente cría cerdos, pavos, patos y cuyes. Las continua necesidad por la que atraviesa su familia y el incremento de la demanda por parte de sus compradores han hecho que planee ampliar su negocio por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compa de más animales.

El nos cuenta que su mayor anhelo es poder construir su casa de material noble (de ladrillos y cemento) y brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior. El es un padre responsable que siempre trabaja dando lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 44-year old father who lives with his wife, his 4 children - ages 12, 10, 7, and 3 - and his mother and nephew. They live in the Cruz del Médano sector, belonging to the district of Mórrope, located an hour north of the city of Chiclayo.

He works in agriculture and the sale of small animals. He began working as a farmer but the continuous problems of water scarcity for crop irrigation in the area caused him to little by little leave farming and dedicate more time to raising and selling animals.

Jorge buys animals to raise them and sell them to businessmen that frequent the area. He usually raises pigs, turkeys, duck, and guinea pigs. The continuous necessity of his family is the increased demand that his customers have. For this reason he plans to grow his business and this is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to invest in purchasing more animals.

He tells us that his greatest longing is to be able to build his house of noble materials (brick and cement) and provide his children with the opportunity to for advanced studies. He is a responsible father who always gives his best in his work in order to take care of himself and his own.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod A. is 28 years old, married and has a little daughter. His wife stays at home, but is currently training to be a hairdresser. She wants to open a salon so that she can supplement her husband’s income. Dilshod sells hay for animals at his house and at the market. He buys them  wholesale from local farmers. Having worked in this business for 10 years already, he is a well-known seller of hay in his village and has many clients who buy hay from his house. The price he charges for hay is based on the quantity that his customer buys. Dilshod also offers a discount to his frequent buyers who come to him often. With a loan from IMON International, Dilshod plans to increase his stock in order to fully meet the demand of his growing customers. He says that the demand is there and his problem is being able to supply enough hay. The well being of this young family is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as: Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Éxito II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y madre D. 05 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Rosa Victoria, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta D. ropas usadas, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben D. su negocio. También se traslada por los diferentes lugares D. las zonas, a ofrecer su mercadería.
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará  más mercadería D. ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosa Victoria belongs to the “Mujeres con Exito II” Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín province, department of San Martín. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children, all of them adults. Rosa Victoria is a persistent and capable woman. She makes a living selling second-hand clothing in a location that is very well equipped; her business is located in her own home. She tells us that her business is going well—she has customers who know her and who know about her business. Rosa Victoria also travels to different places in the area to sell her merchandise. Her strength and perseverance have helped her to grow as an independent woman who is very proud of her achievements. She will use this loan of 800.00 soles to purchase more second-hand clothing so that she can stock up on items such as trousers, shorts, blouses in all sizes and styles, polo shirts, and dresses for women and girls. Rosa Victoria feels that she is an established and hardworking woman. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for the opportunity it has offered her, which will help her to develop further as a woman and as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La señora JUANA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “HUAYNA CCAPAC” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco. La socia tiene 47 años es madre soltera y tiene un hijo que se llama Alexander. 

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivó abrir hace varios años su propia ferretería, cuyas ganancias aporta al ingreso económico en su hogar. Ya son varios años en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para adquirir más artículos para la ferretería comprará clavos, pernos, pintura, etc.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. En la foto la socia esta acompañada de su hijo Alexander.
texts.en:
Ms. JUANA belongs to the Asociación Arariwa’ s communal bank “HUAYNA CCAPAC” ,in the Province of Cusco, Department of Cusco. The member is 47 years old, is a single mother and has a son named Alexander.

Her character and desire to fulfill her dreams motivated her to open her own hardware store a few years ago. The earnings from the store contribute to her household income. She has now been in business several years and things have gone very well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. Our member is a hard-working and enterprising mother who supports her family in spite of adversity. The member is requesting a loan to obtain more products for the hardware store. She will buy nails, bolts, paint, etc.

The member is grateful for the opportunity provided by this resource and she promises to make her scheduled payments. In the photo, the member is accompanied by her son Alexander.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to obtain more products for the hardware store, she will buy nails, bolts, paint, etc

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Roxana tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos y dependen de ella: Angela tiene 8 años y Nicol tiene 2 años. La socia Roxana es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su esposo y sus hijos. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a las 7 de la mañana al “Mercado Modelo de Urubamba” a vender juguetes hasta las 7 de la noche. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido buen bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. La socia nos cuenta que requiere el préstamo para construir su humilde casa y para comprar juguetes para esta campaña navideña. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. En la fotografía la socia se encuentra acompañada de su hija menor.

La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra a 78 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a una hora y media de viaje. La ciudad de Urubamba se halla en el corazón del Valle Sagrado. En la época prehispánica fue un centro agrícola muy importante.
texts.en:
Roxana is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has two young children: Angela, who is 8 years old and Nicol who is 2 years old. Roxana is a native of the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco and is a member of the village bank "Jose Carlos Mariategui" within the Asociación Arariwa. She wakes up very early to do housework including preparing breakfast for her husband and her children. After her morning housework, she goes to the local market "Mercado Modelo de Urubamba" by 7 am to sell toys until 7 at night. She has been involved in this business for a year now and has fared well thanks to her hard work. She will use the loan to build a modest house and buy toys for the holiday season.

Roxana is grateful for the opportunity offered with this loan and agrees to make all the payments on time according to the payment schedule. In the photo Roxana is accompanied by her younger daughter.

The city of Urubamba is 78 kilometers from the city of Cusco, a journey of about an hour and a half. Urubamba is in the heart of the Sacred Valley in Peru. In pre-Hispanic times it was an important center of agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construct a modest house and buy toys for the holiday season

loans.name: Angua

texts.en:
Angua A. is 37 years old and a widow. She has five school-aged children. Angua is currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil in the market, and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees and build them a house to settle in.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal D. Ladrilleros D. Compañía, es D. la comunidad D. Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Celestina es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Celestina junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad D. Compañía, producto que venD. en el mismo lugar y también lleva a las obras.
Celestina necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago D. los peones y leña.
Los sueños D. Celestina son tener capital propio y construir su casa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the Communal Bank Ladrilleros D. Compana, a community located about 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Celestina is 50 years old, and married with 5 children. Together with her husband, she works making bricks and tiles which they sell in Compania and deliver to construction projects. Celestina will use this loan to purchase firewood and to help pay the workers. Her dream is save up enough money to build a house in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood for their brick business and help pay the workers

loans.name: Manylyn's Group

texts.en:
Manylyn M. is from the village of Palao, Solana, Cagayan. She is 22 years old. Manylyn is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Manylyn is single. To make a living, Manylyn works in someone else's business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Manylyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Manylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manylyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the first loan taken out by Manylyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anselma's Group

texts.en:
Anselma C. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Anselma is the group leader for a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Anselma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Anselma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, sardines, etc. in the local community. Anselma is just starting this business.

In 2010, Anselma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
