Anselma is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anselma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni C. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of beans and pulses (groundnuts, peas or cowpeas) to sell. 

Poni is 30 years old and married to an engineer. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase bags of beans and pulses (groundnuts, pea or cowpeas) to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase underwear and jewellery for resale

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick B. is a 26-year-old married man living in the South Rift Valley of Kenya, near the town of Litein. He has two children, ages 5 and 7, and both are currently attending school. 

He is pictured above at his butcher shop, but he's also been running a mixed farm for four years now. He earns his income selling the milk and tea produced on his farm, and from running his butcher shop in town. He is able to employ three people in the community. He says that lately the main challenges to his business are lack of clean water, insufficient feed for his livestock and poor marketing and pricing for milk.

Erick has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing a loan of 40,000 KES. He has now requested this loan for 50,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow (40,000) and to expand his butchery business (10,000). He says that with the added income he'll earn he can repay the loan and also care for his family's needs.

In the future, he hopes to improve his cows to pedigree level, producing 30 liters per day, and to add to his land. He thanks Juhudi Kilimo for having improved his living standards through loans, and he promises to repay loans well so as to get another one.

loans.use: To buy a cow and make improvements to his butchery.

loans.name: Jose Fabian

texts.es:
José de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (En la foto el aparece de lado izquierdo con una camisa ploma, esta con su esposa y su mejor amigo) empezó a vender pescados hace 4 años, en la esquina de su casa, para poder mantener a sus cuatro hijos de 20, 19, 16 y 15 años. Aunque su casa es de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico, el sigue trabajando como vendedor de pescados.

Su trabajo lo realiza con ayuda de su esposa y en ocasiones con sus hijos, trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 00h00 pm todos los días. Ahora su puesto de trabajo esta ubicado en un mercado del Fortín.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar, pescados para su negocio. En el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old and lives in the semiurban area of Fortin de Guayaquil (in the photo, he is on the left side in the lead-colored shirt with his wife and best friend). Four years ago he started to sell fish on the corner of his home in order to support his 4 children who are 15, 16, 19, and 20 years old. Though his home is made of reeds and only has electricity in terms of basic services, he keeps working hard selling fish. His wife and children help him with his work; he works from 8 am to midnight everyday though he now sells in a stall in the Fortin market. With this loan, he will buy more fish for his business. In the future he would like to build a cement home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn A. is from the village of Malobalo, Kitaotao Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Analyn is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling nata de coco (jelly coconut dessert) and orange juice in the local community. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more raw ingredients & additional working capital. This  will be the 2nd loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients & towards working capital.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Y. sells cups of rice and 'gari' (cassava couscous) at Takoradi. She is married and has two children. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a driver.  

Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more bags of rice and 'gari' to be sold in smaller quantities. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to plough what she can back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more bags of rice and 'gari'

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
Carla Patricia Martínez Vaca es una fémina esforzada, luchadora y emprendedora de 24 años quien tiene un pequeño bar y tragamonedas desde hace seis años. Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio para que mejore y en ropa interior para diversificar sus ingresos. 

Martínez sueña con tener su propio local ya que por no contar con este el negocio lo atenido que trasladar de lugar varias veces.
texts.en:
Carla Patricia Martínez Vaca is a hard-working, tenacious, and enterprising 24 year old woman. She has had a small bar and slot machine for six years. She will use the money to improve her business. She will also buy underwear to diversify her income. Martínez dreams of having her own place. Not having her own place means that she has to move her business several times.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drinks and underwear

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam C., 24, is married and lives with his wife and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia – an area known for pre-Angkorean 
temples. He is a carpenter and earns $2 US per day. His wife is a garment factory worker, earning $2 US per day. C. is requesting a loan of $500 US to purchase a motorbike to start another business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Kokou Amen

texts.fr: A. kokou amen, est un jeune célibataire âgé de 26 ans, il habite à zanguéra qui est un quartier au nord ouest de la ville de Lomé. il a commencé en 2007 le commerce de matériaux de construction. il fait ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu'il a appelé" ETS SPERO". il s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. son stock de marchandise est en baisse raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 tuyaux PVC,  26 tuyau orange, 46 robinet, 20 paquets de ciment, 36 fers et divers. c'est avec le revenu de son activité qu'il subvient à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Atifou Kokou Amen is a young single man, 26 years old. He lives in Zanguéra, a district in the Northeast of the city of Lomé. In 2007 he launched a business selling construction supplies. He keeps his own shop named “ETS SPERO.” He stocks up at the big market of Lomé. His stock is being depleted, which is why he is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase five PVC pipes, 26 orange pipes [for propane gas], 46 faucets, 20 packs of cement, 36 soldering irons and other miscellaneous items. It is thanks to the revenue from this business that he is able to support himself.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction supplies

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Milagro se encuentra conformado por Margarita del Carmen Gómez de 38 años, Ana María López López de 35 años y Brígida de la Concepción Mejía V. de 23 años; tres mujeres jóvenes y deseosas de salir adelante.

Margarita, coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de accesorios de uso personal como cosméticos, ropa, zapatos, prendas, perfumes y otros, ella inició hace 6 años vendiendo solamente ropa, luego decidió vender también perfumes y así poco a poco fue introduciendo más productos. Ana María, vende ambulante perfumería y accesorios por catálogos en especial productos de AVON y ZERMAT, el negocio lo inició su mamá pero al no poder dedicarle el tiempo necesario ella se hizo cargo. Por último Brígida, quien es la menor del grupo tiene apenas 1 año de dedicarse a la venta por catálogo de los productos AVON y su deseo es poder ser más autosostenible para poder trabajar también con otras empresas como ZERMAT, ORIFLAME y JAQUELIN CAROL.
texts.en:
The community bank Milagro (Miracle) consists of Margarita del Carmen Gómez, who is 38 years old, Ana María López López, who is 35, and Brígida de la Concepción Mejía V., who is 23. They are three young women who want to advance. Margarita, the coordinator of the group, sells personal accessories such as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, perfumes, and other items. She began this business six years ago, selling only clothing. Then she decided to also sell perfumes, and thus, little by little, she introduced more products. Ana Maria makes door-to-door sales of perfume and other catalog accessories, especially Avon and Zermat products. Her mother began the business, but when she was not able to dedicate the necessary time to it, Ana Maria took over. Finally, Brígida, the youngest of the group, has barely one year of working in catalog sales of Avon products. Her wish is to be more self-supporting and to also work with other businesses such as Zermat, Oriflame, and Jaquelin Carol.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to sell

loans.name: Lenin Antonio

texts.es: El  Sr. Lenin Antonio M. G.    él es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Inspector Ambiental tiene  dos año de trabajar para esta empresa es casado actualmente, tiene 2 niños en Edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Lenin Antonio M. G. works for the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, in the position of Environmental Inspector. He has worked for this organization for two years. He is married and has 2 children of school age. He has had six loans with CEPRODEL, which he has used to buy construction materials to improve the home where he lives. The loans have benefited him greatly, because they have allowed him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sand, stones and cement

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
This is Irenea C., 43, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Juanito C.. They are blessed in their marriage to have good health and healthy physiques, which enables them to provide for themselves and their families.

Irenea operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands (prepared dishes) costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Irenea hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old and single. To make a living, she operates a motorcycle transport service. She also has another line of business. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $467 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 45,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Teresita is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 19th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 47 years old. Erlinda is married and has nine children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector providing motorcycle transport. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled) transport services. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair existing vehicle for better service. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Gioconda De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Gioconda M. M. es trabajadora de la Alcaldia de Chinandega se desempeña como operaria de limpieza publica desde hace 22 años es casada y tiene 06 hijos pero todos estan casados y ninguno depende de ella.
Doña M. M. Solicita credito con ceprodel desde el año 2007 ha obtenido 4 creditos los cuales ha utilizado para reparar su vivienda poco a poco y ha demostrado ser muy punctual con sus obligaciones.
texts.en: Gioconda M. M. is an employee at the Town Hall of Chinandega.  She has been a public building cleaner for 22 years.  She is married and has 6 children, however they are all married and no longer depend on her.  Ms. M. M. has obtained credit through CEPRODEL since 2007.  She has had 4 loans that she has used to improve her home little by little.  She has demonstrated herself to be very punctual with her financial obligations.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe O. W. is 27 years old and married. He and his wife have three children aged between 2 and 6 years old whom they hope to educate to the university level. His business is located in the busy city of Kisumu. He has been selling tea to the local people for four years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is weather conditions since he has to walk to sell the tea. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy tea bags to sell to the local people. He hopes to expand his business and get a permanent premises to operate the tea business which he likes so much. He describes himself as observant.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves

loans.name: Perfecto Wellington

texts.es:
Perfecto Wellington M. M. tiene 53 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y el hijo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene  1 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Perfecto se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 12 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa y terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Perfecto Wellington M. M. is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. He has one son.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Perfecto has worked growing corn, rice and beans in a special way for the past twelve years. He buys his products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of farming supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan support will help him financially to meet his needs. He faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the change in climate. His dream is to buy a house and land.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 40 years old and a father of three.  To earn a living, he sells seedlings.  He has been running the business for four years.  Besides, he runs a bakery.  Through Faulu Kenya he has managed to buy rabbits which earn him extra income.  He dreams of becoming financially stable in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy livestock and seedlings for resale.

loans.use: To buy livestock and seedlings for resale

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is an individual loan client with Esperanza, and he is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza. In his business, he produces and sell Pastel en Hojas (meat or vegetables coated in a blend of mashed plantain, green banana or yuca, wrapped in the leaves of a banana tree and then boiled in water), a traditional plate for the Dominican cuisine. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing beef, chicken, plantains, seasoning, yuca, and other vegetables. 

Rene makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and three children. He has been running his business for about 10 years. He will use the profits to improve his business and to establish it. His story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). He is located in Hato Mayor where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy plantain, seasoning, meats.

loans.name: Naisianta Ene

texts.en:
Naisianta Ene K. is 42 Years old, married and a mother of seven and surports ten other people.She does farming activity on her own piece of land for the last twelve years.

She learnt about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan which she is planning to spend to buy fertilizer and three bags of wheat and maize seeds. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Naisianta dream is do buy a good house and settle her family. She is an assiduous woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and three bags of wheat and maize seeds for planting

loans.name: Eleodoro

texts.es: Eleodoro tiene 62 años, es un hombre casado. La actividad económica es la venta de frijoles y leña. El  dio inicio este negocio por que no tenía un trabajo, y su esposa necesitaba el sustento diario, a pesar de lo difícil que es su situación mantiene la alegría con sus clientes. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y con mucho esfuerzo es que ha logrado salir adelante con su actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de frijoles y leña. A pesar de los difíciles problemas que enfrenta como las cuentas por cobrar. Los sueños de Eleodoro son de proporcionarle a su familia las condiciones de vida necesarias.
texts.en:
Eleodoro is 62 years old and married. He sells beans and firewood. He started this line of work because he didn't have a job and his wife needed support. In spite of the difficulties he is faced with, he always maintains a positive outlook with his customers. 

Eleodoro began this business more than five years ago and with a lot of effort he has been able to move forward with this line of work. He will use the loan he has requested as working capital to purchase beans and wood. 

In spite of the difficulties he faces and the bills he has to pay, Eleodoro dreams of being able to provide his family with the necessities in life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abatoni Group

texts.en:
Belthilde is 36 years old and is married.  Belthilde's business is well-organized and she employs one person in her small shop selling various products. Her business is open from 6am until 10pm. This is her third year of successful business operation. 

Belthilde is the group leader of a loan group called "Abatoni" in the local language. Belthilde is the middle women in the photo. The group includes five members, each one has his/her own business. 

Belthilde and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses so they can offer good service to their customers. This loan will impact the group members by helping them purchase more products to sell, which will allow them to earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas

loans.name: Munhtuya

texts.en:
Munhtuya, 40, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. Her husband works with her while her daughters attend college and the local school.

She began cooking and selling food in 2001. She makes dumplings and sells them with tea to the business operators in the market. Her daily net income is between 50,000 and 60,000 MNT. She wants to expand her business and increase her profit. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, "be positive and your dreams will come true." She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more food for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Насыр кызы Назира родилась в селе Кожоке  (Ош область, Кыргызская Республика). Ей 42 года. Назира с супругом сегодня воспитывают троих замечательных детей. 
Назира родилась в простой семье, где была старшим ребенком и большую часть времени посвящала домашним хлопотам: присматривала за младшими братьями и сестрами, занималась домашней работой и небольшим хозяйством. Назира в детстве мечтала стать детским врачом, но, увы, жизнь заставила ее пойти совсем по иному пути - сегодня она говорит, что ее дочь обязательно станет хорошим врачом. В 18 лет Назиру выдали замуж и по кыргызской традиции, молодожены остались жить в родительском доме, так как муж Назиры был младшим сыном. Муж Назиры честно трудился в колхозе,  а она сама занималась домашней живностью и  к тому времени у них уже было 2 малышей.  К сожалению, земли в 4 сотки, выделенной на каждую семью было недостаточно для посадки и  затраты не покрывались полученным урожаем. В 2001 году, после похорон родителей, Назира с семей переехали в Чуйскую долину, в село Алексеевка. Здесь супруги купили дом с огородом и на остальные средства купили 2 дойных коров.  Средства от сдачи молока и урожая с огорода стали единственным источником пропитания и дохода для семьи Назиры. С тех пор прошло 10 лет, через многие испытания прошла семья, но благодаря упорству и трудолюбию, выбралась из тяжелого состояния. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Назиры  есть 4 бычка на откорме, 1 дойная корова, также семья дополнительно занимается выращиванием лука. 
Назира берет кредит в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки двух бычков и овцематок. Это позволит Назире увеличить поголовье скота и расширить хозяйство. В будущем, Назира с мужем мечтают дать хорошее образование своим детям и  построить большой дом.
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Nazira N. K. was born in the village of Kozhoke (in the Osh area of the Kirghiz Republic). She is 42 years old. Nazira and her spouse are raising three remarkable children. Nazira was born into a simple family in which she was the eldest; therefore, she had many chores: looking after younger brothers and sisters, doing housework, and helping on the farm. As a child, Nazira dreamed of becoming a pediatrician, but, alas, life forced her onto another path.  However, today she says her daughter will absolutely become a doctor.  

When she was eighteen, Nazira got married.  By Kirghiz tradition, newly-married couples live in the parents’ house, and Nazira’s husband was a younger son.  Nazira’s husband worked hard on a collective farm; she worked taking care of the family’s livestock, and by then they already had two children. Unfortunately, the 400-square-meter plot of land allocated to each family was not sufficient to plant enough crops to turn a profit.  

In 2001, after her parents’ funeral, Nazira’s family moved to the Chuysky valley, into the village of Alekseyevka. Here the couple bought a house with a vegetable garden and bought two milk cows. Income from delivering milk and selling vegetables became Nazira’s family’s livelihood.  Ten years have passed since then, and the family has endured many trials, but thanks to persistence and diligence they are no longer in grave financial condition. Today, on their small farm, there are four calves being fattened, one milk cow, and the family is now cultivating onions.   Nazira is taking out a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two calves and some ewes. This will allow Nazira to increase her livestock and to expand the farm. In the future, Nazira and her husband dream of giving their children a good education and building a big house.  


Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 40-year-old married mother of six children ranging in age from eight to adulthood. Only their three youngest live at home with her. Annie didn't have a chance to go to school, and her husband works as a contractor. One of the challenges she faces is balancing her business responsibilities with those involved in being a mother.

For 23 years Annie has been selling food products; she now has a small convenience store that mainly sells food, soft drinks and beer but also several types of candy, soap, shampoo, toothpaste and some cleaning products. Now requesting her second loan with BRAC Liberia, she will use the money to enlarge her store and replace the wooden door with a steel one. In the future, Annie wants to build her own house.

loans.use: to make improvements in her store

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support 3 children. She is married and has a dry goods business in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergencies. Josefina is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Mi Bankito (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mi Bankito está formado por 13 socias quienes son amigas y viven por el mismo sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y muy cordiales como nuestras socias, quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias.

La Señora. Nube L. vive por el sector del Monay, tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 5, 2 de edad, su priM. hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer privado, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Nube es de profesión sastre y trabaja en una fábrica cerca de su casa, allí se dedica  a  confeccionar pantalones, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. En su hogar se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos como a la cría y venta de  pollos y cerdos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 1 año al cual fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos para continuar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios secundarios.

En la fotografía del grupo está una foto pequeña adjunta de la Señora Gloria Susana que por motivos de fuerza mayor tubo que ausentarse y no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mi Bankito (My Little Bank) is made up of 13 members who are friends and live in the same zone of the city of Cuenca. This city is a mix of colonial and modern. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are friendly and cordial like our members who work in various activities that allow them to support their household finances and get their families ahead.

Ms. Nube L. lives in the zone of Monay. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 children who are 8, 5 and 2 years old. Her oldest daughter is studying in one of the city’s schools. Her husband is a chauffeur. Between them they have managed to construct their own home.

Nube is a professional tailor and works in a factory near their house.  There she makes pants. She works from Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. At home she takes care of their children as well as raises and sells chickens and pigs.

Nube has been a member of the communal bank for a year and was invited by a friend. She will invest the money from the loan in buying chickens and pigs to continue this business,

Her goal is to complete her secondary studies. 

In the larger group photo there is a small attached photo of Mrs. Gloria Susana, who, because of extenuating circumstances, could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, beef meat, pork meat, instant soups, bathroom tissue, detergents, beans, juices, soft drinks, and charcoal.

loans.name: Rosalind

texts.en:
Rosalind is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosalind has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, eggs & biscuits. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosalind has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalind hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Winefredo

texts.en:
Winefredo is married with eight children. Winefredo is 59 years old and lives in Lawaan, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Winefredo sells different products in his general store to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, he earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more products such as canned goods, dry goods and anything that is needed in the household.

 Winefredo has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, dry goods and household products to sell

loans.name: Tiessiri 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Tièssiri 1 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et  en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kenikela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, GNASSA GAOUSSSOU, qui la première debout à gauche compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environs par campagne
texts.en:
The ten members of the Tièssiri 1 group are married women who average 42 years of age and have an average of two children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Kenikela, one of the villages in the municipality of Massigui, in the prefecture of Dioïla, which lies in Koulikoro, Mali's second administrative region.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of better organising their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow among other things rice and groundnut. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.

With this new loan, Gnassa Gaousssou, who is standing on the far right, is planning to buy farm inputs, small tools and to pay for labor costs (hoeing) to maintain around one hectar of rice and groudnut.

The produce is sold once harvested in the town of Massigui to a customer base made up of men and women. They are expecting to make an average profit of around 50,000FCFA per season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller, hoeing and small tools

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Mwanaisha has operated a preparatory school for young children. Her potential customers are school-going children from her neighborhood. She dreams of establishing a full primary school for all children in the future.

Mwanaisha plans to use this KES 50,000 loan to renovate her classes and to set up another class to meet the rising of number pupils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her classes and set up another class to meet the rising number of pupils.

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en: Edreda is a 36-year-old married woman with three children living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her major dream is to educate her children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. She sells home utensils and fresh foods for a living and has been in business for four years. Her major constraint now is high transportation prices, which in turn affects the demand power of her customers. Edreda needs the loan to buy home products such as flasks and cup to sell.

loans.use: To buy home products such as flasks and cups to sell.

loans.name: Libia Fanny

texts.es:
Libia de 44 años, trabaja duro en el restaurante de una amiga suya, ella gana un sueldo básico en el cual no le alcanza para hacer mejoras en su casa lo cual es su gran prioridad hasta el momento. Como madre soltera ella lucha diariamente para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos de 17,14 y 8 estudiantes de la escuela fiscal.
Luego de que le den el préstamo que está solicitando ella quiere comprar cemento, arena, hierro para construir su casa. Sus deseos como toda madre es la comodidad y bienestar para su familia, esperando que sus 3 hijos terminen con éxitos su educación.
texts.en:
Libia is 44 years old and works at a restaurant of a friend. She earns a base salary, so she cannot afford to make improvements to her home, which is a high priority at the moment. Libia is a single mother who strives each day to help her three children (ages 17, 14, and 8) get ahead. They are students at a public school.

Libia requested this loan because she wants to buy cement, sand, and iron to build her house. Her dreams as a mother include providing for the comforts and welfare of her family. She hopes that her three children finish their education successfully.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and iron for building her house.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 45 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. He is married with one child.

To earn a living, James has a business selling items such as rice, corn, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, vegetable oil, toyo (soy sauce), cigarettes etc. He earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. James has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase stocks for his grocery store. James has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, James would like to have a big grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his grocery store

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 25-year-old married man and father of one child. He owns a small restaurant in Metn, where he serves delicious chicken sandwiches.

Adham is a hard worker. Planning to make his own career, he started this business three years ago, after he stopped working at a fish shop. He improved his restaurant over the past three years. Adham loves his business a lot, and he puts effort into expanding it.

Adham requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new machines needed for his business, such as a chicken broasting machine. He would also like to increase his restaurant's merchandise with extra mayonnaise, ketchup, pickles, and other things that can be kept for a long time and saved in big quantities.

Adham hopes to expand his business by opening a new branch in the future.

loans.use: to improve his restaurant by increasing his machines and merchandise.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, age 56, earns her living by making and selling bread. She earns about PhP 1,000 each month through her business. She and her husband have one child and live in Calunsan, Larena, Siquijor.

Edna has requested a loan amounting to PhP 8,000 in order to purchase ingredients for breadmaking.
 
Edna has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Edna would like expand her small business. Her goal is to ensure that her child receives a complete education.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for breadmaking

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with three children. 

Mary Grace has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages, and has been in business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

Mary Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sofronio Jr.

texts.en: Sofronio is from the village of Sta. Filomena. He is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Sofronio Jr. owns and operates a coffee farm. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for his coffee farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his coffee farm

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 31ans. Elle est mariée à un maintenancier et à un enfant de 7 ans scolarisé.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète et revend des cartes de recharge pour téléphone portable à toutes personnes dans une boutique. 
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge destinée à la vente. Elle pense avec les profits supplémentaires de son activité, diversifier sa marchandise.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait élargir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a maintenance staff person and has a 7-year-old child attending school.

Afi has been working as a retailer since 2007. She buys and sells recharge cards for mobile phones to all-comers in a shop.

Afi has requested her first WAGES credit loan to purchase recharge cards for resale. With the extra profits generated from her business activity, she is thinking of diversifying her product offerings.

In coming years, Afi wants to expand her business. She said that with the profits she intends to contribute to the food requirements of her family.

loans.use: Buy mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch, 41 years old, and her husband, Launh, 39 years old, live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have two children -a son and a daughter. One is a garment worker and the other attends school. 

Toch and her husband are rice and lotus farmers. Toch is asking for a loan of $500 in order to buy seeds and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Раъно занимается торговлей на рынке, где в основном продает лепешки. Этим видом деятельности она занимается восемь лет. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. Кредит берет для приобретения муки, масла и молока для последующей выпечки национального вида хлеба (кульча). Кроме того она берет кредит для покупки лепешки.
texts.en: Rano is involved in sales at a market and primarily sells flatbread.  She has been involved in this business for eight years.  Rano is 40 yeas old and married.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour, oil and milk for the next baking of the national bread variety (kulcha).  Besides, she is requesting the loan for the purchase of flatbread.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil and milk, and flatbread

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with three children. She is 40 years old and presently lives in Sto. Nino, Pagadian City.

She sells dry goods products to earn a living and has had the business for two years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase clothing supplies to expand her business.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to be successful due to her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing supplies to expand her business.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Normelita has a meat shop that sells pork by the kilogram. She has had this business for 14 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of pork to sell.

Normelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of pork to sell.

loans.name: Ro

texts.en: Ro, 53, is widowed and resides with her son in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a fish vendor. Her son is employed at the factory. Since the factory is far away from home, Ro is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her business and purchase a small store in the market to sell fish and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.name: Andréa

texts.fr: Andréa est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un certain Adrien. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Andréa et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Andréa vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Andréa mène comme activité depuis vingt ans environs, la vente de tubercules d'ignames dans son quartier. Andréa s’approvisionne au nord du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son chiffre d’affaire, Andréa sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Andréa is 47 years old and married to a man named Adrien. They have six children, all in school. Two of the children are dependents. Andréa and her husband jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. She lives together with her husband and children. 

To meet her needs and those of her family, Andréa has had a business selling yam tubers for about twenty years in her district. Her supplies come from northern Benin. 

With the goal of boosting her business and increasing her customer base and her sale, Andréa is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a fourth time. The loans previously received have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy yam tubers

loans.name: Arjielyn

texts.en:
Arjielyn is 34 years old and lives in San VIcente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. 

Arjelyn has a motorcycle rental business with two motorbikes, and earns approximately PHP 5,250 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase equipment for her motorcycle transport business. 

Arjielyn has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Arjielyn hopes to buy a brand new car and to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Swzan

texts.en: Swzan is a 43 year old married woman who has 6 family members from Al Zraqa Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JD to pay for her home improvements, She wants to buy an air conditioner. She hopes to provide for her family a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget O. is 30 years old and a 4 years old dedicated LAPO client. She specializes on sales of clothes and tailoring materials to people in her environment.  She needs the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with three children. She lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Mariam sells “khanga”, a type of cloth worn by women that is fitted around the waist. The cloth is very famous as casual wear in Tanzania. The cloth can be seen on Mariam in her photograph.
Mariam sells these khanga to her customers on credit and they repay on a monthly basis. This situation prompted her to get enough working capital to make her business continuous so she can add stock on time without waiting for the customers to repay their debts. Mariam is in need of USD 400 to facilitate her business.

loans.use: Increase her stock of khanga.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the thirty women of the Deggo de Nder association, led by Ndeye S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Objectives: To make it possible for the women to remain on their land by giving them the chance to earn substantial income in order to meet their basic living needs. Activities: Harvesting and sale of local incense [note: this incense is made from the roots of the grass that grows in the Senegal River and is popular in markets throughout Senegal], in addition to small-scale retail sale of local products. [The incense-selling business] will consist of harvesting the incense roots where they grow and then processing them into incense which will be sold in the local market and in the other markets of Senegal.”

Original French business description:

«Objectifs :

- Fixer les femmes dans leur terroir

- Leurs permettrent d’avoir des revenus substantiels pour la prise en charge de leurs besoins prioritaires ;

Activités :

Exploitation de l’encens au niveau local

Petit commerce

Il s’agit de chercher la matière première sur place et ensuite le traiter avant de le vendre dans le marché local comme dans les autres localité du Pays.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Homemade incense production - harvesting expenses, storage jars, and transportation to market

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat is married and has 3 children.  She has been selling modern women dresses for 5 years. Her husband is her business partner and he is responsible for trips to the wholesale market. Her daughter and her son help her to arrange goods in her trade place. Salomat’s business place is located in open-air market, in the 32nd district in Khujand. Salomat became a client of Micro Invest in 2001.  Her first loan was 50USD.  She spent her loan buying goods such as socks, men's underwear, and women’s headscarves.  Gradually she increased the turnover of her working capital and noticed the high demand for women's dresses. Today she sells women garments and is happy with her choice.  
The government is planning to build a big supermarket where the open-air market now stands.  Salomat wishes to rent one shop from there for her business. She is requesting 700USD for it.

loans.use: Renting  premises for shop.

loans.name: Fadai

texts.en: Fadai A. lives in Gahramanli Village. It is a small city in the Beylagan Region, which sits in southwest Azerbaijan. He is married and has 3 children. His business is cattle-breeding. Fadai established his business 10 years ago. He borrowed 3 loans from the Normicro Beylagan Branch and paid back those loans on time. He now needs $400 in an additionaly loan to buy a calf.

loans.use: To Buy a Calf

loans.name: Rachide

texts.fr:
Mr. Rachide A. was born on November 19, 1981 in Lomé, Togo and presently resides in Agoè. He is a bachelor and has no children. He went to primary school in Sokodé. Then he went into an apprenticeship which terminated with his becoming a master mechanic. He now has his own workshop that he manages rigorously. He is looking for funding to better equip his workshop, and it is for that purpose that he is asking for a loan of US$ 400.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Rachide, est né le 19 Novembre 1981 à Lomé, réside à Agoè. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il a fait ses études primaires à Sokodé. Après, il s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage au bout duquel il devient maître mécanicien. Il tient aujourd’hui son propre atelier qu’il gère avec rigueur. Il recherche les moyens pour équiper son atelier. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $400.

loans.use:
outfit his workshop

Equiper son atelier

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is a young entrepreneur of 29 who opened her first business just this year. She runs a Duka la Dawa (pharmacy, in Swahili) and requires a loan of $275 in order to increase both the quantity and range of her stock. She is determined to expand her business amidst the hustle and bustle of Kibaha Kwa Matias, a busy town on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and range of products at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Chariyas

texts.en:
Mrs. Chariyas E., 26, and her husband, Mr. Saren Srey, 27, have been married since 2002. They have two sons, both of whom are still young and are at home. She and her family live along National Road Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Chariyas sells grocery items in front of her house, which she has been doing since early 2007. Her husband is a driver for a company in Phnom Penh. He travels from home to work by motor taxi.

Chariyas is requesting this, her first loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $600. She will use this money to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travE. to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To buy one motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Mrs. Julienne K. is very dynamic and courteous, a favorite with her friends and customers. She is also very strict in the management of her business. Presently requesting her third loan, she has always made regular, punctual repayments. Born on January 28, 1959 in Cotonou, she is a widow and is raising three children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame K. Julienne est très dynamique et très courtoise. Elle est très appréciée de son entourage et de sa clientèle. Elle est aussi très rigoureuse dans la conduite de son affaire. A son troisième crédit, elle est toujours régulière et ponctuelle aux remboursements. Née le28/01/1959 à Cotonou, elle est veuve avec 3 enfants à sa charge.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 bolts of African print cloth

Achat de 10 pièces de pagnes

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata is 48 years old married with 5 children. 2 of her children are under 18 years old. She is a subsistence farmer in the village of Sulemania, in the Koinadugu district.

She grows vegetables throughout the year. She has a water well in the middle of the farm where she gets water for watering the vegetables. She grows cabbages, green leafy lettuce, onions, tomatoes and hot peppers. With her previous loan from SMT, she began growing irish potatoes and paid back her loan from other farming produce. Isata also grows pigeon peas and some rice. With all the farm activities, she needs to work hard from sun rise to sun set.

She thinks that, if she can access a loan of $1200, she could hire laborers and purchase fertilizer and more vegetable seeds to increase her production for better profits.

loans.use: Isata has an opportunity to grow her farming operation and needs to hire laborers to help her run it.  A loan from Kiva would greatly help her in this endeavor.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María H. is married to Francisco de la Isla Márquez, an independent mason, and they have 4 children ages 10, 11, 15 and 16 years old. 3 years ago Rosa began her business due to the lack of money as her husband’s job does not provide a steady income. She began her business when she realized that around her house there was not a candy store and there were many children. So she decided to start a business herself with only a table and a few candies, putting the table outside of her home because many children passed by on their way to school.

Now she needs a loan for US$250 which will be repaid in 6 months, to purchase merchandise such as drinks and frozen products in addition to increasing the variety of candy.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa María H. esta casada con Francisco de la Isla Márquez quien es albañil, y trabaja de manera independiente, ellos tienen 4 hijos de 10, 11, 15 y 16 años, hace 3 años Rosa inicio el negocio debido a la falta de dinero ya que el trabajo de su marido no los provee de un sueldo seguro, ella empezó su negocio cuando se dio cuenta que por su casa no hay dulcerías y hay muchos niños, así que decidió emprender un negocio inicio solo con una mesa y pocos dulces, la mesa la coloco afuera de su casa porque por ahí pasan muchos niños que van a la escuela.

Ahora requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía como bebidas y productos congelados además de incrementar la variedad de dulces.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mwaka's Mtegemee Mola Group

texts.en:
Mwaka, age 45, is a single mother with four children (ages 18, 16, 20, and 23). Ten years ago, Mwaka began a business selling charcoal and coconuts. She works daily from 8am to 3pm at her business where she is able to make a monthly profit of about $85.

Mwaka hopes for a loan to purchase more charcoal and coconuts. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members belong to group Mtegemee Mola. These members guarantee one another to pay back loans.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khulkaroi

texts.en: A. Khulkaroi was born in 1967 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in the high-mountain region where livestock is important. She is engaged in the livestock business, as are many her fellow villagers. Mrs. A. Khulkaroi raises and sells livestock. It is the family business. She is also a school teacher. She has 10 years of experience in livestock so she has appropriate skills and knowledge that she uses in practice. Now, Mrs. A. Khulkaroi applies to KIVA with the request of a business development loan for 8 months to purchase special milk-making equipment to start milk production and selling. Mrs. A. Khulkaroi thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA gives to entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase special milk-making equipment

loans.name: Block C Nime A 2037-6 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mania Palista. Currently, she sells local brew at home and is requesting a loan to buy livestock. Mania is 40 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children, ranging from age 7 to 20, all of whom go to school. Each week, Mania makes approximately 80 Sudanese pounds in profit and, with the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to start a livestock business.

Mania is joined in her small group by Agnes J., Mary P., and Anjuka A.. Agnes sells vegetables at the market and wants to buy charcoal to sell. Mary sells bread and paste at the market and wants a loan to open up restaurant. Anjuka sells groundnut at the market and wants to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy livestock and other items to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a single woman who began selling clothes in 2002. Every day, she works extremely hard from 11 am to 5 pm at her business.

Naomi now requests a loan in order to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. sells foodstuffs like tubers of yam, plantain, garri, and cocoa yam. She also makes and sells beads. She learned how to make beads from her mother. Mary is 30 years old and married with a child. She is a client of LAPO. She needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more foodstuffs for sale and bead materials for her to make more beads. This, she says, will enable her satisfy her numerous customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and bead making  materials

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 son independientes y de familia, quedando los dos últimos a su cargo, los mismos que son la razón para seguir adelante y prosperar en todo, ella desea poder lograr que sus hijos, más adelante, sean profesionales y  así sentirse una mamá orgullosa. En la actualidad, Luz se dedica la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, así como también vende comida y brinda pensión a los trabajadores de un aserradero frente a su casa, actividades que le permiten vivir tranquilamente, pero ella quiere que en el futuro su negocio sea más grande, su esposo Artemio que trabaja como chofer de máquinas pesadas, siempre la apoya en todo y juntos se anima para seguir adelante.Luz quiere implementar su negocio, es por eso que requiere de un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Luz is 44 years old and is the mother 5 children, 3 of whom are independent and have their own families. This leaves her with the 2 lasts ones in her care, which is her reason for seeking to get ahead and prosper in everything. She wants to be able to achieve that her children in the future are professionals and in this way she will feel like a proud mother. At the present time, Luz works selling groceries and household products as well as food and she provides lunch to the laborers of a sawmill in front of her house. These activities allow her to live tranquilly, but she wants her business to be bigger in the future. Her husband Artemio works as a driver of heavy machinery. He always supports her in everything and together they are motivated to advance in life. Luz wants to start her business, which is why she requires a loan that will allow her to meet her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for the improvement of her business: her small store and food sales.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
Nohemí estudio cultora D. belleza y en su casa se dedica a cortar el pelo hacer faciales y algunos servicios D. belleza, las clientes le pedían que le recomendara cremas o cosas para su arreglo personal fue por eso que ella decidió vender por catalogo productos D. belleza, ya que no contaba con el dinero suficiente para establecer una estética, ya tiene 3 años en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas mercancía y tener que ofrecerle a sus clientas mas variedad, con las ganancias espera poder establecer su estética en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Nohemí studies cosmetology and runs a styling and beauty services business out of her home. Her clients ask her to reccomend cremes and other products to use themselves. As a result she decided to do catalog sales of beauty products, since she does not have enough capital to establish a salon. The business has done very well over the past three years. She needs a loan of $400 that she will repay in six months, so that she can purchase more merchandise and be able to offer her clients more variety. With the income she hopes to be able to establish a salon in the near future.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purhcase merchandise

loans.name: Morris 1- Getrude Group

texts.en:
Getrude N., a 40-year-old female Ugandan, is married with 3 children aged 18 to 8 years. On acquiring some snack-making skills from a friend, Getrude was supported by her husband to start the business of frying cookies, doughnuts, and crackers and selling them to schools, offices and shops in her locality.

Her five-year-old business is mostly affected by the persistent inflation rate in the country, which affects the prices of major ingredients required for her snacks. This makes it difficult for her to compete with those who purchase the ingredients in bulk who are therefor not so affected by the price rises. Getrude is using the loan to purchase enough cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar.

Besides being social and welcoming, she attracts her customers by ensuring that her working area is clean. She hopes to extend her services to catering for functions like conferences and weddings, and also help her husband in setting up their residence. On good days, Getrude makes a profit of 15,000 UGX. It is from these profits that she affords to pay for her semi-permanent stall at the rate of 50,000 UGX per month.

loans.use: Purchase enough cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị K.  năm nay 32 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Đến năm 2002 gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để đấu thầu ao của hợp tác xã và chăn nuôi theo mô hình trang trại. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi 400 con vịt đẻ, 2 đàn lợn nái và 1 ao cá cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để  mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị K., 32 years old, has two children who attend school. She became a member of the TYM Fund in 1996, borrowing money to invest in raising pigs. In 2002, she and her family used a loan to run a model fish farm in a pond belonging to the local co-operative. Today, her family has 400 laying ducks, two groups of sows, and one fish pond, which together provide an income of about 3,000,000 VND (180 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (600 USD) to buy feed for her animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs, ducks, and fish.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. is a single mother with five dependents. She has completed up to senior high school. Veronica sells fish. She buys fish directly from the fishermen, processes and preserves them, and than sends them to the market at Liverpool Street in Elmina to sell.  She has done this since 2005. Veronica uses her income to pay for her family's financial needs and the children's school fees. Veronica will use the loan to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the increased profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to reinvest in the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: Veronica will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has owned a small charcoal store and has been a coconuts seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 20 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business in order to improve her home and pay the school fees of her children.

Mwajuma is 44 years old, married, and has 5 children, ages 27, 24, 16, 12, and 6.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and coconuts in order to expand her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther S. is in the business of selling charcaol, sugar and soap and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Esther is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a nurse. She has 1 child and her child do not go to school.  With the extra profits earned from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her food selling business

loans.name: Volimata

texts.fr: Mme Volimata S. est une femme qui fait de l’embauche ovule depuis 10 ans. Elle  a une grande expérience de ce travail. Elle achète des moutons au marché hebdomadaire de Touba-Toul pour les revendre durant les fêtes de Tabaski. Avec ce crédit elle veut renforcer son activité dont les revenues vont servir à payer la scolarité de sa petite fille qui est en classe de terminale.
texts.en:
Ms. Volimata S. is a woman who has been working for ten years fattening sheep . She has a lot of experience in this trade. She buys sheep at the weekly market in Touba-Toul in order to resell them during the Tabaski holidays. With this loan, she wants to bolster her business. The profits from it will be used to pay the schooling costs for her granddaughter, who is in the 12th grade.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith R. Pérez y  Juan Gilberto Martínez es un matrimonio muy joven que obtuvo una vivienda  por medio del gobierno esta es de  interés social. Al obtener esta casa fue pensando en el patrimonio de su único hijo el cual tiene 1 año de edad. La joven ya ha tenido crédito aquí en esta institución por lo que pago muy bien este préstamo por lo que utilizo para poder adquirir la casa que ya tiene. Ahora su mayor prioridad es poner protecciones  en las ventanas para dar más seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Edith R. P. and Juan Gilberto Martinez, who have been recently married, purchased their home through a government social program. They have continued to focus their attention on the well-being of their one-year old child. They have established credit with this institution because they promptly paid back the loan they received to purchase the house. Now their primary objective is to place protective barriers on the windows to provide greater security for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase protective barriers

loans.name: Tuuituka (C) Group

texts.en:
M. is a 65-year-old married man. He has 10 children, ranging from 4 to 32. The oldest child is now a boda boda driver (a motorcycle used for public transport) and the youngest is still in the local government schools. M. also cares for his late brother's five children.

M. has been in the business of buying produce and re-selling it for 40 years. He says that people prefer his stand because he is trustworthy and dependable. He says that he has been around for a long time so people know him.

This loan cycle M. is requesting a loan of 2.5 million USH. With this amount Mukiiki will be able to buy a large amount of produce. He is also thinking of starting a new business, but he is not sure which one yet. M. hopes that in the future he will see all of his children finish school and be successful in their jobs!

loans.use: to buy a large stock of vegetables

loans.name: Noor Sabra Ghulam Murtaza Group

texts.en:
Noor Sabra baji is the wife of G. M. and lives in Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Noor baji is a very devoted lady. She always motivates her husband to go ahead no matter what the circumstances. Her motivation gives power to him and he has started a clothes selling business. From this business, they are able to send their two children, a daughter and a son, to school. Noor baji is very happy with his efforts. Noor baji also operates a sewing business to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to increase the profit of her husband.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Saeeda baji is requesting a loan to buy wood to sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy sugarcane for her juice corner. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es: Claribel M. tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica a es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio por la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio, ya que no tenía mucho dinero para iniciar por lo que decide establecer una relación entre Fundación León 2000 y ella, y es através de los financiamientos que logra salir adelante por que con el primer financiamiento compro cosméticos y ropa interior. Y esto fue lo que la impulso a seguir. El dinero solicitado es para su capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa interior, calzado, pantalones, faldas y camisetas. El sueño de Claribel es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Claribel M. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She makes a living selling general merchandise. She has been doing this for the last 15 years. She started it because she wanted to launch her own business. Since she did not have much money to begin the business, she established a relationship with Fundacion Leon 2000. Through the loans that she received, she has been able to get ahead. With the proceeds of the first loan she purchased cosmetics and underwear. This gave her the desire to continue. The current loan will finance the purchase of underwear, shoes, pants, skirts and shirts. Claribel's dream is to improve the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy querida en su familia, vive en la casa que construyó con mucho esfuerzo y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.
