La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella es una vendedora muy alegre y convincente y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. Olga trae la ropa desde las ciudades de Tacna y Desaguadero (frontera con Bolivia) y siempre se preocupa por traer las prendas que están de moda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta e informarse sobre las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar la ropa por autobús, ya que las largas distancias le resultan muy casadas, aun así sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo por salir adelante. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una gran tienda de ropa, donde pueda vender con más comodidad su mercadería. Este es el primer préstamo de Olga con MFP, está dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días un poco para poder pagar su crédI. por completo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Olga, 46, is a very beloved woman in her family. She lives in the house it took her great effort to construct. Her greatest wish is to improve her quality of life. She sells clothes from her stand in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She is a happy and convincing sales person, and she always greets her customers with a smile on her face. Olga brings the clothes from the cities of Tacna and Desaguadero (on the Bolivian border), and she always takes care to bring clothes that are in style. What she likes most about her work is talking with her neighboring sales women and finding out about what is happening in the market. She has been in this business for 20 years. The hardest part is transporting the clothes by bus. Traveling long distances is very tiring. Even so, she knows that she needs to use all of her strength to get ahead. In the near future she would like to have a big clothing store where she could sell her merchandise more comfortably. This is Olga’s first loan with MFP. She is prepared to save a little every day in order to be able to completely repay her loan. In her community bank she is very responsible, and she is always up to date with the agreements between members. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to buy clothes to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus E., 37, is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin and a mother of 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Venus owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish to her established customers in the local community. She is also into selling "Ready to Wear" clothing of GTY. Venus has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns ~3,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Venus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase dried fish to sell. Venus is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP as additional capital for her businesses. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Sonia tiene la edad de 34 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace cuatro años administra, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio en la venta de tortilla y destace de cerdo. Reside en el barrio Máximo Jerez  y tiene un hijo de 6 meses. Este negocio lo iniciaron con  la liquidación de su trabajo ya que ambos trabajaban en zona franca. Con este crédito es su cuarto ciclo el cual invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, productos lácteos, carnes entre otros productos. Sus planes es poder seguir invirtiendo en su pulpería y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Sonia is 34 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Máximo Jérez. She is married and the mother of a son of 6 months.

She has been running a convenience store for four years. Her husband helps her in her business by selling tortillas and pork. They started this business with their redundancy pay when both their jobs in the duty-free zone were shed.

This is Sonia's fourth loan. She will use it to buy basic grains, dairy products, meat and other items. She hopes to be able to continue investing in her store and increasing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, dairy products and meat

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Doña aida S. es una mujer que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa y cosméticos para ayudar primeramente a su padres y cuando se caso a su esposo para solventar los gastos de su familia, tiene 54 años de edad, reside en el barrio Carlos Fonseca de la Farmacia Solmar. Procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales todos están casados, con Afodenic lleva cuatro ciclos trabajando y ha hecho de gran oportunidad para seguir ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes, como la captación de clientes nuevos, vende al contado y al crédito de quincena. Con este crédito invertirá en variados cosméticos y perfumenes de los cuales espera obtener mejores ganancias, de los productos que venden son buenos ya que son de la Zermath conocidos por los clientes y a buen precio. Da las gracias a la institución por beneficios alcanzados no solo para su negocio si no para su familia.
texts.en:
Aida S. has worked selling clothes and cosmetics since she was a young girl. She did this primarily to help her parents. When she got married, she worked to help her husband with the household expenses. She is 54, and she lives in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood of the Solmar Pharmacy. She has four married children. She has been working with Afondenic for four loan cycles. This has been a great opportunity to keep offering her products to her customers and to get new customers. She sells for cash and credit for two weeks. She will use this loan to buy various cosmetics and perfumes, which she expects to give her greater earnings. The products she sells are good because they are from Zermath, which is well known to her customers and at a good price. She is grateful to the institution for the benefits gained not only by her business but also for her family

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 28 year old newly married man. He operates a kitchenware business in the Muthurwa Market of Nairobi. He has requested a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to add inventory of thermos, stoves and other products. He plans to own a supermarket and desires to build a home for his family and educate his children. He describes himself as jovial and social.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add inventory

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra D. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère 4 enfants. Elle réside à Amoussoukope. Son activité consiste à acheter du maïs dans les villages environnants et de venir les revendre au marché. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit faire des stocks afin d’éviter des ruptures de stocks et aussi accroître la capacité de son commerce. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abra D. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère 4 enfants. Elle réside à Amoussoukope. Son activité consiste à acheter du maïs dans les villages environnants et de venir les revendre au marché. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit faire des stocks afin d’éviter des ruptures de stocks et aussi accroître la capacité de son commerce. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de maïs pour stockage et revente

loans.name: Herika Liset

texts.es: Kerika Liset R. A. tiene 29 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de sastrería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que con la ayuda del tiempo obtuvo la experiencia necesaria por lo que anteriormente trabajaba en una zona franca, lo que le ha ayudo a obtener la respectiva velocidad en la elaboración de cada uno de los trajes que elaboraba, pero no recibía un salario justo y llegaba muy cansada a su casa para hacerse cargo de sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo, por lo que decide comenzar su propio negocio en su humilde vivienda y con el poco dinero que obtuvo empezó a realizar sus confecciones, actualmente Kerika tiene muchos clientes. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. En un futuro le gustaría obtener su propio taller para emplear a personas que son como ellas.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Noadik

texts.en:
Noadik V. is currently sells local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials like charcoal, yeast, etc. Noadik is 32 years old and is married to a peasant. She has six children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase brewing materials like charcoal and yeast

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther P. is from the village of Dimalco, Bonifacio Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Esther is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products and soft drinks in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esther is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Esther from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: N. Marguerite est née en 1959 et est mariée à HINKATI Antoine, un agent de sécurité. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et réside depuis 22 ans au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marguerite vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les charges de la famille sont supportées ensemble par les deux conjoints. Marguerite n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a dix ans de cela que Marguerite mène comme activité la vente de glacières dans son quartier et aussi de nourriture (riz et haricot) au Collège Père Aupiais de Cotonou. Marguerite s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Marguerite voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et satisfaire davantage sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Marguerite sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
N. Marguerite was born in 1959 and is married to HINKATI Antoine, a security guard. The couple has four children who are all in school. They have resided in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for 22 years. Marguerite lives together with her children and husband. The couple supports the family jointly. Marguerite never went to school. For ten years, she has been running a business selling insulated containers in her district and also food (rice and beans) at a middle school called Père Aupiais de Cotonou. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. She would like to expand her business and to satisfy her customer more. This is why she’s requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coolers and sacks of rice and beans

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.es:
Adelfa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años, 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Adelfa, nos cuenta que ya lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio, pero para implementarse y aumentar mas su negocio, decidió sacar un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00.
Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa y también recorre por los diferentes lugares, en una carretilla, herramienta principal, para su trabajo. Sus clientes ya la conocen y saben del trabajo que realiza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00, comprará 500 cocos, en sacos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá, comprando cuchillos y envases, para depositar sus cocos.

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Adelfa belongs to the "Las Nazarenas" Community Bank in the Bellavista District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, San Martín Department. She lives with her partner, is 38 years old, and has one child who she still cares for. Adelfa has been selling fruit juice for many years already but in order to grow her business she decided to take out a loan for 1,300 nuevos soles. Her business is located at her own home and she also takes it to different places on a cart, her main work tool. Her customers know her already and know the work she does. With this loan of 1,300 nuevos soles, she will buy 500 coconuts. She will also invest part of the money in buying knives and containers to put her coconuts in. Today she feels like a very accomplished woman, with more hopes to achieve her dreams and make them reality. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start her business and for helping other woman that want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of coconuts

loans.name: Nora Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Nora es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Nora nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y comprar una oveja y un chancho.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Nora, 27, has been a member of the "Gregoria Apaza" communal bank in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department, for 4 years now. She is married and has two children. She finished secondary school and she raises cattle. Nora tells us that she used her first Manuela Ramos Movement, 300 new sol, loan to buy a sheep and a pig. She now needs 1500 new soles to buy a cow. Her dream for the future is to have her own home in Ilave and that her children become professionals. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings and the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Raquel de los Ángeles L. M. aprendió el oficio de la mueblería con su padre quien le heredo el taller en 2001. Desde entonces ella se ha encargado de expandir el negocio con el apoyo que le da su tío quien es su consejero y guía.  

Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como madera, fornica, pega, pintura, clavos, tapizado etc.
texts.en:
Raquel de los Ángeles learned furniture making from her father. She inherited his shop in 2001. Since then she has taken to increase the business with the support of her uncle who is her adviser and her guide.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of material such as wood, formica, glue, paint, nails, upholstery fabric, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood, nails and glue

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Mrs. Math M. is 27 years of age and currently resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is a local vendor, selling both used and new clothing. She has been operating this business since early 2007 and is able to earn about $4 each day. She is assisted by her husband in selling the clothes. This couple has been married for years and is blessed with two school-aged kids. 

Math has been very busy at her business.  There are buyers who need to buy her clothes, but she doesn't have enough clothing to sell to them. Therefore, she looks for a loan to put additional clothing into her inventory. Math was busy selling clothes when the photo was taken, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To put additional clothing into her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fruit

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: Arminda cuenta con 62 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos pero ambos son independientes; ella vive en anticrético. Arminda se dedica a la venta de fiambres,  embutidos y abarrotes. Se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo atrás. Su negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado central, donde hay una gran afluencia de personas. El nivel de competencia es alto, ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a esta actividad,  pero la demanda que existe por estos productos es alta también. El destino del crédito es para capital de operaciones, compra de mercadería por las fiestas de carnaval. Es el tercer crédito al que accede Arminda en nuestra institución, presentó un comportamiento bueno en las anteriores operaciones. No presenta antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Arminda is 62 years old. She is single. She has two children, but they are both independent. She lives in anticretico (a type of renting). Arminda is sells lunch meats, sausages, and other groceries. She has been doing this work for a very long time. Her business is located inside the central market, where there are many people. The level of competition is his as various people are involved in this activity, but the demand for these products is also high. The destination for the loan is capital for operations; to purchase merchandise for the celebration of Carnaval. This is the third loan that Arminda has accessed from our institution. She comported herself well in the previous operations. She does not have a negative background in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital for operation

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a school teacher from Qalqilia. One of his sons works as a tailor while the other three sons and a daughter are still college students. Talal used the first loan he took from FATEN to pay his sons' and daughter's college tuition fees and he is now taking the second one for the same purpose. 

Talal hopes that he will be able to help his sons and daughter receive their degrees and find good jobs since they are brilliant students and deserve a good chance. He is hoping that they will help him bear life's expenses soon.

The picture above of Talal was taken at FATEN's office.

loans.use: Pay college tuition fees

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn T. is from Mahayag Zamboangan del Sur. She is 32 years old and married with three children. To make living, she manages her business, which is a sari-sari (variety retail) store. Her husband is a farmer and supports their daily basic needs. She has managed her business for more than two years, and she and her husband earn approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

She successfully repaid her previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. As of now, she has a new loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC and this loan is intended for her to use as additional capital. Merlyn is on her third cycle of obtaining loans from PMPC.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena P. is from the village of Macanhan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Nena owns and operates a specialized retail business, peddling health and medicinal products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Nena plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: La Sra. Emelinda es propietaria D. un vehiculo marca Toyota  cual lo hace  trabajar en la línea del nuevo palmar (Taxi trufi)  a patir D. las 15:00 D. la tarD. hasta las 10:30  todos los días, además la señora se dedica a trabajar como empleada domestica, su esposo es el señor Ciro el trabaja D. empleado en la zona franca  tienen 3 hijos y actualmentemente uno bajo su cargo que tiene 17 años este año sale bachiller, los otros hijos ya son independientes, comenta ella que su gran esfuerzo que le dedica es para volver a comprar otro  vagoneta y poder hacerla trabajar y asi poder tener un ingreso mas ya que su hijo pronto entrara a la universidad y necesitara dinero para sus estudios, es muy trabajadora cuando no viene su chofer ella se dedica a manejar su auto, con el dinero del credito realizara el mantenimiento a su vehiculo para que este no presente fallas al momento D. trabajar esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ermelinda owns a Toyota car she rents out to a driver working for the Taxi Trufi Nuovo Palmar route (T.RU.FI – Taxi con Ruta Fija) from 3 pm to 10.30 pm every day; moreover, she works as a maid. Her husband, Ciro, is a clerck in the duty-free zone. They have 3 children and one in foster care who is 17 years old and will graduate from high school this year; she says she is working hard to be able to buy another vehicle to rent out, in order to get another income as her son will shortly begin university and she will need money for his education. She is a very hard-working woman, she even drives her car when her driver cannot come to work. She will use the loan she is requesting to keep her car in good conditions so that it will not break down while being used at work. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain and repair her vehicle

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita O. is from the village of Kiorob, Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 52 years old, married, and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Esterlita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer B. is single. She has been through junior high school. Jennifer sells clothes by going from one house to another in Takoradi. She has been selling clothes for about a year now. Jennifer uses her income to pay her rent and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase to more clothes for resale. Jennifer plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey N., 56, who lives in Srae Kaes village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns 2.50-hectares of land upon which she cultivates rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Srey N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Phan Nol, shown with her in the photo, is an electronics repairman (video player, radio, television, etc) earning a small income to support his family. This couple has two children, both students, who also support their mother's farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Bikuweraki Womens Group-Jinja

texts.en:
Fortune finally knocked at her door 6 years ago when she finally took root in her retail franchise that she operates from home. Prior to that, 45-year-old M. Nulu was eking out a relatively low-level living with profits from her modest salon business. The tough experience mill she was brought to terms with whilst still running her salon business was enough to help her dispense with the naiveté of operating a business. The only reliable stock in trade she had to employ in her new business was a strong resolve to succeed and a focused, clear, and sustainable plan of action. These attributes have been her mileage in an invariably competitive retail business field. 

Her shop has an array of goods on display ranging from bags of sugar, bars of soap, and rice. In the course of time, Nulu has come to the realization that never losing sight of one’s objectives principally in operating a business is of paramount importance if one is to achieve short-term and long-term success. 

Though her business doesn’t bring in hefty profits going by the 20,000 shillings she reckons she makes in a week, she is upbeat that her prospects will only get better as long as she can continue biding her time patiently. She is high on conviction that with this loan, she will be able to buy more retail items for her shop. She is looking at buying more bags of sugar, salt, rice and bars of soap, as these are highly demanded items in her locality. She figures she will be able to earn more revenue as a result of the restocking of her shop.

loans.use: The purchase of retail items like bags of sugar,salt and rice

loans.name: Petra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petra de 59 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene una tienda de víveres desde hace 6 años cuando murió su esposo. 

Ella comenzó a vender huevos en cubetas, arroz y leche en un puestito que tenia en la calle, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo readecuar su casa y ubicar la tienda que siempre quiso, por esa buena decisión ahora ella trabaja en su propia tienda desde muy temprano, vende arroz, bebidas, lácteos, carnes etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y aceites para su negocio. En el futuro quiere, terminar de construir su casa y poder alquilar cuartos para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Petra, 59, lives along Guayaquil’s Perimetral Highway (in the city outskirts, surrounded by a salt marsh). She has had a grocery store for six years, since her husband died. She began to sell eggs, rice and milk from a little post that she had in the street. Little by little, with effort, she was able to readjust her house to accommodate the store that she had always wanted. Because of this good decision, she now works in her own store, beginning very early in the day, selling rice, drinks, dairy, meat, etc. With the loan, Petra wishes to buy rice, sugar and oil for her business. In the future she wishes to finish construction on her house and rent rooms in order to earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag B. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Central province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works as a doorman in a local secondary school, and earns 200,000 MNT per month.

Tungalag operates a shoe trading business at a rented stall in her town market. She started her business in early 2010, specializing in shoes and boots retailing. She has made progress with her business for such a short period of time, and has found much success. Today her earnings are stable and her husband continues to help with her business as well. Tungalag is focused on the future and is working hard to keep up with her fast growing customer base. She is a hard working and modest woman, who is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more shoes and boots at wholesale prices and resell at retail for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and boots.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: Maria Emilia tiene 58 años, su actividad es una pulpería, Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido muy satisfactorio esta oportunidad, cuando dio inicio fue con muy pocos productos, pro con el paso del tiempo es que ha incrementado su inventario y sus clientes que son sus mismo vecinos, familiares entre otros. Este crédito es para comprar pan, galletas, golosinas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Maria Emilia is 58 years old and she has a general store. For more than 14 years she has had this business. It is not the first time that she has had a loan and she has appreciated the support. When she first started out she only had a few products to sell but with time she managed to increase her inventory and she gained more clients, mostly her neighbours and her family. This loan will be used to purchases bread, cookies, snacks and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 47 years old. Leonora is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 8 years.

Leonora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Elena P. C., se dedica la venta de refrescos en el mercado la estación, inicia las 6:00 am y finaliza a la 1:00 pm, solicita este crédito para compras de semilla, cacao y productos varios el cual ella le agradece a ceprodel porque con los créditos que le ha brindado, ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo con productos populares, donde obtiene una mayor ganancia para la mantención de su hogar.
texts.en: Sra. Rosa Elena Perez C. operates a business selling cold drinks at the market in the station.  She works from 6:00 in the morning to 1:00 in the afternoon.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients for making the products she sells.  Sra. Perez is very grateful to CEPRODEL because the extra working capital she's received has allowed her to make products that her customers want and, in turn, increased her earnings.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Sidibé est un homme marié de 38 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de  Bougouni.
Monsieur Adama Sidibé a fait des études, en langue Arabe, après lesquelles, il décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités  comme la vente des céréales, mais sans succès. Après une longue réflexion il finit par apprendre auprès de son ami la vente des articles divers tels les habits, chaussures, radios...
Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Sa boutique de prêt à porter est située en plein cœur du grand marché de Bougouni.
Pour renforcer son activité, il décide rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, des habits, chaussures, radios et autres petits articles.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako. Il est à son deuxieme prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent ont été correctement bien remboursé.  Sa clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA
texts.en: Adama Sidibe is married, 38 years old and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.  Mr. Sidibe was educated, in the Arabic language, after which he decided to earn a living. He spent years trying different businesses, such as selling grain, but without success. After much thought, he decided to learn from a friend how to run a business selling various items such as clothes, shoes, radios ...  After more than 5 years of experience, he has mastered his business.  His ready-to-wear shop is located in the heart of Bougouni's large market.  To bolster his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to buy clothes, shoes, radios and other small items. He gets his supplies in Bamako. This is his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loan has been fully repaid. His clientele consists of all social classes.  He expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: :   Santos Pablo

texts.es: SANTOS PABLO R. R.,Trabaja como Higienista en Commema mercado Oriental de Managua.   es padre de familia de cinco j¡hijos dos se encuentran en el colegio, ha trabajado ocho prestamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, el prestamo solicitado  es para la compra de pliegos de zinc y madera para el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Santos Pablo R. R. works as a cleaner for Commema (Corporación Municipal de Mercados de Managua) in Managua's Mercado Oriental market.  He is the father of five children who all attend school.  He has had eight loans from CEPRODEL and they have been used to improve his house.  The loan he is currently requesting will be used to buy sheets of corrugated metal and wood for the roof of his house.

loans.use: House improvements.  Replacing his roof

loans.name: Angel Armando

texts.es: El señor O. G. Angel Armando, tiene 47 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad, es casado vive en casa familiar, con direccion Raul Boza 335 Subtanjalla, casa de material noble de una planta. El Es Operario de construccion  se dedica a este rubro hace mas de cinco año.El señor tiene metas  trazadas y obejetivos, en futuro quiere crecer y tener todos sus implementos para asi dar un mejor servicio, con el credito piensa invertir en sus gastos personales y asi ganar experiencia crediticia con la entidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Ormenno G., Angel Armando is 47 years old; he is married and has 4 adult children. They live in the family home at Raul Boza 335 Subtanjalla, a one story wooden house.

He is a construction worker and has been in this trade for more than five years. He has goals for the future, He would like to increase his work and have all the implements necessary to give better service.

He will utilize this loan for personal expenses and through it hopes to gain credit experience with the financial institution.

loans.use: He will utilize the loan for personal expenses

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma (pictured with the book) is a very industrious lady. In addition to her household responsibilities, she does sewing and embroidery for her neighboring clients and supports her husband in fulfilling the basic needs of the family. Salma has given birth to five sons. Only three of them are able to get an education, and the others stay at home. 

Her husband has a business selling construction supplies. He sells his supplies to different construction companies and also to regular customers who buy supplies for building their houses, shops, etc. He has been in this business for over 15 years and has a good reputation among his customers. 

Salma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more construction supplies to fulfill his customers' orders in a timely manner and earn more income. Salma is hopeful that a loan investment will bring positive results to her husband’s business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client, having paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Angelica Berenice

texts.es:
Angélica de 25 años, debido a los pocos ingresos que tenía para su familia hace años atrás la mama le ayudo con un pequeño capital de trabajo para que comprara papelería. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana y caracterizada porque está rodeada de un estero salada ha estado trabajando con ayuda de su mama para mantener a sus dos hijos ya que se separo de su esposo y ella mantiene el hogar. En la actualidad vende cuadernos a $ 1.50, plumas $ 0.30, marcadores, juguetes por la época de navidad.  Trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 20h30pm.  

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo vitrinas, juguetes, papelería. En el futuro quiere comprar su propia casa ya que vive con la mama y que sus hijos termine sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Angélica is 25 years old.  A few years back she had very little income with which to support her family so her mom helped out by giving her a little bit of working capital to buy some stationery items.

Angélica lives in a peri-urban area which is surrounded by a salt marsh.  She has been working with her mom's help to support her two children since she is separated from her husband and she supports her household.  She currently sells exercise books for $1.50, pens for $0.30, markers and toys for the Christmas season.  She works from 8.30am to 8.30pm.

To continue in her business, she would like to use her loan to buy display cases, toys and stationery items.  In the future, she would like to buy her own home since she lives with her mom.  She would also like her children to successfully complete their studies.

loans.use: To buy stationery items and toys

loans.name: Po Joayu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de 17 Señoras  trabajadoras quenes se unierón para formar un grupo; un comité solidario Financiado por la Fundación Paraguaya, en donde el compromiso es conjunto y la clave del éxito poseer un espiritu emprendedor.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Gloria quien se dedica a la venta de joyas.
Ella compra las joyas de proveedores o viaja hasta la ciudad de Luque n donde se hace joyas de plata.
Comenta que no se queja de las ventas que tuvo en esta epoca pero quiere continuar con muchas variedades de joyas para la venta para ello solicita el prestamo para la compra de joyas de plata como pulseras, cadenas, aros y otros.
texts.en:
This group of 17 hardworking women have united as a group, a "financial solidarity committee" or communal bank, through the [field partner] Fundación Paraguaya. The pledge to repay the loan is a joint one, and the key to success is an entrepreneurial spirit. One of the members is Señora Gloria, who dedicates her time to selling jewellery. 

Señora Gloria buys the jewellery from intermediaries or travels to the city of Luque where they make siver jewellery. She says that while she can't complain about the sales she has had lately, she wants to continue stocking many styles of jewellery for sale. She is therefore seeking the loan to buy silver jewellery such as bracelets, chains, earrings and other things.

loans.use: To buy silver jewellery such as bracelets, earrings, chains and other things

loans.name: Sairagul Sharsheeva's Group

texts.en:
Collective farming, called “kolkhozy”, was first introduced in the republics of the Soviet Union. Several farmers joined together in farming activities such as agriculture, cattle breeding and dairy production. This was a strategy for boosting the country’s production. Unfortunately, “kolkhozy” failed after the collapse of the Soviet Union, leaving hundreds of thousands of peasants managing the land on their own.
Sairagul S., 43, is the leader of this group. In Soviet times she used to be a dairymaid in a local “kolkhoz”. Like many others, she was left helpless after the collapse of Soviet Union. Having no education, but excellent skills in cattle breeding, she decided to continue this occupation. Three years ago, Sairagul ventured into the resale of cattle, which proved successful. Nowadays she spends most of her time taking care of cattle, but she also works as a salesperson in a nearby market on weekdays. Sairagul earns 6,000 KGS per month, but she still is unable to purchase some sheep for resale. In order to accomplish this goal she has applied for a loan from Kiva. Sairagul would like to spend her business returns on finishing the construction of her house, which she started two years ago.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Cruz Absalon

texts.es:
El senor Cruz Absalon, vive actualmente en la Comarca Namanji, es casado, con 1 hijo, tiene 30 anos de edad, se con mas de 16 anos de dedicarse a la agricultura.
Es originario de la Comunidad Los Arguetas en el Departamento de Jinotega a unos 42 kms del norte de Esteli; el recuerda que desde los 6 anos de edad le ayudaba a su Papa con las actividades agricolas en la casa.
Inicio ayudandole a arrear las vacas, a cuidar los sembradillos de las aves. A los 12 anos de edad tuvo su primer siembra en sociedad con un amigo, y el recuerda que de esa ganancia se compro su primer par de zapatos; posteriormente a los 18 anos comenzo a sembrar Repollo, tambien en sociedad.
Desde que se caso a los 22 anos de edad, su suegra le ha apoyado y a sembrado Repollo y Cebolla; pero fuera de temporada se dedica a la compra/venta de Ganado.
Realizo este Credito para compra de insumos, para la siembra de Cebolla, espera obtener mejores rendimientos en sus cultivos y de mejor calidad; ya que ahora las exigencias de mercado son mayores.
Su meta es comprar su propio terreno, mejorar su vivienda, ser independiente.
texts.en:
Sr. Cruz Absalon currently lives in the Namanji region. He is 30 years old, married, and has one child. Cruz has been farming for more than 16 years.

He is originally from the community of Los Arguetas in the Department of Jinotega, which is approximately 42 kilometers north of Esteli. At the age of six, he remembers helping his father with the farming duties around their home. He started by helping herd the cows and caring for the baby chicks. When he was 12 years old, Cruz planted his first crop with the help of a friend. Later when he was 18 years old, he started planting cabbage, also with the help of a friend.

When he got married at the age of 22, his mother-in-law helped him with the planting of cabbage and onions. During the off-season, he engages in the purchase and sale of cattle. Cruz applied for this loan in order to buy supplies for planting onions. He hopes to obtain larger crop yields that are of better quality since there is greater demand at the market. His goals include buying his own land, making improvements to his home, and becoming independent.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for planting onions

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita de 26 años; natural del distrito de Quimbiri  convive con Edgar de 29 años, fruto del gran amor que sienten tienen 02 hijos Samith de 10 años y Ruth de 07 años de edad y juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la felicidad. Sarita, es una mujer muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida; es dueña de su propio negocio de Raspadillas; que lleva por nombre Raspadillas Sarita, donde viene trabajando 02 años cuenta que su primera inversión fue de 1,500 nuevos soles para la moledora de hielo, una carreta para vender las raspadillas y fruta. Al principio le fue difícil ganarse la clientela, pero luego la gente le gustó las raspadillas. Hoy disfruta de su trabajo y de los buenos ingresos económicos que le genera la venta de este refresco. Asegura que el secreto es: tener voluntad y ser creativo, vender lo que no hay, dar un buen servicio, ser cuidadoso con la limpieza y atender bien a la gente. Los planes para el futuro de su negocio es comprar otra moledora de hielo para así abastecerse con su público exigente. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará una moledora de hielo ya que con una sola moledora no se abastece.
texts.en: Sarita, 26 years old, from the district of Quimbiri, lives with 29-year-old Edgar. As a fruit of their great love, they have two children: Samith, 10 years old, and Ruth, 7 years of age. They live together in their own home where happiness reigns. Sarita is a very business-oriented woman with many desires of excelling in life; she is the boss of her own snow cone business called Raspadillas Sarita (Sarita's Snow Cones). She has worked there for two years and tells us that her first investment was 1,500 nuevos soles for the ice grinder and a cart on which to sell the fruit and snow cones. At the beginning, it was difficult for her to acquire new clients, but then her popularity grew as people tried the snow cones and liked them. Today she enjoys her work and the good income that the sale of this beverage generates. She advises that the secrets to a good business are: having willpower, being creative, selling unusual products, providing good service, paying attention to the cleanliness and attending well to her clients. The plan for her business' future is to buy another blender in order to keep up with the demand. This is the fourth loan with MFP and she is saving in order to be able to make her payments on time, seeing as she doesn't want to cause any problems with her communal bank because she is very happy with it. With the 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy a blender because her current blender doesn't suffice.

loans.use: To buy a blender.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase furniture for her kindergarten

loans.name: Silsa

texts.es:
Silsa tiene 61 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, sin carga familiar vive con su familia en el dustrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, este distrito es catalogado como uno de los más pobres de la Provincia de Chiclayo, sin embargo podemos encontrar mucha gente trabajadora y empeñosa, que trabaja de sol a sol para salir adelante.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de plátanos de seda, plátanos de freír y papayas; en forma ambulatoria desde hace más de 10 años. Sus compras las realiza a los grandes comerciantes del mercado de Moshoqueque. Silsa tiene como objetivo hacer crecer su negocio y con el tiempo comprar un puesto comercial.  Y en busca de cumplir su objetivo, ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Silsa is 61 years old and she is single. She doesn't have dependents and she lives with her family in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz.  This district is known as one of the poorest in the province of Chiclayo, although here we can find many hard working and earnest people that work from sun up to sun down in order to make a living.

Her business is the sale of bananas, plantains and papayas. She has been traveling to make her sales for more than 10 years. She makes her purchases from the large businesses of the Moshoqueque market. Sisal’s objective is to make her business grow and with time to set up a sales-stand. And in order to meet her objective she has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase bananas and papayas.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 43 years old, married to a primary school teacher, and has 3 children. She has operated a shop where she sells beans and sorghum for 26 years. Donatha is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and beans and, with the profits, she plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy sorghum and beans for sale

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Roberto M. llegó a Medellín con la esperanza de comenzar una nueva vida después de la separación con su esposa. Desde el 2010 se ha dedicado a vender controles para el televisor y estuches para estos controles, gracias a un amigo quien le colaboró para tomar este trabajo. Roberto es un vendedor ambulante e independiente, y actualmente necesita capital para comprar mercancía y así permitir que su negocio crezca. Su mayor sueño es poder, algún día comprarse una moto, no sólo por facilidad en sus ventas si no porque así podrá ir a todos los lugares de la ciudad y ofrecer sus productos a muchas mas personas.
texts.en: Roberto M. came to Medellín with the hope of beginning a new life after separating from his wife. Since 2010 he has worked selling television remote controls and protective cases for these remotes, thanks to a friend who helped him get started in this work. Roberto is an independent traveling salesman, and right now he needs capital to buy merchandise, which will allow his business to grow. His greatest dream is to some day be able to buy a motorcycle. Not only would this make his sales easier, but it would also allow him to go all over the city and offer his products to many more people.

loans.use: to purchase television remote controls and cases for them

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Ke P., 38, and his wife, also age 38. They currently live in Kompong Cham province. Ke P. earns a living by cultivating rice with his wife. They have six children, one of whom is a Khmer food vendor from morning until evening next to her house. Ke P. will be using his loan to get a mortgage for farmland for his neighbor and to buy natural fertilizer for her crop to grow well.

loans.use: to get a mortgage for farmland and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline D. is from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Evangeline is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor cost for farm maintenance. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna vive en el estado de veracruz en una comunidad llamada Tierra Blanca o mejor conocida como la novia del sol, la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera y sus abuandantes calores en verano  de hasta 54°c. doña Reyna tiene la edad de 47 años de edad solo estudio la primaria, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres y uno es hombre, actualmente solo estudia la mas pequeña de sus hijas de nombre Barbara que tiene 17 años y estudia la preparatoria.

Doña Reyna nos platica que hace algunos años su esposo y ella construyeron en el patio de su casa unos cuartos los cuales rentan, nos dice que hace un par de años llegaron a vivir a sus cuartos de renta unos señores que viene de distintos estados y trabajan en Barcel los cuales le pidieron el favor de que le vendiera comida todos los dias (de lunes a domingo) 3 veces por semana y ella para ganarse algunos pesos acepto,  gracias a eso ahora tiene dos negocios la venta de comida y de cuartos.

Ella necesita este credito para inverlo en la compra de insumos (chiles, tomates, cebolla, carne, frijol, arroz, aceite tortillas, leche, gas, azucar, sal y cafe) para la preparacion de su comida y posteriormente venderla tambien ocupara un poco en la remodelacion de sus viviendas de renta.

Ella espera que con esta invercion su negocio prospere ya que desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y a la mas pequeña de sus hijas darle la oportunidad de estudiar una profesion.
texts.en:
Reyna lives in the State of Veracruz, in a community called Tierra Blanca which is better known as 'La Novia del Sol' (The Sun's Bride).  It is noted for being an area where sugarcane is grown and also for the intense heat it experiences in the summer when temperatures reach 54°C  (129°F).  Reyna is 47 years old and has an elementary school level of education.  She is married and has three children (two daughters and one son).  Currently, only her youngest daughter Barbara is still in school.  She is 17 years old and in high school.

Reyna tells us that some years ago she and her husband built some rooms in the area outside their home which they rent out.  She tells us that a few years ago some gentlemen came to live in these rental rooms.  The men came from different States and worked for Barcel.  They asked her if she would be good enough to sell them meals every day (from Monday to Sunday), three times a day, and she accepted in order to make some extra money.  Thanks to this, she now has two businesses: selling meals and renting rooms.

Reyna needs this loan to invest in buying supplies (chilis, tomatoes, onions, meat, beans, rice, oil, tortillas, milk, gas, sugar, salt and coffee) so that she can prepare and sell her meals.  She will also remodel her rental rooms a little.  

Reyna hopes that this investment will enable her business to prosper since she would like to provide her children with a better quality of life and would like to give her youngest daughter the opportunity to study for a career.

loans.use: to sell meals and rent out rooms

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 37 years old, single, and has one child. She owns a supermarket in which she sells different items such as juices, fruits, biscuits, etc. She has been in this business for three years. Jacqueline’s business has enabled her build her own house. She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her supermarket so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as juices, fruits, chewing gums, etc. for her supermarket.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 50 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason. She is married and has 2 children.  She works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.  Rosie has requested a loan to purchase different kinds of fish.  She has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: purchase fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 37 years old and is married with two children who are 11 months and 3 years old. Vincent makes a living by selling cows. He has been in this business for about three years and the hours of his business are from 6am until 5pm every day except Saturday. He currently employs two people to help him.
Vincent has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more cows for resale. With his profit, Vincent hopes that the number of customers will increase as well as his profits. These profits will be used for further reinvestment and to build a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 37 years old, married, and has seven children, six of whom are currently attending school. For the past 17 years, she has been a farmer in Kitale town in western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans, bananas, and potatoes, which she sells to the local market. She mainly depends on her farming income to provide for the needs of her family.

Hellen has made a loan request of 62,400 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable her to improve her family's standard of living. 

Her biggest challenge in this business has been fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce. In the future, she hopes to venture into zero grazing and own high-bred dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Mrs. Chann has resided of Siem Reap Province since she was single. She is a mother of two single children, and lives with under her responsible. Mrs. Chann employed as a chief in France restaurant and she can get a specific salary every month. She also has her husband who always generates some incomes from his business as a motor taxi driver. He could be earned about $2.5 per day.  Mrs. Chann requeted a loan in order to build a new hedge of her house as it is getting old and broken also.

loans.use: to build a new hedge of her house.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Isabel empezó dando clases a los niños de su barrio, cuando una vecina le explicó la venta de mercadería por catálogo, lo que la emocionó y se inscribió en el negocio, le resultó mejor que dar clases.
Actualmente vende productos Avon y otros cosmeticos.

Trabaja sola y sus clientes la llaman para hacer lo pedidos por teléfono.Su dificultad al momento de vender es que por su sector rondan muchos ladrones por lo que ya le ha robado en alguna ocasión. Casada y madre de 2 hijos que estudian. Desea obtener un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, pero en el futuro desea establecer un local de ropa, zapatos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isabel began giving classes to the children in her neighborhood, when a neighbor explained the sale of merchandise by catalog to her. This excited her and she signed up for the business, which turned out to be better than giving classes. Now she sells Avon products and other cosmetics.

She works alone, and her customers call her to place their orders by telephone. Her difficulty at time of selling is that many thieves hand around her district and thus she has been robbed a few times. She is married and is the mother of two children who are in school. She wants to obtain a loan to invest in her business, but it the future she wants to establish a shop with clothing and shoes and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy perfunes, creams, lotions, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Dolibe

texts.es: Dolibe tiene 59 años  es mujer casa casada, fruto D. su matrimonio es madre D. cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores y tienen familia. Ella vive junto a su esposo y una hija en su casa propia que pudieron comprar con esfuerzo.El trabajo D. Dolibe consiste en la venta D. bebidas, además ella tiene otras actividades, venD. queso, comida y panes, este último no pueD. hacer por el momento ya que el horno que tiene en su casa sufrió algunos desperfectos y esta en espera D. ser reparado. Ella realiza este trabajo en su casa y lo hace sola ya que su esposo y su hija trabajan fuera, lleva dos años realizando este trabajo que le permitió tener tiempo y un ingreso extra a la economía D. su hogar.Le gusta D. su trabajo que tiene tiempo a su disposición, además por la alta temperatura siempre hay clientes en busca D. bebidas gaseosas heladas. A Dolibe le gustaría mucho mas adelante poder hacer crecer su negocio además D. poder reconstruir su horno para que siga generando más ingresos a su economía.Este es el préstamo dieciséis entre la institución MFP y Dolibe, espera poder seguir trabajando con MFP ya que le agrada mucho que le den la confianza D. poder salir adelante por si misma, además D. los intereses son uy bajos y le permite poder trabajar sin tener que endeudarse demasiado.Con el dinero solicitado 2000 soles, ella comprará más bebidas gaseosas que requiere para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Dolibe is 59. She is a married mother of four grown children who have their own families. She lives with her husband and one daughter in her own home which they worked hard to be able to buy. Dolibe sells drinks. She also has other businesses; she sells cheese, food and bread. She cannot sell bread at the moment because her oven is in need of repair. She works from home, alone, since her husband and daughter work outsiD. of the  home. She has done this work for two years, and it has allowed her to have time and an extra income for her home. She likes that her business allows her to have time to herself. Because of the heat, she always has customers looking for pop and ice cream. Dolibe would really like to expand her business in the future, as well as to be able to fix her oven so that she can continue making more income. This is her sixteenth loan from MFP. She hopes to be able to continue working with MFP, and she is very grateful that they give her the confidence to be able to get herself ahead. The interest rates are very low and allow her to continue working without having to get too far in debt. With the 2000 requested soles, she will purchase more pop, which she needs in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pop for her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married with four children. She is 44 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor, Philippines.

Nelly sells assorted grocery items in her small store to earn a living and has had this business for six months. Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP net income doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
  
Nelly has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for eight months.  In the future, Nelly hopes to have more savings from the income of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. Ilham was born into a simple, rural family and has worked with livestock for many years. He is very experienced and has the special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock, and sells meat and milk. 

Ilham is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to enable him to purchase a second dairy cow. The second cow will enable him to increase the milk produced and will provide income security to the family when one of the cows is with calf. The income will enable Ilham to provide for his family, take good care of his cows, and supply his neighbors with quality milk.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow and one cattle.

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi is a married man with no children. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and transport. 

He has operated a retail shop for the past two years; in addition to the shop, he practices farming. His potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of transporting his stock to his shop. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To  purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his business.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is 33 years old. In order to financially support her husband, she sews clothes for her community clients. Due to the good quality of work, she receives regular orders every month. 

Her husband runs a grocery store in the market. Through his store, he sells daily used items such as sugar, spices, lentils, rice etc. He is very fair in his rates and earns good profits from his business. 

She has given birth to three children: one of them is studying while the others are very young and haven’t started their education yet. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk, which will allow him to fulfill the client's orders and earn better profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past nine years. Asia is very sure that his business will be improved further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La socia Benita es viuda, la socia cría animales menores como chanchos, cuyes, ovejas, para la venta; La socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de animales menores como cuyes 20 pares, ovejas 2 terneras, y un par de chanchos pequeños para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos; la socia desea poder comprar terrenos de cultivo y también ver a sus hijos profesionales y seguir apoyandolos en sus estudios. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de chanchos, cuyes, ovejas para la crianza y venta final.
texts.en: Benita is a widow.  She raises small farm animals like pigs, guinea pigs and sheep to sell.  She wants to use the loan to buy small farm animals like 20 pair of guinea pigs, two lambs and calves and a pair of piglets to raise, fatten up and then sell.  She wants to be able to buy farm land and to see her children become professionals and to continue supporting their schooling.  She’s asking for the loan to buy pigs, guinea pigs and sheep to raise and then sell.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, guinea pigs and sheep to resell.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Mr. Baasansuren, 52, has been working as a driver in a company for 10 years. He lives with his 2 children and his wife in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since his monthly salary usually does not meet his family's expenses, he always lends from people and financial institutions.

Recently Baasansuren built a new house on his small piece of land and could not finish the building completely. He especially needs to install a low-pressure furnace and panel-heating system, important factors to cut down his coal-fuel usage. It will also help the environment by decreasing the harmful effects from coal usage. The loan Baasansuren is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the new low-pressure furnace and panel-heating parts.

loans.use: To purchase a new low-pressure furnace and panel-heating parts to cut coal usage

loans.name: Getar Muda Group

texts.en:
Faridah is 37 years old and married with three children. All of her children are going to school. Two of them are in the middle school and one in elementary school. She has been selling mobile phone minute refills from her house for seven years. The business has been steady. The income that she gets can help her husband to cover daily basic needs of the family, including school fees. But she needs more capital to have more mobile phone minute refills to resell to create more income. 

In the future, she plans to have her own shop and have more customers. She also might try to find another type of business she can run in addition to the mobile phone minutes sales because she enjoys running her own business.

Other group members plan to use their loans to help their businesses which include a general store and traditional clothing sales.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phone minute refills to resell.

loans.name: Shin

texts.en: Mrs. Shin, 50, is in the business of selling fresh fish in a local market in the Baray district.  Her husband catches fish from dawn to dusk along Tonle Sap River to support her sales. Together, they can generate an income in the neighborhood of $6.00 per day to cover their daily expenses. The purpose of this loan is to buy a boat motor and some fishing tackle for her husband because most of what they have are currently unusable. She lives with her husband and 5 single children.

loans.use: to buy a boat motor and some fishing tackle for her husband.

loans.name: Jesusima

texts.en:
Jesusima is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jesusima has a shop that sells animal feeds by the kilogram and sack. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of animal feeds for sale.

Jesusima has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jesusima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of animal feeds for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: For some time now, Efua has been in the production of Fante kenkey. Fante kenkey is a common dish popularly known in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua helps her husband take care of the home. Efua will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey for sale. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan, 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling coconut for over six years, earning approximately, USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about USD 5 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about USD 7 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Phan is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 47 years old, married, and has four children.

Mona has been a tailor since 2005. She professionally makes, repairs, or alters clothing such as suits, coats, and dresses for women. She has more than ten years of experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to rent a shop. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to rent a shop.

loans.name: Jakleen

texts.en:
Jakleen is a 46 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to pay for used furniture to resell,her husband has a shop for used furniture she wants to open another shop in the same of her area.
Jakleen is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her son's

loans.use: to pay for used furniture to resell

loans.name: Tiana

texts.en:
Mesepi is a 51-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows green beans, cabbages, green peppers and green onions to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. 

Mesepi has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, a hose set, seeds and spades. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Mesepi hopes to help her kids' education and her family matters.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, a hose set, seeds and spades.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para comprar 100 libras de queso,  8 quintales de harina 25 libras de levadura.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 33 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife and four children.
He opened small workshop “Aluminums work shop” in 2012 he specializes in manufacturing frames of the doors and windows to prevent the water and the winds from enter the houses; this business is the only source of income for his small family, and he has one labor to help him because his customers increasing constantly.
Mohammad is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this loan to buy welding machine and equipment for his workshop which will allow him to expand it. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy welding machine and equipment for his workshop which will allow him to expand it.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farming business where she sells farm produce. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farming inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Mrs. Tu is 29 years old, married and has four children, all of them are schooling. She works very hard to feed & education her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lacks capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from farming. In this picture, she stands near her temporary toilet with her baby.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Madam Yawa V. was born toward 1970 at Fidokpui in the canton of Toglé. She is married and mother of five (05) children and has another dependant. She is living at Fidokpui with all her family where she has as main activity the planting and selling of vegetables (Adémé, Gboma, and okro) the only source of income of the family.
