She started off selling costume jewelry and personal products and, little by little, with effort, she bought lots of different types of costume jewelry until she managed to get a street stall from which to sell her merchandise.  She currently works in her business from 7.00am to 3.00pm so that she can spend more time with her children.

She will use her loan to buy toys and Christmas products since demand increases during this season.  In the future she would like to improve her sales and be able to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy toys and Christmas products

loans.name: Yubu

texts.en:
Yubu is a 33-year-old married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after six household members and his dream is to have enough savings to support his children in school.

It is now nine years since he started driving for a living and this has helped him pay school fees for his children. He also has a piggery that is promising him good results in the future. Yubu needs the credit facility to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa; ella tiene 55 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. maíz, verduras, y pasto, ella venD. en el mercado modelo D. Urubamba desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6.00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un local donD. pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the “Virgen Natividad” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Carmen Rosa is 55 years old.  She is married and has 6 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling corn, vegetables and fodder.  She sells her products in the Mercado Modelo, a market, in Urubamba.  She works from 6.00am to 6.00pm.  She would like to have premises from which she can sell her vegetables.  She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables wholesale.

Carmen Rosa is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan tiene 22 años, es un joven con muchas ilusiones de progresar, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su madre y sus hermanos menores. Después de haber trabajado por muchos años en un taller de costura Jhonatan, puso su bodega hace 6 meses, instalado en el primer ambiente de su casa. La bodega  “Alva Dariano”, así es como se llama su negocio, es la más concurrida, donde todos sus vecinos recurren a su establecimiento para comprar algún producto, asimismo comparten momentos gratos con él. Es por ello, que atiende durante todo el día, siendo su madre quien le ayuda a proveer la mercadería que necesita para vender. De esa manera sus ganancias le resultan muy beneficiosas. Es así que  llevan  6 meses en esta labor, en la que le tiene tanta confianza y fe; en adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio y convertir en un mini Marquet. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente  sus cuotas, para acceder a otras con mayor tranquilidad. Con el crédito que solicita,  incrementará más productos perecibles y no perecibles, para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en: Jhonatan is 22 years old. He is a young person that has dreams of success. He lives in his own house with his mother and younger brothers. After working for many years in a tailor’s workshop, six months ago Jhonatan started a small canteen in his house. The canteen, called “Alva Dariano”, which is the name of his business, is very busy. All of his neighbors stop by his house to buy certain products or to pass the time with Jhonatan. He works at this store all day. His mother helps him buy the merchandise that he sells. This is why his earnings are very helpful. After six months of work, in which he had a lot of confidence and faith, he looks forward to expanding his business by converting it into a mini-market. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to pay his payments on time so that others will be pleased. With this loan he will buy more perishable and non-perishable products in order to stock his canteen.

loans.use: to increase the products that he sells in his business.

loans.name: Kulsiyna's Group

texts.en:
Since ancient times the Kyrgyz people have been some of the best livestock breeders and farmers. Leading a nomadic lifestyle, they have worked out special strategies for raising healthy cattle high in the Kyrgyz mountains.

Kulsiyna K., 44, is the leader of this group, consisting of four experienced and ambitious cattle-breeders. Five years ago, having some savings and a big desire to start a successful business, she had to decide where to invest her start up capital. A widow with three sons living apart, Kulsiyna started with purchasing just a few head of cattle. She would feed and look after them carefully and go to the nearest stockyard to sell them. 

Soon she found out that the more carefully you look after cattle, the more productive you are going to be. Over these years she’s been quite successful, and now that she is more confident and experienced, she would like to try raising sheep and goats, which are also in high demand. 

Kulsiyna hopes to obtain the loan in order to purchase sheep and goats, since a monthly income of about $44 is unfortunately not enough. In the future she would like to help her sons arrange nice wedding ceremonies with lots of guests and good memories. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny del Carmen M. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de comida, gaseosa y refrescos naturales desde hace ocho años con el cual ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos de 17, 9 y 2 años.
Ella invertirá el crédito principalmente en carne, pollo y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jenny del Carmen M. is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been selling food, softdrinks and natural beverages for eight years in order to provide an income for her three children, ages 17, 9 and 2.

She plans to use the loan mainly to buy meat, chicken and basic grains.

loans.use: To buy meat, chicken and basic grains

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Isabel Mari A. es una mujer de 45 años que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus tres  hijos en las edades de 14, 16 y 20 años allí tiene un negocio llamado: “Tienda el grano de mostaza”  donde vende ranchos víveres y productos de la canasta familiar, en la que trabaja con sus esposo y con la que generan ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar. 
Isabel María desde la edad de 15 años llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla procedente de Majagual una población de Bolívar,  y se dedicó a trabajar de empleada del servicio doméstico durante una década; cuando contrae matrimonio decide   trabajar desde su casa para manejar mejor sus responsabilidades de madre, esposa y también generar ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento, mientras  su esposo en ese entonces era cotero en una empresa, y después cambió su actividad laboral, para vender verdura en un puesto; cuando ella empezó su negocio  lo hizo con la venta de chicha de maíz o de arroz y también preparaba sopa en las horas de almuerzo y principalmente los días sábados y festivos, así lograba su mayor volumen de ventas.  En el año 1999 decidió iniciar un negocio de tienda en su casa y con la ayuda de su esposo, cuando ya habían reunido un capital para hacerlo, negocio que han logrado sostener y ampliar hasta llegara a fortalecerlo y generar sus propias fuentes de empleo desde su casa.
Este el financiamiento # 12 que tiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha logrado construir su historial crediticio y con la que ha logrado también darle una formalidad a su negocio.  Su sueño es continuar progresando, buscando oportunidades de trasladarse a otro barrio donde pueda generar   más estabilidad para su negocio, porque tiene un gran desafío respecto a la prestación de los servicios de luz, que muchas veces se tornan deficientes y también quiere mudarse a otro lugar para lograr una mayor comodidad y  el completo bienestar a sus hijos.  
En la actualidad su tienda maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 2 días, su rotación de inventarios es de 19 días mientras maneja  una utilidad sobre las ventas es de 30%  y una capacidad de pago de un 39 %. Con su credikiva comprará útiles escolares, como libretas, lapiceros, lápices, block de hojas, cartulina para surtir su negocio en esta temporada escolar, lo cual augura una recuperación exitosa porque vende justamente lo que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Isabel Mari A. is a 45 year old woman living in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and three children ages 14, 16 and 20.  They have a business called: "A Mustard Shop" that sells groceries and basic products. She works with her husband to generate income to support their household.
 
María Isabel arrived in the city of Barranquilla from the Bolivar area of Majagual at age 15 and went to work as a domestic worker for a decade.  When she married, she decided to work from home to better manage her responsibilities  as a mother and wife and also to generate income to help with household expenses while her husband was a Cotero in a company.  Later on he changed his work to selling vegetables at a stall. When she started her business she did it by selling corn or rice chicha.  She also made soup at lunch time and especially on Saturdays and holidays when she made her highest volume in sales.  In 1999 she decided to open a store in her home with the help of her husband when they had assembled the capital to do so.  The business has been able to grow and expand and generate their own sources of employment from their home. 

This funding, # 12, she has with the "Mario Santo Domingo' Foundation, an organization with which she has managed to build her credit history and which has also given her business some formality.  Her dream is to continue progressing, looking for opportunities to move to another neighborhood where she can create more stability for her business because it faces great challenges regarding the provision of services like electricity, which often become weak, so she wants to move to another place for greater comfort and for the welfare of her children.
 
Today her shop handles a receivables turnover of 2 days, its inventory turnover is 19 days while operating return on sales is 30% and a capacity to pay 39%. With her Kiva loan she will buy school supplies like notebooks, pens, pencils, and pads of paper, and cardboard for her business in this school season, which promises a successful recovery because she sells exactly what her customers need.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies like book, pens, pencils, note pads, and cardboard to stock her business.

loans.name: 'group For Used Shoes'

texts.en:
Saydee K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Group For Used Shoes'. He is 27 years old, married, and has three children whose ages are between 13 to 8 years old. He is a high school graduate.

For eight years, he has been selling used shoes in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 54,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more consignments of used shoes for resale.

He describes himself as a kind man whose goal is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more consignment of used shoes for resale

loans.name: Segundo Saturnino

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 35 años de edad. Vive con su esposa e hijo en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua o luz.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves, ovinos y pavos. Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando los animales han alcanzado un tamaño y peso ideal, los vende en el mercado local al público general. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para invertirlo en alimento balanceado para sus animales. Con esta inversión, puede engordar los animales en menos tiempo y venderlos para mejor precio en el mercado. Con este aumento en sus ingresos, podrá solventar sus gastos familiares y seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and son in Tambogrande, an agricultural region that is located in the province of Piura. It is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the region of Lambayeque. He doesn’t have basic services such as water and hydro.

For more than 5 years he has been raising and selling foul, sheep, and turkeys. He has his business is the posterior part of his property. When the livestock have reached an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the neighborhood market to the general public. He has an established client base. He requests a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in the purchase of balanced feed for his livestock. With this investment he will be able to fatten his livestock in less time and he will be able to sell them at a better price in the market. With this increase in income he will be able to provide for his family’s expenses and he will be able to keep providing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Abdimitalip

texts.en:
Abdimitalip M., 41, is married and the father of five school-aged children, the youngest of whom is three. He works as a builder, helping his neighbors to reconstruct their houses, and is also engaged in cattle breeding and rice cultivation in order to support his family. Starting with initial capital of 15,000 KGS, he now manages to earn about 10,000 KGS a month from these activities.

Abdimitalip has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cattle and mineral fertilizer to manure land. It will allow him to multiply his cattle and broaden his business activities. In the future, he dreams of providing his children with a good education and building a big house for his family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan, uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, leading to increased employment and meeting the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es:
María Inés forma parte del banco comunal “Lontué I”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Molina. 
Ella se dedica a realizar y vender productos de repostería desde hace 4 años. Todo su quehacer lo realiza desde su casa y vende sus productos al comercio establecido. Específicamente queques y brazos de reina. Durante la temporada de verano se dedica a vender helados artesanales y durante ésta temporada de otoño invierno, venderá comida rápida en un carro.
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en distribuidoras y supermercados mayoristas.  
Con el préstamo comprará insumos para sus productos de repostería y su carro de comida rápida. 
Sus motivaciones son surgir y para esto sus metas son tener un local establecido. Su sueño a nivel personal es tener éste local en su propia casa, debido a problemas de salud, María Inés no puede trabajar en otro lugar. 
María Inés está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que la han impulsado a seguir adelante con su negocio, lo que es una gran motivación para ella. Respecto a las reuniones, éstas son muy amenas y le sirven como distracción en sus ratos libres. El crédito ha sido un apoyo fundamental para su negocio, ya que con éste invertirá en su negocio. Las capacitaciones han sido esenciales para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio. 
Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Maria Ines is a member of the “Lontue 1” communal bank, located in the city of Molina. She has sold confectionery products for 4 years. All her work is done from her house and she sells her products, specifically, cakes and swiss rolls, to commercial establishments. During the summer, Maria Ines sells artisan ice creams, and during the autumn and winter, she sells fast food from a cart. Her merchandise is usually bought by distributors and wholesale supermarkets.

With this loan Maria Ines will buy supplies to make confectionery products and for her fast food cart. Her motivations are to get ahead, and to do so, her goal is to have an established store. Her personal dream is to have this store in her own house, due to her health problems. Maria Ines can't work in any other place. 

Maria Ines is very content and grateful for the help offered through Fondo Esperanza. It has motivated her to forge ahead with her business and is a great motivation for her. With respect to the group meetings, they are very useful and serve as a distraction during her free time. The loans have been a fundamental help for her business, enabling her to invest in her enterprise. The training sessions have been essential in organizing the accounting for her business.

Molina is town in the central zone of Chile, located in the Maule region. It is characterized, principally, as being one of the grand poles of Chile's grape-growing industry. In addition to the vineyards, there is the fruit growing industry, especially the production of apples, pears, and kiwis.

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES FOR HER CONFECTIONERY PRODUCTS AND HER FAST FOOD CART

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O., 35, is married to Mario O., a mason.  They have been blessed with four healthy children, who are all studying in public elementary and high schools nearby.  Erlinda is working hard to help her husband in order for them to send their children all the way through college. They live in Brgy.Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines.

Erlinda has been in the rags-making business for quite some time now.  She buys cut out pieces of fabrics, old newspapers as patterns, and other raw materials needed.  She weaves these fabrics into palm-sized and doormat-sized rags.  Users of these rags are usually jeepney and taxi drivers and even offices.  She sells the finished products to her patrons on a wholesale basis.  Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 PHP.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to pay for the purchase of more raw materials needed for her rag-making business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

It is Erlinda's desire to help her children finish their college education and become financially stable someday.  She prays for sustainability of her business and continue to provide the needs of her family.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she reads.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed for her rag making business

loans.name: Ramona Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal  se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la Señora Ramona, tiene 49 años  de edad y es soltera. Ella vive en casa de una hermana en compañía de sus sobrinos que los quiere como si fueran sus propios hijos.  Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y nos cuenta que estos ocho años que lleva el banco han sido muy buenos ya que ha recibido mucha ayuda.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 13h00, nos cuenta que aprovecha las mañanas ya que tiene muchas clientes que son maestras y a ellas las encuentra en las mañanas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es seguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the El Pedregal community bank meet every 15 days in Portoviejo, a city known for its thriving commercial zone, for its festival celebrating St. Peter and St. Paul and for the friendliness of its people.

Sra. Ramona, 49, is single.  She lives with her sister and her nieces and nephews who she couldn't love more if they were her own children.  Sra. Ramona is a founding member of the community bank and she tells us that the bank has been very supportive of her business over the eight years that she's been a member.

Sra. Ramona operates a business selling all kinds of clothing.  She sells from door to door, working every day from 8:00 to 1:00.  She tells us that she works in the morning because many of her customers are teachers and they can see her more easily in the morning.  She sells her merchandise on credit and collects from her customers every fifteen days.  She buys merchandise in Guayaquil when she needs it. 

Sra. Ramona has operated the business for more than ten years and she is pleased with her progress.  She will use this loan to stock her business with pants, blouses, t-shirst and clothing for children.

Her goal is to continue the business.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

loans.name: Tolentino

texts.es:
Tolentino  tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos  en caserío Sincape  un pequeño poblado del distrito de olmos a 2 horas de la ciudad  de Chiclayo.

Tolentino se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera  necesidad. El cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual el atiende y administra. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente  se dedica a la venta y reparto a domicilio de frutas desde el mercado de olmos.  

Contando con una moto, con la que el se transporta por todo el distrito de olmos repartiendo sus pedidos. Con estas actividades él cubre y solventa sus gastos familiares.
 
Tolentino está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la ampliación de su negocio ya que ha visto crecer la demanda de sus clientes de ésta manera podrá  generar más ingresos  para su  hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.

Tolentino es una persona muy tranquila y trabajadora, que tiene deseos de superación y de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Tolentino is 50 years old and he lives with his wife and children in the community of Sincape. It is a small community in the district of Olmos, at 2 hours form the city of Chiclayo.

Tolentino sells basic needs products. He has a small store located in his house which he attends and administers. There he offers a variety of daily use products for sale to his neighbors and clients in the region. This products are basic needs products and grocery store products. Teh business is in high demand. In addition he also has a sales and home delivery business selling fruits from the market at Olmos.

He has a motorcycle on which he delivers throughout the district of Olmos, distributing his orders. These activities help him to cover and pay for his family's expenses.

Tolentino requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to expand his business. he has seen an increase in demand from his clients and this will help him generate more income for his household and to improve the quality of life for his entire family.

Tolentino is a very calm and hardworking person. He has a wish to improve and to provide for his family.

loans.use: to expand his business with the purchase of general store merchandise.

loans.name: Tumurtulga

texts.en:
Mr. Tumurtulga is 57 years old and a  driving instructor. He has been working as a driving instructor for 39 years and he still works as an instructor. He lives with his wife and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He owns a plot of land and a family house on it. He has 2 other children who are grown up, both University graduates who live separately with their families. To give them proper education Tumurtulga spent all his savings and income while they were a students until 2009. 

Since then, he has gradually improved his family’s living conditions. Two years ago Tumurtulga bought a family car, and last year he did some light improvements to his house. This time he is planning to do proper restoration to his family house by making the walls thicker and the house warmer to withstand Mongolian harsh winters. To do that he needs to buy rockwool insulation materials and to put them under floor, in all the walls and the roof, plus replace the doors and windows with double-glazed ones. Finally, the house will become warm and more efficient in the use of charcoal (for heat) as well as greener.

loans.use: buy insulation for all walls and the roof, plus replace the doors and windows to make the house warmer and greener.

loans.name: Mach Trang-2-6 Group

texts.en:
Na, 27, is married with two children who are still young. Her husband is a worker. She is the leader of a five-member group loan from SEDA.

Na has been a tailor for two years, making clothes for everybody in her village. She also raises chickens and pigs. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 (VND).

This is the first time Na has taken a loan from SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Huong is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her clothes shop. Lien is 54 years old. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to promote his small business. Bay is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND. She buys and sells scrap. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to promote her small business. V. is 27 years old. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Gulzat, 22, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in the town of Isfana, which is on the border between Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekystan. She is single and doesn’t have any financial dependents. Last year Gulzat started up a barber shop of her own. This decision came during her trip to Russia, where a good friend of hers shared tips on operating a beauty salon which offers various types of services.  After coming back home, she found a perfect place to rent and soon the barber shop was open. Nowadays, Gulzat has customers on a regular basis. “I’m especially good at wedding hairdos”, she says.  Most of the initial capital was spent on beauty tools, kits and electronic appliances. Her monthly income is 2,500 soms. 

The purpose of the loan is to purchase additional appliances for the salon.  “I need to be stocked well at the start of the busy time, “ says Gulzat.  “I expect the wedding season and the feast of Ramadan to be very busy.”

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase additional appliances for the salon

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, single and lives with three family members. Two of the family members work.

Ahmad has had a barber shop since 2008, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has a lot of experience and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate and change the decoration in his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Norjana

texts.en:
Norjana is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Norjana has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.
Norjana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Norjana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Mohamed A.

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Mohamed.  He is married to an experienced small-scale retailer and has seven children aged 3, 6, 9, 11, 15, 18 and 21 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he helps him with his business.  

In 1999, Mohamed established his photography and photocopying equipment and accessories business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,450,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed  has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy film (2 packets @ Le450,000), batteries (2 cartons  @ Le150,000), 1 camera at Le700,000, duplicating papers (2 cartons @ Le500,000) and photocopy ink (3 cartons  @ Le600,000). He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to buy a vehicle, establish a bar with a cinema, and educate his children to the highest level they wish to achieve. High customs duties and rise in cost of goods are his business challenges.  He serves a majority of the Makeni community in photocopying and photography. He is very serious and hard-working in his business.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for supplies for photography and photocopying.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 39 years old. She is a single mother of four children who are 19, 17, 13 and 10 years old. She has been running a general store and a beauty shop for the past two years old with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her business and family.
 
She is applying for her second loan from KADET. She has been loaned KES 50,000 after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy a blow dryer, hair conditioners, shampoos, and hair extensions. With the remaining loan funds, she will expand her salon and add more stock to her general store like unga, sugar, cooking oil, etc 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant and employ some workers, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a blow dryer, hair conditioners, shampoos, hair extensions, to expand her salon and to add more stock to her general store like unga, sugar, cooking oil, etc .

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Gloria has engaged in a motorcycle transport business to make a living. It helps her too to lessen the transportation cost when there is an important matter to undertake. Other income of the family is derived from raising pigs, in which she makes a good return. These businesses have allowed her to earn approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month, considering all sources of revenue. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to repair the existing engine and continue the business operations.

Gloria is a GDMPC member who joined this year. In the future, Gloria hopes to increase the number of pigs she raises and widen their shelter for convenience. She has plans for house improvement as well to have a comfortable place to live.

loans.use: To repair the existing engine.

loans.name: Renante

texts.en: Renante is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. Renante has been providing motorcycle or habal-habal services for the past five years. He is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools for motorcycle maintenance and pay for gasoline. Renante is a new member of HSPFI. He hopes to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools for motorcycle maintenance and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Nenita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks & viands.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks & viands

loans.name: Fakhar-Un-Nissa's Group

texts.en:
Fakhar-un-nissa sells clothes to financially support her family. She has good business sense. She keeps herself updated on the latest fashion and trend, which helps her understanding her clients' demand.  She purchases clothes from different cities and then sells them to her community clients on profit.
 
Fakhar-un-nissa is married and her husband has a construction supplies business. She is the mother of 8 children -- 3 of them work while the others are studying in different classes.  Fakhar-un-nissa is also a very good mother and housewife. She fulfills her household responsibilities and her family respects her very much. 

Fakhar-un-nissa has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With this loan, she will buy clothes in bulk which will  allow her to offer more variety to her clients and increase her sales and profit.   She has been operating her business for past 10 years and is confident about her success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Lucely Janeth

texts.es:
Lucely, desde muy joven se dedico a aprender a los oficios de la confección, actualmente tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad. Mediante su microempresa de confección de ropa de hogar, se siente muy útil, ya que puede ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los  gastos de la familia y la educación de sus hijos.

Actualmente, con la ilusión de aprovechar la época navideña como oportunidad de ampliar su negocio, Lucely necesita un crédito, para comprar insumos con referencia al tema navideño y sacar una producción de tendidos de cama, sabanas, toallas y ropa de hogar en general. Este préstamo le permitirá aumentar sus ventas, llegar a nuevos clientelas y reinvertir en su negocio con la idea de innovar en nuevos productos y así proporcionalmente hacerlo crecer y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucely learned to be a seamstress when she was very young.  Now she is 35 years old, married and the mother of three minor children.  Through her home linens microbusiness she feels very useful since she is able to help her husband with the family expenses and the children's education.

Right now she is excited about taking advantage of the Christmas season to expand her business.  Lucely needs a loan to buy supplies with a Christmas theme so she can make bedspreads, sheets, towels and general household linens.  This loan will enable her to increase sales and reach new customers.  She will reinvest in the business with the idea of innovation through new products, and this will expand the business proportionally and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as fabric to make home linens for Christmas.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, in Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Jenelyn is married. Jenelyn operates a specialized retail store, selling sim packs and pre-paid cell phone credits. She earns 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to use to purchase additional cell phone products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jenelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

In 2008, Jenelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase additional cell phone products to sell

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria is married with four adult children. She is 49 years old and lives in Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. Gloria sells ricecake to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 to purchase two sacks of rice to make ricecake.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

Gloria is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has his or her own business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice to make ricecake.

loans.name: Sapon

texts.en:
Sapon (in the photo) and her husband are farmers and she is also a weaver. She is requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to continue her farming by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.
Sapon and her husband have been together since 1978 and have 6 sons and 2 daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, three have full time employment and the other four are in school. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Rogelen

texts.en:
Rogelen is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rogelen has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rogelen became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Rogelen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa fries doughnuts for sale at Brase near Abura. She lives together with her husband and 4 children. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients that will enable her to fry in larger quantities for sale. She hopes to build a snack bar with the new profits.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to enable her to fry in larger quantities for sale.

loans.name: Abu Al-Fadl

texts.en:
Abu Al Fadl is 36 years old, married and the father of seven children, most of whom are in primary school. In his childhood, he could not go to school because nobody was there to support him.
 
Abu Al Fadl is a food distributor to small groceries. He purchases food and other simple goods from big producers and distributes to small groceries in Sana'a using a tricycle to carry goods. This idea came to him earlier when he was working with a merchant in a big store who supported him to start the business with simple products. This business is the main and the only source supporting him and his big family. 

Abu Al-Fadl took a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more goods to cover the demand of his clients/groceries since this will bring more profit to him and his family's conditions will be improved accordingly. 

Abu Al-Fadl hopes to improve his business by building capital and buying a car instead of the tricycle so that he will be able to distribute goods more easily and reach more groceries.

loans.use: to purchase goods from producers to distribute to small groceries.

loans.name: Adut

texts.en:
Adut is a 25-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in South Sudan for the past two years.

Adut is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mahulome 12 Group

texts.fr: MAHULOME 12 est un groupe composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies et qui font des tontines ensemble. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Anne1 est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Anne1 est âgée de 33 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Anne1 est mariée à un pêcheur nommé Florentin. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et  tous à leur charge.  Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Anne1 et son mari. Pour cette raison, Anne1 vend du poisson à son domicile depuis six ans. Parallèlement à son activité, Anne1 vend également du maïs et des condiments. Anne1 s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Anne1 sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHULOME 12, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du poisson, du maïs et des condiments.

loans.name: Daimati

texts.en:
Daimati is a 28-year-old differently abled woman who lives with her husband and two children in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha, India. She is the mother of two children. Her children study in a government school near to her village. Her husband is farmer and earns 3,000 India Rupees (INR) per month. Daimati has been engaged in a tailoring business for 8 years and she also makes 3,000 INR per month. She had started this business to help her husband financially and to make some money for her childrens' educations. 

She has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and threads in bulk to run her business smoothly, because her current sewing machine is eight years old and its not working properly these days. She will use her extra income to improve her childrens' education and health.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and threads in bulk to run her business smoothly.

loans.name: Améwossina

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Améwossina was born in 1959 in Assiama. After her primary studies, she was adopted by an aunt in Lomé who needed an assistant in her business activities. When she went back to Tsévié in 1986, she started marketing millet, maize and other agricultural products.

She is married to a man temporarily employed in a local company and has five (05) children to care for (including three of her own). The insufficient salary of her husband cannot cover the household needs, therefore she provides 65% of the necessary resources. Mrs. S. Améwossina\'s experience has allowed her to correctly manage her business. She was able to easily reimburse the two credits that she obtained, which demonstrates her trustworthiness and her good sense of management.

Mrs. S. Améwossina has applied for a credit of $700 that will help her build up a stock of cereal to reinforce her activities and make significant profit to meet the needs of the family.

Madame S. Améwossina est née en 1959 à Assiama. Après ses études primaires, elle fut adoptée par une tante à Lomé pour l’aider dans ses activités commerciales. Revenue à Tsévié en 1986, elle se lance dans le commerce de mil, de maïs et autres produits agricoles. Mariée à un homme, temporairement engagé dans une société de la place, elle a à sa charge cinq (05) personnes dont ses trois (03) enfants. Le salaire de son mari, insuffisant pour couvrir toutes les dépenses de la maison, elle contribue aujourd’hui à plus de 65% des besoins du foyer. L’expérience acquise depuis lui a permis de bien gérer son activité. Elle a pu sans difficulté rembourser les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenu ce qui démontre sa bonne foi et son bon sens de gestion. Elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $700 qui servira faire un stock de céréales pour renforcer son activité et dégager une marge conséquente pour améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To build up a stock of cereals

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin is a member of MBK requesting a loan of $125. From this loan, a portion will be used to purchase goods for her general store and the balance to fund her husband’s vegetable business in the market. Emin generates a daily revenue of IDR320,000 with an income of IDR20,000.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: General store - Warung

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is a carpenter and he does all his work with wood. He does not have full-time workers, but hires them on specific jobs when he has a lot of work. He lives in the Villa San Antonio Alto region of La Paz, which is also where his workshop is. He works comes from client orders, and he makes the most on jobs working on furniture.

He is a second-time client here, and he fulfilled his initial loan with no problems. This new loan would be used to purchase raw materials and building supplies (wood, nails, sandpaper, glue, etc.). His work and his credit history make him an excellent candidate for a loan, since he already knows the business, which will give him the money to repay it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Emilio es Carpintero y elabora todo trabajo en madera, no cuenta con empleados fijos ya que cuando tiene muchas obras contrata empleados por obra realizada, pagandole al mismo un porcentaje de la ganancia.. Vive en la zona de Villa San Antonio Alto de la ciudad de La Paz, donde también es su taller, su trabajo lo realiza a pedido, y sus mayores ingresos son por arreglo de todo tipo de muebles Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 2, es decir con cumplimiento regular en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Madera, Venesta, clavos, lijas y pegamento). Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and building supplies (wood, nails, sandpaper, glue, etc.).

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en: Geronima has dedicated her life to buying and selling for supermarkets, particularly the supermarket "Bravo." She goes 3 days a week and gets paid on Fridays or Saturdays. She is single and has three children, two daughters and one son. She lives in the community of Los Botados.

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuff to a supermarket

loans.name: Meriamo

texts.pt:
Meriamo Macuacua is 56 years old. She is married and has one son. She lives in the town of Hulene "A" in Maputo. She sells basic need products from home and from her ranch in the Khongolote zone. She joined the program in October, 2006, when she received a loan in the amount of 3.000 MT. She will now start her third loan cycle and this time she will borrow 6.000 MT, which will be paid off in six months. She will use the loan amount to increase her inventory.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Meriamo M. tem 56 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de um filho. Vive no bairro Hulene "A" em Maputo. Vende produtos de 1ª necessidade em casa e também tem machamba na zona de Khongolote. Entrou para o Programa em Outubro de 2006, tomou como 1º empréstimo 3.000MT e agora vai para o terceiro ciclo e vai tomar um emprestimo de 6.000MT pagável em seis meses com vista a reforçar o stock.

loans.use: Aumento do Stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary I. is 56 years old, married with 8 children, and lives in Benin City. She has a milling machine for the milling of grains, and also sells foodstuffs. She learned this business from her mother and then established her own in 1958. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She has been with LAPO for the past 5 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy an additional milling machine.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter already has 5 years experience selling natural products. He maD. the important decision to work independently after his contract in the business where he was working as a security guard ended. Seeing he had no better option, he decided to invest his small savings in the marketing of these products. He was motivated by one of his cousins and by the urgent need to support his family, particularly his two young children, who now are daily help and encouragement for his successful enterprise. He travels through diverse cities to market his products in the streets. Sometimes he sells door to door. He feels satisfied with the earnings he has been generating since his effort at work allows him to respond satisfactorially to every request maD. to him by a member of his family. Facing tremendous demand for his products, he is applying for a loan with which to acquire a larger quantity of products, with an aim to establish himself in the medium term in a retail storefront . Support this responsible father who dreams of giving the best to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Walter, ya lleva cinco años dedicándose a L. venta D. productos naturales y tomó esta importante decisión D. desempeño laboral debido a que culminó su contrato en L. empresa donD. trabajaba como personal D. vigilancia; es así que no quedando otra opción mejor decidió invertir sus pequeños ahorros para comercializar estos productos incentivado por uno D. sus primos, y por L. urgencia D. sostener a su familia y en especial a sus dos hijos que ahora son su ayuda y aliento diario para su exitoso desempeño. Se desplaza por diversas ciudades a fin D. comercializar sus productos D. manera ambulante y a veces realizando sus ventas D. puerta en puerta y por las ganancias que ha estado obteniendo se siente satisfecho ya que este esfuerzo le permite responder satisfactoriamente a cada una D. las solicitudes D. los miembros D. su familia. Ante L. gran demanda D. productos por L. que traviesa solicita un préstamo a fin D. adquirir mayor cantidad D. productos con el objetivo D. establecerse a mediano plazo en local comercial. Apoya a este padre D. familia responsable que desea dar lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy a larger quantity and a wider variety of natural products in order to establish himself in the medium term in a retail shop.

loans.name: Sifatbonu

texts.en:
D. Sifatbonu is 40-year old lady. Sifatbonu and her husband, who is an entrepreneur, have a large family. There are three children of school age.

Sifatbonu is working hard to earn an honest livelihood. For 13 years already Sifatbonu has been running her own business. She started with baking national bread, which is called “lepeshka”, and other types of bread. She gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

Initially Sifatbonu only baked the bread and lepeshka but never sold them herself. Gradually the business expanded and the children grown up. Today it is the family business where the husband and the elder daughter are helping, since now Sifatbonu has a trading place in the central market of the city. The family business is stable; Sifatbonu has the clientele that allows her to improve the income of the family.

Sifatbonu has been a client of IMON for 2 years already, having a positive credit history. Today Sifatbonu requests 750.00 US Dollars in order to purchase flour, firewood, and coal for baking lepeshka and bread. Sifatbonu would like to ensure that she is ready to pay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of flour, firewood, coal

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
A hairdresser by profession, Mrs. Christine C. is married and has 3 children. She opened her hairdressing salon in Lokokoukoume, one of the neighborhoods on the outskirts of Cotonou. The geographic location of her salon makes it the most frequently visited in the area. Unfortunately she is experiencing difficulties due to not having enough products to satisfy her large clientele. She therefore decided to take out a loan in order to fulfill the expectations of the many young girls and women of her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Coiffeuse de profession, Dame C. Christine est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure à LOKOKOUKOUME, l'un des quartiers périphériques de Cotonou. La situation géographique de son salon fait de ce dernier le plus fréquenté de la zone. Malheureusement, elle éprouve des difficultés dues à l'insuffisance de matériels pouvant satisfaire sa forte clientèle. Ainsi, elle a décidé de contracter ce crédit afin de répondre aux attentes des nombreuses jeunes filles et dames de son quartier.

loans.use: To buy one free-standing hair dryer, one hand-held hair dryer, 20 packs of hair extensions and various cosmetic products.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Mr. Isidro D. has been working in the food business by selling tacos for more than twenty years. He and his wife work in this business, which is their main source of income and helps them support their family. The business is going well, but they would like to buy more merchandise and fixtures for their business. They are asking for a loan of $1000 that will be used to buy merchandise and furniture for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

EL Sr. Isidro D. tiene ya más de 20 años en el negocio de venta de tacos. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Gracias a dios no esta yendo muy bien en el negocio pero queremos comprar mas mercancía y inmobiliario para el negocio. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de inmobiliario y mercancía para el negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and furniture for their business.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a forty year old mother of four children. She has been selling palm nut soup and rice for the last four years. The proceeds of this loan will help her buy rice and palm nuts in larger quantities to help guard against price hikes. Eventually, Adwoa wants to use the proceeds of her loan to build her own house.

Adwoa is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of rice and palm nuts

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is 29 years old, married, and has three children (ages 2, 6 and 10). She has a business selling poultry, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 5am to 8pm and earns a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more poultry to increase her stock

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira B., the widow of M., lives in Arifwala, Pakistan, where she owns a two room brick house and is the mother of four children. She runs a grocery shop which she started after her husband’s death. In order to diversify her product line and expand her business, Tahira is requesting a loan. She recently successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan.

Tahira has been joined in her loan group by two other members: Iqbal B., who wants a loan for her spare parts business, and Ramzana B., who wants a loan to buy welding tools for her son. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses and improve their financial situations.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Mrs Filomena C. A. is a very loving and determined woman. She is 43 years old, has two children, and lives in the Rioja district.

Filomena is a member of Santo Cristo De Bagazan Community Bank and runs a catering business selling prepared food dishes from a stand near the Nuevo Rioja Health Centre, whose employees are her main customers. Using her experience in preparation of several food dishes and her ability to spot an opportunity, she began her business to earn an income and to support her husband with family expenses. She aspires to own a restaurant.

With this loan, repayable over four months, Filomena plans to buy various ingredients in bulk such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, condiments, and chicken, for convenience as well as to guard against rising price.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Filomena C. A., es socia del BANCO COMUNAL ”SANTO CRISTO DE BAGAZAN”, vive en el departamento y provincia de Rioja distrito de Rioja se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida ambulatoria gran cantidad de sus clientes son los trabajadores del centro de salud de Nuevo Rioja. Su experiencia en la preparación de diversos platos de comida, su buena sazón y la necesidad de tener un ingreso propio, la impulsaron a iniciarse en este negocio, para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 que será pagado en 4 meses, ella implementará su negocio, pues compró insumos como arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, aceite a granel , condimentos y gallinas en cantidad para preparar sus juanes ya que le es mas cómodo comprar en cantidad , en vista de que no hay estabilidad en los precios de los productos La señora Filomena tiene 43 años es una mujer muy amorosa y decidida, tiene dos hijos vive con su pareja y sueña con tener un Restaurante.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema R. is a married, Tanzanian woman. She runs a tailoring shop in the Vituka area outside the Dar-es Salaam city center. She makes a variety of clothes in different sizes for women, men, and children, including school uniforms. She purchases the materials from the Karia Koo shopping center in Dar-es-Salaam.

Neema has been running this business for two years. Her life depends on this business. She requests a loan of $550 to purchase more materials so she can expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more materials to make more clothese to sell

loans.name: Hamidu

texts.en: This group is called Mabai Zone. Its members includes: Hamidu S., Mamusu Thullah and Mohammed Kamara. They have twice received loans from Kiva through SMT. They however need a 3rd loan to further enhance their businesses. This group is thus seeking a new loan of Le 2,400,000. Hamidu S., who is the leader of this group is now 45. He is married with 10 children. Hamidu is a blacksmith and has 27 years of experience in this job.

loans.use: Buy working tools

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal San Antonio D. Padua pertenece a la comunidad D. Huando en Huancavelica. Este Valle tiene 3 barrios, Acobamba, Libertad y Progreso, la comunidad es bastante acogedora por su zona comercial. Entre las actividades principales que realizan esta la agricultura (maíz, papa, olluco, cebada, trigo), la ganadería (carnero, vacas, caballos, burros) y la artesanía (bordado D. fustanes).

Nora S., es casada, tiene dos hijos pequeños D. 5 y 3 años. Su negocio es una ferretería la cual ha surtido continuamente con los préstamos que recibe. Con el préstamo D. ahora comprará cemento en cantidad. Su sueño es que sus dos lindos tesoros, como les llama, tengan estudios y sean profesionales.

Norma M., tiene 8 hijos, se inició en el negocio vendiendo bebidas calientes, ahora ella venD. ropa, comida y fruta, esto es según la temporada. Antes no contaba con capital pues las ganancias las utilizaba en la alimentación D. sus hijos. Su esposo maneja un tractor que alquila a instituciones, ahora Norma pueD. ahorrar para la educación D. sus hijos que están en la universidad.

Soledad S., es casada, su negocio es la venta D. Cds y DVDs, agradece las reuniones D. su bancomunal porque ha aprendido mucho, su préstamo lo quiere invertir en la compra D. plásticos pues ha visto que en la comunidad D. Huando no hay.
texts.en:
The San Antonio D. Padua Communal Bank belongs to the Huando community in Huancavelica. This valley has three neighborhoods - Acobamba, Libertad and Progreso and the community is quite charming due to it's commercial area. Among the principle activities of the people are agriculture (corn, potatoes, olluco, barley and wheat), raising livestock (rams, cattle, horses and donkeys) and handicrafts (embroidered white skirts).

Nora S. is married and has two small children ages five and three. Her business is a hardware store that has run continuously with the loans she receives. With the current loan she will buy a large quantity of cement. Her dream is that her two beautiful treasures, as she calls them, are able to study and become professionals.

Norma M. has eight children. She went into business selling hot drinks. Now she sells clothing, food and fruit depending on the season. Before, she could not count on having business capital because she used all of her earnings to feed her children. Her husband drives a tractor that he rents to institutions. Now Norma can save for the education of her children who are in college.

Soledad S. is married. Her business is selling CDs and DVDs. She is thankful for the communal bank meetings because she has learned a lot. She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of plastics because she has seen that there aren't any in the Huando community.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The San Antonio de Padua Communal Bank requests a loan for 13,900 soles that will be used by its 18 members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 33 años de edad, es socia del Banco comunal Desarrollo y Progreso y vive en la Av. Ramón Castilla Nº 425, distrito de Caraz, provincia de Huaylas, departamento de Ancash.
Tiene un negocio de abarrotes, el cual está ubicado en la esplanada del mercado central de Caraz, lugar donde sueña tener su propio local. A pesar de ser madre soltera y con dos hijos, sigue adelante. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará  4 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azucar, 3 cajas de aceite y 5 bolsas de fideos. Gracias a dicha inversión podrá seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Carolina, 33, is a member of the Desarrollo y Progreso ("Development and Progress") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. She operates a grocery business on the esplanade of the Caraz central market, the place where she hopes to have her own store. Although she's a single mother with two children, she's forging ahead. With this S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 4 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 3 cases of cooking oil and 5 bags of pasta. Thanks to this investment, Carolina will be able to continue moving her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Enma tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella y su esposo, desde hace 8 años tomaron la decisión de tener su propia fabrica de ladrillos, antes solo trabajaban en otras fabricas de manera dependiente, ahora el trabajo para ellos es todo un esfuerzo bien recompensado, desde muy temprano ambos se esfuerzan para elaborar los ladrillos que necesitan todo un proceso para su elaboración, demoran  hasta 4 días en  producir millares. Esta actividad es muy rentable, aunque exista época de escasez de ventas, pero que son compensadas por las temporadas de abundancia que es durante los meses de marzo y abril, aunque el trabajo se torna sacrificado es una buena fuente de ingresos, que anima a su familia a continuar fabricando ladrillos. Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo en MFP y hasta el momento ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. Solicita este dinero para la compra de troncos y aserrín, que son necesarios para la fabricación de los ladrillos, además pagará el arriendo de parte de espacio donde tiene su fabrica de ladrillos. La camionada de aserrín está valorizada en 600 soles, y los palos y troncos serán comprados con el dinero restante.
texts.en:
Emma, 25, lives with her husband and 4 children. She and her husband decided 8 years ago to set up their own brick factory. Before that, they had worked in other factories for other people. Now they work for themselves and reap the full reward for their labor. Starting very early in the morning, they both work hard making bricks, something that requires several steps. It takes 4 days to make thousands. It's a profitable business but seasonal and sales vary depending on the time of year. Sales increase substantially in March and April and, though the work is hard, those months are a good source of income that inspire the family to go on with the business. This is the third time that Emma has applied to MFP for a loan and she's been consistently responsible and punctual in repaying the loans. She's applying for a loan to buy logs and sawdust, materials necessary for making bricks. She will also pay part of the rent on the space where she operates the business. A truckload of sawdust costs 600 soles and she will pay for sticks and logs with the rest of the money.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for brick-making business.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Née en 1972 à Zowla, Madame Z. Kayi exerce le métier de coiffure depuis 10 ans. Elle est mariée et a cinq enfants. Elle est une femme dynamique, très dévouée et maîtrise bien son activité. Son mari n’ayant pas un revenu fixe, les charges de la famille reviennent seule. Toutefois, le revenu tiré de son métier ne lui permet pas de couvrir tous ces besoins. 
Pour renforcer son activité et accroître son revenu, elle sollicite un financement pour faire le commerce des mèches et autres produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Zowla, Ms. Kayi Z. has been a hairdresser by trade for ten years. She is married and has five children. She is an energetic and very devoted woman who has a good command of her work. Because her husband lacks a steady income, the family expenses fall entire upon her shoulders. In any case, the income derived from her work doesn’t allow her to cover all these needs. To bolster her business and to grow her income, she is requesting financing to do commerce in hair extensions and other beauty products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell hair extensions and beauty products in her hair salon

loans.name: Queen O.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Queen M. is 35 years old and she lives in Tukuyu. She is married with 1 child, who is only a year old. Queen has been running a tailoring business since 2004. She sews clothes, such as shirts, trousers, and dresses and then sells them in her shop.

She works at her business for 9 hours a day, 6 days a week. She works there with another member of her family. Queen currently earns about $200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 USD in order to to buy another two sewing machines for her business. In the future, she plans to employ someone to help her so she can expand her business. Queen thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To to buy another two sewing machines for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. is 49 years old and married with 6 children. She sells bicycles and bicycle spare parts. She needs the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more bicycles to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bicycles to sell

loans.name: Enachi

texts.en: Enachi Grigore is 34 years old. He is married and has a son. For 7 years Grigore has farmed his land, together with the help of his wife. He is planning to sow potatoes, melons, tomatoes and many other vegetables on his land. He is requesting this loan to purchase potato seed and mineral fertilizer to strengthen the soil. Grigore is asking for a loan of $950 USD with a term of 12 months. You could become an important part in Grigore family's life, he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him. MicroInvest also has trust in this client and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase potato seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Hilda López C., hace tres años decide abrir una librería con la ayuda del esposo en la zona de Chasquipampa, iniciando con material escolar básico, la librería se encuentra ubicada al lado de un colegio y frente a otro colegio de la zona, es así como llega a tener un gran crecimiento de mercadería, de clientes y un movimiento en época de clases continuo. 
Tiene la ambición de adquirir otro local a futuro donde tenga mas espacio y logre ofrecer una gran gama de productos escolares.
Junto a su esposo son personas muy trabajadoras y muestran seriedad en las funciones que realizan demostrando capacidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Three years ago, Hilda López C. decided to open a book store, with the help of her husband, in the Chasquipampa zone. They began by selling basic school books. The store is located next to a school and across from another school in the zone, so Hilda has been able to grow her merchandise and customers, and during the school season, this trend continues.

She hopes to acquire another location in the future so that she can have more space and offer a wider range of school products. Both she and her husband are very hardworking people, and they take their jobs seriously and execute them with skill.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bookstore

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима сотрудничает с МикроИнвест уже 4 года. За это время в ее жизни было много перемен. За счет займа, который она целенаправленно оборачивала она смогла прикупить приданное и выдать замуж свою дочь. Постоянной работы она не нашла и занятие предпринимательством для нее основной источник дохода. Фотиме 46 лет, у нее 3 детей.  Продает мелкие товары: носки платки носовые, мелкую бижутерию и тп. Фотима собирается немного расширить свой бизнес, и поэтому подала заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Fotima has been working with MicroInvest for four years. During this time there were a lot of changes in her life. Because of the loans she took which she purposefully turned over she was able to buy a dowry and have a wedding for her daughter. She has not found a permanent job and her business is the main source of income for her. Fotima is 46 years old, she has three children. She sells small items: socks, handkerchiefs, small jewelry and etc. Fotima plans to expand her business a little and this is why she applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La señora Otilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, en el distrito D. Cabanilla, D. la provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 03 hijos, ella posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 03 años, se retiró un tiempo por motivos D. salud; actualmente ella se dedica al engorD.  D. animales menores y mayores, producción D. leche; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar ovejas para engorD.. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo desea adquirir ovejas y crías D. vacunos para engorD. y crecimiento; su deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales en un corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Otilia P. T. D. T. is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“ ("Women working for development") in the district of Cabanilla, Lampa province, Puno department. She is 47 years old, is married and has three children. She has not finished primary studies, having reached only the fifth graD..

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. She retired for some time for health reasons. Now she works in raising small and large animals (fattening them) and milk production. Her first loan was of 500 nuevo soles, which she used to buy sheep to fatten.

Now she would like an additional loan of 500 nuevo soles. She promises to pay this back in 6 payments. With this loan she wants to buy calves to fatten and grow. Her wish it to see her children become professional workers soon.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small livestock (sheep) and heifers

loans.name: Rubina Kosar M. Tariq Group

texts.en:
Rubina kosar baji is a wife of M. T.. She has lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 16 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. She is the mother of two daughters. Both of her daughters are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Rubina baji wishes to give her daughters a good education, which her parents couldn’t give her. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He has 5 years of experience. Rubina baji helps him by arranging the fruit in boxes so he able to pack them easily and sell them to the fruit shops. She is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her husband’s fruit selling business.

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Sultana baji and Hanifan baji each want a loan to buy a beam shuttering business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen kosar baji wants a loan to buy material (scissors and a sewing machine) for her tailoring center. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: In this picture Parveen kosar baji shows a cushion, the cover of which was sewed by her husband.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Iris Amelia

texts.es: Doña Iris Amelia  está solicitando su 1er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (ponerle cielo razo a la casa y acondicionar habitacion), trabaja como Responsable de recursos Humanos en la corte suprema de justicia en  la Zona Urbana de Nueve Guinea desde hace 2 años y siete meses, esta clienta  tiene un  hijo de 10 el cual estudia su 5to grado de educacion primaria, su esposo trabaja en la alcaldia de el Almendro como consejal, ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos, ella  los dias de la semana vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea en el Barrio Linda Vista este barrio recientemente se pobló y cada día se va aumentando su población y los fines de semana se va para su casa en el Almendro, ya que por la distancia no puede viajar todos los dias,  Iris es una mujer profesional  con alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral,  responsable,  que ama su trabajo,  su sueño  es estudiar el proximo año una maestría,  tener estabilidad, salud  y tener su casa con todas la condiciones  como todo cuidadano aspira, pues es el patrimonio de su hijo.
texts.en:
Iris Amelia is asking for her first loan to improve her home (put a ceiling in the house and fix up a room). She has worked in human resources in the supreme court of justice in the Urbana de Nueve Guinea zone for two years and six months. She has a ten year old son who is in the fifth grade of elementary school. Her husband works in the Almendro town hall as a councilman. They both share the home expenses. Because of her commitments, during the week she lives in the urban zone of Nueva Guinea in the Linda Vista neighborhood.
