This neighborhood is recently populated, and every day the population is increasing. On the week ends she goes to her house in Almendro. It is too great a distance to travel every day. Iris is a professional woman with a great spirit for personal and work improvement. She is responsible, and she loves her work. Her dream is to next year study for her master’s degree, have stability, health, and have a house with all of the conditions that a citizen aspires to. It is, after all, her son’s legacy.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put in a ceiling and fix up a room

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Margaret is a food vendor dealing in pastries. She says she serves orders from customers and also supplies to provisions stores. Margaret also hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community to sell. She has been in business for two years.

Margaret buys her materials from Kumasi. She wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru: Махмудова Башорат 1964 года рождения, имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Торгует в Чкаловске 6 лет бижутерией. Она начинала свой бизнес с  продажи семечек , сигарет и жвачек на небольшом прилавке. После получения кредита постепенно увеличила свой  товарооборот.  Первый кредит получила 2003 года на расширение  своей точки. Теперь благодарна КИВА за поддержку и увеличения капитала.
texts.en:
Bashorat M. was born in 1964, has four children and has a secondary-school education. She has been trading in jewelry in Chkalovsk for six years. She began her business selling sunflower seeds, cigarettes, and chewing gum from a small table. After receiving a loan, she gradually increased her trade turnover. She received her first loan in 2003 in order to expand the table which she sells from. Now, thanks to Kiva's support, she has been able to increase her capital.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics and  jewelry

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes S. Blandón tiene 63 años. Es una mujer soltera. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo que todavía dependen de ella. La actividad económica de Mercedes es una panadería en donde realiza la elaboración de pasteles. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Desde muy joven le gustaba el trabajo. Por lo que siente muy orgullosa por desempeñar esta actividad tan humilde y que le ha proporcionado todo lo necesario como el pan de cada día, ya que fue con este negocio que logro ofrecerles a sus hijos alimento, calzado ropa y estudio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, leña, harina, mantequilla, queso, huevos y gastos de luz y agua. El sueño de Mercedes es mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mercedes S. Blandón is 63 years old. She is a single woman. She has four children in her care who still depend on her. Mercedes' economic activity is a bakery where she makes cakes. She has been dedicated to this job for more than 15 years. She has liked working since she was young. So, she feels very proud to work in a humble role that provides everything that is necessary such as daily bread since it was with this business that she was able to offer her children food, clothing and education. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase sugar, firewood, flour, butter, cheese, eggs and pay the water and electricity bills. Mercedes' dream is to improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es: Urania  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar la casa), trabaja como docente de la Esc. Rubén Darío # 2, vive en la colonia La Unión de Nueva Guinea, tiene un  hijo de 6 años estudia pres escolar,  es una joven que ha luchado para que a su ancianos padres no les falte nada ya que ella es una hija muy responsable con sus padres,  es una mujer profesional, responsable, honesta,  trabajadora , profesa  la religión católica, sueña con tener un porvenir mejor, estudiar una maestria,  tener una vivienda bonita, trabajo, y seguir ayudando a sus padres.
texts.en:
Urania is asking for her third loan, to invest in the improvement of her home (to plaster the house). She teaches at the Ruben Dario School #2. She lives in La Union, Nueva Guinea, and has a six-year-old son in preschool. She is a young woman who has fought so that her elderly parents have everything they need, since she is a responsible daughter. She is a professional, responsible, honest, hard-working, Catholic woman. She dreams of having a better future, studying for a masters degree, having a nice home, working, and continuing to help her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plastering her house

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of Masabod,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosemarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Rosa es casada, tiene 37 años y 7 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de rosa son educar a sus hijos y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the community bank, Banco Comunal Paraíso.

Rosa is married, 37 years old and has 7 children. Rosa has a store in her home from which she sells groceries, vegetables and fruits. She works everyday with the help of her husband.

Rosa needs a loan of 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Rosa’s dreams are to educate her children and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras (Women Entrepreneurs) Group

texts.en:
This group of women is from the San Pedro district of Encarnación. The members of the group work in a variety of businesses and industries, including cosmetics sales, hair salons, restaurants, food sales, lingerie sales, and the garment industry. They will receive different loan amounts, each between 300,000 and 500,000.

Each woman will apply her individual loan toward her business needs.

loans.use: To strengthen the businesses of the women in this group

loans.name: G.s. El Labrador Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario El Labrador tiene 2 integrantes que luchan cada día por salir adelante Francisco R. Q. y Haydalina R. Q.. Ambos tienen la misma actividad económica, ellos tienen mucho tiempo con este negocio ya que  fueron con esfuerzos propios. Francisco tiene muchas amistades en su comarca por lo que es de gran ayuda para él, ya que cuando sale a  buscar sus cerdos para el destace siempre obtiene un precio mucho más favorable. Anteriormente no tenía mucha producción porque no tenía capital suficiente, pero al notar que su demanda aumento entonces decide trabajar con Haydalina y juntos fueron creciendo por medio de los financiamientos. Ya que en la actualidad recurren a Fundación León 2000 en busca de un financiamiento que les sea de ayuda para sus negocio
texts.en:
El Grupo Solidario El Labrador (“The Jointly Liable Farmers Group”) has two members who struggle each day to get ahead, Francisco R. Q. and Haydalina R. Q.. Both have been in the same business on their own for a long time. Francisco has a lot of friends in his district which is a big help for him since when it is time to butcher his pigs he always receives a much more favorable price. Previously, he didn’t have much production because he didn’t have sufficient capital, but, noting that his demand increased, he decided to work with Haydalina and together their business is growing by means of financing. Currently, they are applying to Fundación León 2000 for a loan that will be of help to them in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden J. is currently in the business of selling cakes and groundnut phaste (peanuts ground into a paste) and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to sell. Kiden is 30 years old and is married to a policeman. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline B. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale in the community. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jacqueline joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional feed products to sell. Jacqueline is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, Alma B. and her husband want to send their three children to school so that they will find good jobs someday. They sacrifice their time and endure hardships for the sake of their children. The family lives in the village of Barangay Capatan, Tuguegarao City.

As a way of making a living, Alma's husband cultivates a farm lot, planting rice and vegetables, and sometimes he manages a blacksmith business. Alma sells snacks and vegetables in their village to help her husband make income. She wants to sell more snacks and vegetables but she doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, she wants to borrow 5,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders to be used to improve her small business. She hopes that with patience and sacrifice, and with this financial assistance, she can make her business grow.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending business

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
La señora Valeriana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 60 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Valeriana no estudió y se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 10 años atrás y su primer préstamo fue D.  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. dos ovejas criollas y un chancho.
Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/.2,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà dos vacas.
Su deseo para el futuro es vivir tranquila sin preocupaciones.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Valeriana is a member of the San Juan Community Bank in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She 60 years old, married, and has four children. Valeriana did not attend school and works in the purchase and sale of livestock. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for ten years and her first loan was for 300 PEN which allowed her to buy two Creole sheep and one pig. She is requesting a loan of 2,500 PEN with which she will buy two cows. Her wish for the future is to live a tranquil life without preoccupations. What she most likes about her organization are the savings and the meetings with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two cows

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn R. is from the village of Becor, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Merlyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing net. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her fishing net

loans.name: Wilma's Group

texts.en: Wilma A. is from the village of Remus, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 46 years old. Wilma is the group leader of an 18-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Wilma is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma raises pigs for sale. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 23 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the second loan taken out by Wilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ana Isaura

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa, la señora Ana Isaura M. se dedica a atender su propia pulpería que posee siendo ésta la que le permite obtener los ingresos para el desarrollo y bienestar de su familia. Ella es una dama muy trabajadora que comienza a laborar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el anochecer atendiendo a sus clientes que le visitan para la compra de los productos de pulpería.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lacteos, entre otros. Espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así continuar en su actividad.
texts.en:
Ana Isaura M. has a small grocery store in Chichigalpa, which is her only source of income and provides for the development and well-being of her family. She is a very hard-working woman, who starts her workday very early in the morning and continues until nighfall tending to her customers, who visit her to buy items from her store. She is requesting funding to buy basic stock items like: rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, among others. She hopes that the loan will be approved so that she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: K. Elisabeth est née vers 1978 à Avrankou dans le département de l’Ouémé mais vit depuis 12 ans à Kadjacomé, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin.  Mariée à AYABA Jean-Marie, un soudeur, Elisabeth est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés.  Elisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Elisabeth n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Elisabeth vend de l’akassa (aliment local préparé à base d’amidon de maïs) accompagné du poisson à son domicile.  Parallèlement à cette activité, Elisabeth a un moulin à piments, qui lui procure un certain revenu. Elisabeth exerce cette activité depuis 12 ans.  Elisabeth s’approvisionne en maïs et en poissons à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Elisabeth a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Elisabeth sollicite un troisième crédit en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Elisabeth K. was born in 1978 in Avrankou in the "département" (administrative division) of Ouémé; she has however lived for the past 12 years in Kadjacomé in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin. Married to Jean-Marie AYABA, a welder, Elisabeth has five children, all of whom are at school. Elisabeth lives together with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Elisabeth has never been to school. In order to meet her needs she sells "akassa" (a local dish made from corn starch) together with fish at her home. In parallel with this activity, Elisabeth has a pepper mill, which brings in some income. She has been carrying out this activity for the past 12 years. She gets her supplies of corn and fish in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Elisabeth has already had two loans from ALIDé which she has paid back without incident. She is applying for a third loan in order to increase her stock and to boost her income.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Patriselda

texts.en:
Patriselda T. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut phase and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Patriselda is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and onoins to sell.

loans.name: Doflin

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Adjarra dans le département de l'Ouémé, H. Doflin vit depuis 15 ans environs à Adjarra - Tossouhou à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à KPINKPONSOUHOU Hounsouhoui, un guérisseur,  Doflin est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble et le couple assure les différentes charges familiales. Il y a près de 15 ans que Doflin vend des céréales (maïs, haricot, etc.) au marché de Adjarra. De façon secondaire, Doflin vend également du poisson. C'est à Ikpinlè, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin, que Doflin fait ses provisions. Doflin a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Doflin sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Adjarra, in Ouémé County, H. Doflin has lived for about fifteen years in Adjarra – Tossouhou, in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to KPINKPONSOUHOU Hounsouhoui, a healer, she is the mother of four children, who are all in school. The family lives together, and the couple ensure that their various family expenses are covered. For almost fifteen years ago, Dolfin has been selling grains (corn, beans, etc.) at the Adjarra market. Secondarily, she also sells fish. She gets her provisions from Ikpinlè, a market selling staple goods in Benin. She has already obtained two loans from ALIDé and has repaid them both. She's requesting a third loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and responding better to the burgeoning number of demands from customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fairly used clothes to sell

loans.name: Bwamukama Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
K. Sophia is a vibrant woman with the firm courage of her convictions. The 26-year-old engaging mother of one had to dispense with and take exception to all the entrenched stereotypes associated with the fishmonger business in order to get established. She has a strong sense of self-esteem and this was her secret stock in trade.

At length, and to all appearances, Sophia has achieved some tides of success as her business as a fishmonger now brings her profits adding up to 100,000 shillings a month. Her business with her modest earnings is, in her own estimation, now standing in good stead.

Sophia principally sells dried and smoked fish. Season in, season out, she has made headway in a business flagged off its feet by her husband. Prior to bearing a hand in this business, she was a farmer. Her only child, as one of the testaments of her success, is now going to school.

With this loan coming her way, Sophia foresees her flood tide of success continuing as she says she will be able to buy more quality fish to sell. She also wants to increase the supplies of fresh fish to her stall.

loans.use: To make a downpayment to fish suppliers to increase the fresh-fish supplies to her business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Carmen tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 15 años. Hace más de 13 años se dedica  en la venta de productos comestibles, por lo que tiene un puesto de venta en el interior de su casa, lugar donde hay mucha circulación de gente. Cada vez que va adquirir los productos para abastecer su negocio, su hija es quien la ayuda en esa labor, de esa manera evita ser víctima de asalto. Desde entonces trabajan juntas y se esfuerzan cada vez más para sacar adelante su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad, es que logra conocer mucha gente. Su mayor anhelo es incrementar su negocio con variados productos. Este es su diecisieteavo crédito con  MFP, por tanto promete ser cumplida con sus pagos como hasta ahora, ya que no le gusta tener deudas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old, and is a very cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 15 year-old daughter. For more than 13 years she has been selling food products; she has a food stall set up in part of her home, which is in an area where lots of people pass through. Each time she goes to buy products to supply her store her daughter helps her, so she can avoid becoming a victim of assault. Ever since they have worked together they have worked hard to make the business succeed. What she likes most about her business is that she gets to know a lot of people. Her main wish is to expand her business with a variety of products. This is her 17th loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments as she has always done up until now, because she doesn't like to have debts. With the loan she requests, she will invest in the purchase of products to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products to supply her store

loans.name: José Leoncio

texts.es:
José Leoncio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a la agricultura  y comercio, que con sus ingresos apoya a la economía domestica, ellos tienen 4 hijos, mayores de edad, pero apoyan a sus padres en las tareas del campo.
Desde hace 20 años se dedican a los trabajos de las cosechas, dentro de sus planes a corto plazo esta diversificación de las siembras, por otras que tenga un alto índice de consumo, para este propósito solicita un préstamo,  para la compra de materiales agrícolas (fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas, materiles vegetales en general), que permitan un excelente mantenimiento de los terrenos con el fin de sembrar nuevos cosechas, esta inversión apoyara a sus proyectos de nuevas fuentes de ingresos, que favorezcan a su economía familiar.
texts.en:
José Leoncio is 55 years old, and married. His wife dedicates herself to farming and sales, and her income helps support the household. They have 4 grown children who help out with the farm-related tasks. For 20 years, they have dedicated themselves to the work of harvesting crops. Their short-term plans include diversifying the types of crops they grow, and switch to others that have a high rate of consumption. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural products (fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, and other general items) that would allow them to maintain their lands and plant new crops. This investment would support their intent to find new sources of income, which will favorably support the household.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products (fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, and other general farming products).

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene Sánchez Quiroz  es una señora de 42 años de edad la cual vive  con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico,  ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; reconocida como una comunidad amiga de la tranquilidad  y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería  y turismo. 

Desde hace varios  años Marlene  se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos.  Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.
 Actualmente Marlene está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢629.000 (seiscientos veinte  nueve mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.

Marlene  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer Crédito y manifiesta que esta muy contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de desarrollo que le brinda las ECC  a la comunidad y a ella.
texts.en:
Marlene Sánchez Quiroz is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 4 children, in a rural Costa Rican community called Abanico, located in San Isidro de Penas Blancas, San Ramon, in the Alajuela province. It is known as a friendly and peaceful community dedicated to productive activities such as agriculture, livestock and tourism. For several years Marlene has raised chickens to fatten them up, and laying hens for meat and egg production. She sells her products to her neighbours, who are very satisfied. She says that having the support and help of her husband has helped her to continue with this project. She also says that this work is very interesting since she has seen her business grow little by little and the demand is greater every time. Marlene is now requesting a microloan of 629 000 colones for the purchase of more chickens and hens; concentrate and products for the treatment of illnesses; and also to expand and reinforce her location. With this, she hopes to make her business grow more and to improve her quality of life. Her business is going well but a lack of money has stopped its further growth. With the requested loan she hopes to increase her sales and to thus improve her family's economic condition. Marlene is part of the Credito Communal de Abanico Group, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she says that she is very happy and grateful for the development opportunity offered by these groups to her and her community.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens, food, pens

loans.name: Mrs. Ear Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. EA. C. is 48 years old. She has been selected as the group leader by seventeen people who are seeking a group loan. The group is located in Prey Ba Soeng village in Takeo province. Each member of this group will use his/her portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. EA. C. and her husband, Mr. K. C., are farmers who own 1.5 hectares of land. They cultivate rice and vegetables to earn a small income to support their family's daily needs. In order to support this farm, Mrs. EA. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide for her crops. This couple has three children, all of whom are students and also support their parents' farming activities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
El señor Gumercindo E. M. es padre de 3 hijos a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Él quiere terminar de construir un cuarto de su vivienda que ha estado realizando poco a poco con ahorros; se encuentra en la etapa de la losa de concreto, para ya habitar ese cuarto y así tener más espacio.
Gumercindo y su esposa trabajan en una maquiladora para poder cubrir los gastos y dar un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Gumercindo E. M. is the father of 3 children to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. He wants to finish building a room that he has built little by little with savings. He is currently working on puttinga concret floor down to use the room and thus have more space in his home. Gumercindo and his wife work in a factory to be able to cover expenses and give a good education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elabaración de la losa de concreto del cuarto.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita A. is from the village of Burgos, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Nenita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nenita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Franklin Jose

texts.es:
El  Sr. Franklin F. M., trabaja para el centro de insumos para la salud y trabaja como Recibidor –Entregador del almacén D-1 de la dirección de Distribución.
El es padre de familia de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
El trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Arena, cemento y hierro para la construir un muro en la parte delantera de su casa.
texts.en:
Franklin F. M. works for the ‘Centro de Insumos para la Salud’ (a medical supply warehouse) as a receiver and shipper in warehouse D-1 in the distribution department.

He is the father of a family with two school-aged children.

He works from Monday to Friday, 8 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon.

The loan requested is for the purchase of construction materials such as: sand, cement, and iron to build a wall in the front part of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, and iron

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Mr S. Komi est né en 1977 à Gapé-Adido dans la préfecture du Zio. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, il vit actuellement à Adam-kondji avec sa famille. Brave cultivateur et grand producteur de charbon de bois, il est surtout exploitant de moulins à maïs dans le Canton de Gapé. Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter et installer un nouveau moulin et réparer d’autres en panne. Cela va surtout lui permettre de couvrir les besoins de certaines zones et de rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en: Mr S. Komi est né en 1977 à Gapé-Adido dans la préfecture du Zio. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, il vit actuellement à Adam-kondji avec sa famille. Brave cultivateur et grand producteur de charbon de bois, il est surtout exploitant de moulins à maïs dans le Canton de Gapé. Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter et installer un nouveau moulin et réparer d’autres en panne. Cela va surtout lui permettre de couvrir les besoins de certaines zones et de rentabiliser son activité.

loans.use: acheter et installer un nouveau moulin et réparer d’autres en panne

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana lives in a mid-sized Pakistani city called Vehari. She moved there when she married her husband, M. A., and now lives in a small three-room brick house. She is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of household responsibilities, but also leads this six-person loan group. She is not educated because her parents couldn’t afford to send her to school, and needed her at home to help take care of chores and cook food. This experience has made her a good wife and mother who is widely respected in her community. 
 
Her husband is a private entrepreneur who runs a shop where he sells fruit, buying it wholesale and making a good profit by selling it retail in a local market. Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help expand her husband’s business. He will use this loan to buy fruit in bulk and increase his sales. Rukhsana hopes that this investment will be a great help for her husband’s business and mean an improved life for her family.

loans.use: To buy fruits in quantity for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya, where he has been farming for 15 years. His mixed farm produces tea, maize and beans which are sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the needs of his family. His primary challenges are drought and diseases which affects his crops and animals.

He has requested this loan of 40,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and feed a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. The health of his family will improve since the family will have enough milk for consumption. In future, he would like to expand his tea farm and increase the number of dairy cows to 4.

Charles is 47 years old. He is married with 5 school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and feed a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sebastiana Cristina

texts.es:
Sebastiana R. García es una persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación de venta de nacatamales y fritanga, ella trabaja junto con su mama en la elaboración de los nacatamales y las fritanga que hace los fines de semana. Ella es una persona sencilla y con buenos principios morales.
Es madre de familia de  tres hijos y solo uno dependen de ella y este se encuentra en el colegio.
El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los nacatamales y la fritanga para su negocio.
Sebastiana R. ha trabajado 7 préstamos con la institución y estos han sido para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sebastiana R. García is an enterprising woman.  She has a business in her house selling “nacatamales” (steamed meat and vegetable pastry, cooked in banana or maize leaves) and fried food.  She works with her mother making the nacatamales and fried food on the week-ends.  She is an unassuming woman with good moral principles.  She has three children, but only one is dependent upon her.  This child goes to high school.

She wants the loan to buy ingredients for making the nacatamales and fried foods for her business.  Sebastiana R. has worked with the institution on seven loans.  These loans have been to buy goods for her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make nacatamales and fried food.

loans.name: Leonarda Migdalia

texts.es: Leonarda Migdalia tiene 40 años su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy beneficioso para su familia tiene 4 hijos menores de edad, ella ha sido muy responsable ya que ha demostrado  mantener este negocio activo. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos y otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y al mismo tiempo quiere mejorar las ganancias para aumentar su inventario.
texts.en: Leonarda Migdalia is 40 years old.  Her business activity is selling general merchandise.  She has had her business for more than 5 years and it has been very beneficial for her family.  She has 4 dependent children.  Leonarda has been very responsible since she has shown herself able to keep her business active.  She will use her loan to buy footwear, clothes, cosmetics and other items.  She dreams of improving her business and, at the same time, she would like to improve her profits so that she can increase her inventory.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
El Señor Román V. S. es padre de 5 hijos a los cuales apoya y ayuda en su educación, el trabaja con la tienda más de 4 años aproximadamente lo cual le ayuda a desenvolverse en la actividad a la cual se dedica y también se dedica a la agricultura con pequeños cultivos los cuales son indispensables ya que solo le alcanza para poder sobrevivir, el se levanta a muy tempranas horas para ir a trabajar en el chaco para poder llevar el pan de cada dia, también trabaja como peón en algunas ocasiones porque con la actividad que tienes no es suficiente para poder dar una buena comodidad a su familia.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería para tienda de abarrotes y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Roman V. is a father of 5 children who he supports and helps in their studies. He has worked in the store approximately more than 4 years. He also has small crops since they are sufficient enough to survive. He wakes up very early to work in the farmlands to be able to deliver the bread everyday. He also occasionally works as an assistant because the job he has isn't enough to offer his family a comfortable standard of living.

This is the first loan he obtains from our institution which will be used to buy merchandise for a grocery store and improve the service for clients which in turn will increase profits and his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina V.  Garcia es una microempresaria exitosa de la zona de los chiles de la Alajuela.
Hace 5 años  ella tuvo el deseo y coraje de  crear su propio negocio, fue asi como nació su Pulperia (tienda General) con la que logrado sacar adelante a sus dos Hijos.
Ella necesita que su negocio crezca, es por eso que solicita ₡600 000 (seiscientos mil colones) para  la compra de mercadería, especialmente Abarrotes y artículos para el hogar. Ella quiere que a su familia nunca le haga falta nada.
Ellas es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Cristina V. Garcia is a successful small businesswoman in the canton of Los Chiles in the province of Alajuela.  Five years ago she had the desire and courage to start her own business. This is how her general store was born and how she has been able to provide for her children.  She is requesting a loan for ₡600,000 (six hundred thousand colones) to buy merchandise, especially groceries and household items, in order to increase her business.  She never wants her family to have to go without.  

She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe [Santa Fe Communal Credit Company], one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Peang

texts.en: Peang Chornourn, 34, is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Chornourn is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 11 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. Chornourn is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.en:
Marufjon is married with two children. He started his business selling general goods 10 years ago. Financial assistance from IMON International has helped Marufjon develop and expand his business. Marufjon is planning to use this loan of 7,000 TJS to purchase additional goods to expand his assortment. He believes a variety of merchandise will boost his sales and help him generate additional profit. Marufjon’s goal is to continue refining his business skills so that he can keep his venture growing and provide for his family's needs. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing more goods to expand his assortment

loans.name: Victor Ramon

texts.es:
Don Víctor García es casado con dos personas a su cargo trabaja en Lotería Nacional como Guarda de seguridad vigilando las Instalaciones del Lugar.
El crédito que solicita es para compra de uniformes escolares pago de la universidad de su hija y otros gastos familiares.
texts.en: Víctor García is married and supports two people through his work as a security guard at the national lottery office.  He is asking for this loan in order to buy school uniforms, pay his daughter’s college tuition, and other family expenses.

loans.use: Education expenses

loans.name: Aura Sofia

texts.es:
Este es el tercer financiamiento que la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo le hace a Aura O.  B.  y actualmente su segundo credikiva, con el que planea comprar vestidos y accesorios  infantiles al por mayor y de contado. Ella se encuentra muy contenta porque cada vez que ella invierte en su negocio su capital se incrementa y responde mas rápido a sus clientes porque maneja una mejor liquidez y con su esposo persiste en el trabajo porque su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales exitosos. 

Si usted conocer la historia de Aura O. puede acceder al siguiente enlace:

http://www.kiva.org/lend/204781
texts.en:
Aura O. B. is receiving her third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which is her second through Kiva.  She plans to buy clothing and baby accessories in bulk and with cash.  Aura is extremely satisfied because each time she invests in her business, her capital increases and she is able to respond more quickly to her customers.  She is able to handle her liquidity better, which allows her husband to focus on his work.  Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.  

To read more about Juana’s story, please click on the following link:   http://www.kiva.org/lend/204781

loans.use: Purchase clothing & baby accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes and baskets of tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and other improtant things for her business

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is currently in the business of selling paste. She is 38 years old, married and has 4 children who all go to school. Lona took a loan to stock more paste to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more paste to sell.

loans.name: Esteban Proto Miranda Suescun

texts.es:
Esteban lleva 30 años trabajando día a día como vendedor ambulante desde las 6:00a.m. Hasta las 6:00p.m. A pesar de ser un vendedor ambulante desde hace 3 años se radico en un mismo sector donde sus productos se venden con muy buenos resultados, él vende legumbres de cosecha por lo cual hay temporadas donde los resultados no llegan sus expectativas.
 
Se siente orgulloso y contento por ser independiente, aunque a veces no cuenta con el capital para comprar mercancía, ya que periódicamente don Esteban debe surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Esteban has worked day by day for 30 years as a traveling salesman from 6:00a.m.  to  6:00p.m.  In spite of being a traveling salesman, he has been located in the same sector for 3 years, where his products are sold with very good results.  He sells vegetable crops for which there are seasons when the results do not reach his expectations.  

He feels proud and happy at being independent, although at times he can not rely on having the capital to buy merchandise, since periodically Don Esteban must re-supply his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his fruit and vegetable business

loans.name: Lynett

texts.en:
Lynett lives in Sto. Niño in South Cotabato with her family. She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 10. Lynett and her husband are both farmers. They have been growing rice for 10 years.

Lynett does her best to keep their farm productive. She also wants to find ways to help augment their income. She plans to raise pigs to sell to achieve that purpose.

Lynett's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, piglets and feeds

loans.name: Donis Francisco

texts.es:
Donis, nacido en la comunidad Santa Rosa – La Rica comarca de Yali, tiene  36 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos, de oficio agricultor el se dedica a la siembra de café . Inicio trabajando en la siembra de frijol y maíz  para ese entonces el tenia 15 años de edad, el ayudaba a su papa en las labores agrícolas, después su papa le ayudo a sembrar 2 manzanas de café así ha venido manteniendo a su familia, sus hijos estudian. Cuando las cosechas  están bajas el se dedica a vender granos básicos, el no pudo estudiar pues el acceso a las escuelas eran distancias muy lejanas.  
El solicito el crédito para mantenimiento 2 manzanas de siembra de café .De esta inversión espera poder sacar una buena producción de calidad y rendimiento, venderlo a un buen precio el quintal de cafe. El tiene entre sus planes aumentar las aéreas de la siembra para cafe. Tiene como próxima meta comercializar en mayor cantidad granos básicos, construir una bodega para almacenar café.
texts.en:
Donis, 36, was born in the community of Santa Rosa-La Rica, Yali.   He’s married and has four children.  He’s a coffee planter.  He started out farming beans and corn when he was 15 years old; he helped his father do the farming chores.  Later, his father helped him plant two manzanas (Central American measure of area) of coffee and this is how he’s been supporting his family; his children all go to school.  When harvests are low he goes into basic grain sales.  He was unable to go to school because schools were too far away.

He asked for the loan to care for his coffee crops.  From this investment he hopes to attain a good production both with respect to quality and quantity and to sell it for a good price.  

Among his plans is expanding the area he plants.  His next goal is to sell larger amounts of basic grains and to build a warehouse to store coffee.

loans.use: to care for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, age 23, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Chenda is a housewife and raises pigs while her husband, who is a construction worker, earns an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has improved since Chenda’s husband has had this business. Chenda is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her brother to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her brother to commute to work.

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.en:
Makhsuda is a hardworking woman who is married. Her husband works in Russia. For 10 years Makhsuda has been running her cattle-feeding and farming business. She cultivates potatoes, carrots, Lucerne and corn. Also Makhsuda engaged in gardening. From the profit which she hopes to make she plans to marry off her grandson. Her son, daughter and daughter-in-law help her in this business. Makhsuda would like to get a loan of 13,000 TJS for purchasing of cattle and expansion of her business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is married with one child. She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. Ellen is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizers. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Ellen hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Klubo

texts.en:
Klubo is 34 and lives in Paynesville. She's married and her husband is a builder; they have four children between the ages of 12-20, all of whom live at home and attend school. 

Klubo sells a wide range of dried goods from her home including rice, red oil, salt, fish, meat, spices, and charcoal amongst others. She enjoys selling to customers as it enables her to help her children. Her main challenge is running the business whilst looking after the children. 

She's requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and dried goods. She would like to own her own shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs and dried goods

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widowed woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a business selling firewood, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her livelihood. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jessica requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment. Jessica has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: 12.7 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo is 44-years-old and married with two children. She lives in Thanh Hoa City, which is a semi-urban area in the Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 12.7 Nam Ngan solidarity group, which has three members.  

Mrs Thảo operates a food stall selling snacks, and she has been involved in this business for five years. Her main hardship is that she has a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been selling second-hand clothes for the last six years in Kiambu town. She is 41 years old and married to Waithaka. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to add to her stock of trousers, shirts and sweaters.

In future Caroline hopes to buy piglets for rearing and also a dairy cow.

loans.use: to add to her stock of used trousers, shirts and sweaters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 36, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Nida has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and electronic loads from several networks like GLOBE and SMART. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to more buy canned goods, snacks, beverages and electronic loads.

Nida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, beverages and electronic loads.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is married and is the mother of a son and a daughter.  Her daughter works in a factory while her son is studying in the 9th class.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to his passengers, which also include school children in his community. 

Perveen is an embroidery expert. She prepares beautiful-looking embroidered clothes for her clients for reasonable rates. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. 

Perveen  has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery materials in bulk quantity to allow her to make different kinds of beautiful-looking embroidered clothes and increase her sales and profits. She is very confident that this investment will help improve her business and also the living standard of her family.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Eufemia Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Eufemia es una mujer casada, madre D. 6 hijos ya todos mayores D. edad e independientes; la Sra. Eufemia es una mujer que a su edad sigue luchando por salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras en el mercado central D. Camaná, ya lleva en este negocio mas D. 10 años, escogió este tipo D. trabajo porque sus familiares hace 25 años llevan trabajando en el mismo negocio. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la ampliación D. su negocio y así poder progresar mucho más. Su principal sueño D. la Sra. Eufemia es ver a todos sus nietos profesionales. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que ello contribuye a su desarrollo comercial.
texts.en: Mrs. Eufemia is married and the mother of six children, all of whom are adults and independent.  At her age, Eufemia continues to struggle to get ahead selling vegetables at the central market in Camaná.  She has been in business for over ten years.  The reason she chose this type of work was that her family has been in the same business for 25 years.  The loan she has requested will be used to expand her business so she can progress even further.  Eufemia's main goal is to see all her grandchildren become professionals.  She is very grateful for the loan since it will contribute to her commercial development.

loans.use: To buy goods (fruit and vegetables) to expand her business.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is married and aged 32. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She has been farming for the last four years to make a living. Since the climate is favorable, she has become successful in her farming business. 

In the next five years, she plans to expand her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer and seeds. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 35, resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. He provides driving training services.

Sophy is requesting a loan of 700 U.S. Dollars (USD) to purchase a car to expand his driving training services. By doing so, his family will be able to generate more income. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase a car to expand his business.

loans.name: Nohad

texts.en:
Nohad is an undergraduate Lebanese woman. She’s 25 years old, single, and living with her parents and two siblings. Her father is their main source of income and they all depend on him. She has been giving private lessons from her home for the past six years. 

Today, she’s asking for a loan of $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay her educational fees in order to graduate and pursue her Master’s degree.  She notes that this may enhance her way of teaching and help her attract more students. 

In the future, she plans to open her own learning center and hire well educated people to work for her.

loans.use: to pay her educational fees

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Letecia is 50 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Letecia has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: The Eschol Brook Group

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Teddy from Norton, Harare. He is married and has two children.  Teddy runs a retail business selling books and stationery. The business has been in operation for 2 years.  He says the main challenges he faces are the high cost of stationery during school days and the low demand during school holidays. 

Teddy has requested a loan of $400 to buy diaries, bibles and academic books for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the general welfare of his family. In the future, Teddy plans to be the major supplier of books to all the schools in his Norton community.

loans.use: to buy stationery and bibles to resell

loans.name: Kipkoech

texts.en:
Kipkoech is 29-years of age, married to Caroline and they have two children. He has been operating a retail shop for the last 3 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 1,500. 

He is requesting a second loan from KADET of Kes 15,000. He plans to use this loan amount to add more stock of diminishing items like detergents, soft drinks and cooking fats and to use the anticipated profits to accumulate savings to expand his shop. 

He hopes to use his business as a foundation to open a big supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal, 38 years old, is a housewife who began a small business in her home yard selling detergents and clothes. Amal buys different types of detergents in large quantities in gallons and re-fills it in smaller amounts in bottles so it can be sold. Now Amal has applied for a loan to increase the amount of detergent she has and to buy more bottles so she can start distributing to closer shops.

loans.use: to buy more detergents and bottles for refilling

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: María Guadalupe vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo; ella posee una piñatería y tiene varios años de tener el negocio vende piñatas en variedad, de todos los estilos y al gusto del cliente además de otros artículos como gorros, bolsa para dulces, confeti, dulces entre otros, el negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio María se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad; es una mujer dedicada a su labor, visionaria, con muchas metas que desea alcanzar y trabajara duro para lograrlo sabe que solo así obtendrá el éxito;  uno de sus más grandes objetivos es hacer crecer el negocio y al mismo tiempo aumentar sus ganancias, necesita de un apoyo de capital para invertir en insumos por eso solicito a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar papel, alambre, pegamento, gorros, dulces, confeti, etc. María Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: papel, alambre, pegamento, gorros, dulces, confeti

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y con mucho esfuerzo a logrado sacar adelante a su hijo, sobre todo porque para Rosa su hijo es lo más importante que tiene en la vida. La vivienda de rosa se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de uva, espárragos, paprika, entre otros.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de juguetes, desde muy temprano Rosa se levanta con muchos ánimos para ir a su negocio, al cual le dedica 8 horas diarias  y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos llamativos y a un buen precio.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como scoters ya que tiene varios pedidos; de esta manera podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a su hijo y seguir luchando para poder ser una gran microempresaria”.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old, a single mother who with a lot of effort has managed to bring up her son, and to Rosa her son is above all the most important thing that she has in life. Rosa’s home is in the city of Ica, which is characterized as having a warm and friendly climate, and at the same time for its agricultural development, especially the cultivation of grapes, asparagus, paprika, and more.

Through a lot of effort and with savings she was able to start her toy business. Rosa gets up very early with a lot of enthusiasm to go to work where she works 8 hours assisting up to 10 customers a day. She thinks that it is going well because she is friendly to the customers and most of all because she offers appealing products at a good price.

Rosa is very grateful for the Kiva loans and thanks to the help they have provided she is able to buy merchandise for her business such as scooters for which she has some orders. This is the way she can have a better variety of products to offer her customers and continue fighting to reach her biggest dream of providing her son a good profession and  to continue struggling to become a great micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy games for her toy business

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay county.  Caren is married and has seven children. She has been farming for forty years and is currently growing maize, groundnuts, lentils, beans, sunflower and amaranth. Caren likes beekeeping because it is not labor-intensive and still provides good returns.  She thinks that “beekeeping, being a new project at my old age, will change my life.” 

This is Karen’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to pay school fees for her grandchildren. Her message to Kiva lenders is “thank them a lot for considering even the old.”

loans.use: To buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Kpedo Group

texts.fr: KPEDO  est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marcelline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 28  ans. Marcelline a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Marcelline, célibataire vit seule et assure toute seule ces différents besoins.  Pour cette raison, Marcelline vend des friperies de façon ambulante depuis six ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face à ses besoins. Marcelline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marcelline sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe KPEDO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des friperies.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Reylen is 18 years old and is 1st of five children in the family. Her mother Belen supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Reylen is studying for her Bachelor of Science of Business Administration and is currently on her 2nd of this 4-year course. Belen is borrowing PHP 7,400 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Reylen for the second semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Reylen plans to be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es: Es una señora afable de 35 años de edad, pertenece a la  etnia Miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casada con 3 hijos: 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y un pequeño de 3 años. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como pescador artesanal. Ella trabaja como docente de educación primaria.  Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda segura, solicita financiamiento para construir el cerco de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el préstamo comprara: madera, clavo, clavos y grapas. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa de concreto (cemento), porque es de mayor durabilidad y para brindarle mejores condiciones a sus hijos.

loans.use: para construir el cerco de su vivienda de tambo y madera

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane wants to buy more ginger, spinach, carrots, godgets, cauliflower, lettuce and garlic

loans.name: Pelelina

texts.en: Peleina O. was born on the 20th of August 1973.  She has eight children, five are in school, and three are staying home.  Peleina's husband and her three brothers are helping her out to clean her vegetable garden.  She has done a great job by improving her business in buying equipment from her loan.  Peleina has given all her effort in doing her business.  She said running this business is not an easy task for her but this business has given the challenge of how to do things that she didn’t do before. Peleina said she received hundred and fifty money from her goods she sold. Peleina is using the money to do what her family wants and especially her children’s fees.  Her business has improved by growing more vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes and more.  She sells her goods at the market, shops in her village and also in her own residence.  She has a strong belief that she will become a better businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables seeds, fertilizers, pesticides

loans.name: Nora Idalia

texts.en:
Nora is 30 years old and is from Monterrey. She is a divorced woman who has 4 children. She began to sell beauty products when she divorced, because she was not able to support her family with her salary. While she was working in a factory she realised she could sell products and make more money. So she bought some beauty products and started-up her business.

Now, Nora needs your help, because she needs a loan of USD$ 750 to get more beauty products, so that she can attract new customers and sell more in order to give her children a better life.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
Valerio is 52 years old and is married with 3 children. After working for many years in highway construction and after seeing the need for more money in his family, he decided to open a stall in the central market in the city with his wife. With the help of his wife and his 2 sons he works very hard 6 days a week, come rain or shine. His main motivation is to give his children the opportunity to go to university as neither he nor his wife were lucky enough to do this. All of his children study and his eldest daughter is doing the entry exam to study Medicine in the UNA (National University of Asunción). Valerio does not only have this stall, but he also rears pigs in a sty that he inherited from his parents. Valerio wants to increase his earnings and would like to buy merchandise in larger quantities so that he can sell more in his stall and sell to other stalls. He is asking for a loan of $675 with which he will buy sugar, flour, oil, grain and dairy products etc.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Valerio tiene 52 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Luego de Trabajar varios años en una empresa de construcciones viales, y viendo la necesidad de generar más ingresos en la familia, decidió junto con su esposa habilitar una despensa en el mercado municipal de la ciudad. Ayudado de su esposa y dos de sus hijos, él trabaja arduamente seis días a la semana haga frío o calor. Su principal motivación es la de dar la oportunidad a su hijos de culminar sus estudios universitarios, ya que él y su esposa no corrieron con esa suerte. Todos sus hijos estudian, y su hija mayor está cursando el probatorio para la Carrera de Medicina en la U.N.A (Universidad Nacional de Asunción). Valerio no solo tiene la despensa, sino que también se dedica a la cría de cerdos en un inmueble que heredo de sus padres. Valerio desea aumentar sus ingresos, por lo que desea comprar en grandes cantidades mercaderías para vender al por mayor en su despensa y ser proveedor de las demás despensas del lugar. Solicita la suma de $ 675 con los que adquirirá azúcar, harina, aceite, granos, productos enlatados, etc.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, oil, grain, dairy products/Para comprar al por mayor azúcar, harina, aceite, granos, productos enlatados, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Mrs. Alice E. is 48, married, and has six children. She sells bread and provisions to earn her living.
