She needs a small loan in the amount of US$ 400 to enhance her business, i.e., buy more bread and provisions for resale. This will enable Alice to earn a better living as well as taking better care of her family. She has been a faithful and trustworthy member of LAPO for the past 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more bread & provisions for resale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
Doña Rosita is 26 years old, the mother of three children, and a long-time rancher. Ever since she was little, she learned alongside her parents, and now that she has a family of her own with Gilberto, they decided to buy two milking cows, despite the sacrifices, to help pay the family expenses by selling milk. As the family grew, the expenses grew as well, and Gilberto had to leave the home to find a stable job. Currently he works as a miner far from their village. Meanwhile, Rosita has continued to devote herself to selling milk, which brings in a good income. They hope to purchase another cow to improve their economic situation and allow Gilberto to return to his home and care for the animals, selling milk alongside his beloved wife and children. To make her wishes come to life, Rosita is requesting a loan and is committed to repaying it within six months. We can help this young couple enjoy their marriage and family love.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosita tiene 26 años de edad es madre de tres niños y desde muy jovencita se dedicó a la labor ganadera, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres; luego de formar su familia con Gilberto decidieron comprarse con mucho sacrificio un par de vaquitas lecheras para solventar sus gastos familiares con la comercialización de la leche; sin embargo con la llegada de más miembros a su familia los gastos se iban incrementando, motivo por el cual Gilberto tuvo que salir de su hogar en busca de un trabajo estable y actualmente labora como obrero en una mina muy apartada de su localidad.Mientras tanto Rosita sigue dedicándose a la comercialización de leche, que por cierto le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos, por lo que planea comprar otra vaquita más, con el que mejorará su situación económica y al mismo tiempo le permitirá volver a Gilberto a su hogar y dedicarse de lleno a la crianza de sus animales y a la venta de leche junto a su querida esposa e hijos.Para concretar sus deseos Rosita solicita un préstamo y promete rembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses, nosotros podemos ayudar a esta joven pareja a disfrutar de la unión y amor familiar.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata K. has been in business for 18 years but has experienced slow growth due to lack of sufficient capital.  She sells cotton and African prints in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  She joined the SMT loan program a year ago and has seen her business increase as a result of her first SMT loan.  She will complete her installments in December and would like to access more loans to expand the business further and also acquire a better location for the business.

loans.use: Expand her business by acquiring a better location for her storefront to attract new customers

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn B., age 45, runs a stand at home selling variety of grocery products to the people in her community, making on average around $15 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and typically makes around $7.50 each day of income. She has 5 children; One of them is employed as a garment worker making $80 each month and the rest of them are students. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of grocery products.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
For the last seventeen years, Maria Lourdes has dedicated herself to selling clothing in a stairwell in the Bisne Market of Chinandega. She began her business selling small quantities of her products, but through the years, she has gone on to acquire greater quantities for sale.

She began her business due to the need her family found itself in for a long time; her husband’s income did not suffice to cover the household expenses, which is why she decided to invest in this business. As the years went by, three children her born, and her responsibility blossomed, since it was necessary to work harder to maintain her humble home.

CEPRODEL has been her unconditional support these last three years, providing her a total of 20 credits that have been used for acquiring her products as well as sustaining her household.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Lourdes desde hace 17 años se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa en un tramo del mercado Bisne de Chinandega. Su negocio lo inició vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades sus productos pero por medio de los años ha venido adquiriendo mas cantidades para su debida comercialización.

El negocio lo comienza por la necesidad que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado su familia, el cual los ingresos de su esposo no daban abasto para los gastos del hogar, es por esto que decide invertir en este negocio. Con el paso de los años, nacieron sus tres hijos y su responsabilidad proliferó ya que le es necesario trabajar mas fuertemente para mantener su humilde hogar.

Su apoyo incondicional ha sido Ceprodel desde hace 3 años atrás brindándole un total de 20 créditos utilizados para la adquisición de sus productos y a la vez para el sustento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of curios

loans.name: Sanela

texts.en:
Sanela was born in 1975 and she is married. She is from Filipovići, a small village near the town of Goražde. Her husband has a pension from his military service; he gets US$ 240 monthly as a pension. He also does seasonal work in agriculture together with Sanela. They have two children, 13 and 14 years old.

This is Sanela's second loan at MCO WWI. Sanela will use this loan in the amount of US$ 825 to buy a cow to raise. She intends to increase her monthly household income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita was born and raised in the Ochocienta community of Santo Domingo. She’s thirty-eight years old and a proud mother of five sons and two daughters. Margarita sells an assortment of tennis shoes in her community. This entrepreneur doesn’t currently own an establishment for her to sell the merchandise, but she plans on putting aside money to have a location in a few years. With her loan, Margarita will add new items to her stock so as to make her business more atractive and augment her revenue.

Margarita’s business supports the children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of tennis shoes to restock a small business.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty is a very hardworking person who is always committed to her job in her small hardware store. Thanks to her dedication, she has been able to improve her services, increase her sales, and of course offer more products little by little. Because she has decided to continue to develop professionally, she is requesting a loan in order to improve her business space, thus assuring the profits that will contribute to her personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ketty es una persona muy laboriosa que siempre esta pendiente de su trabajo en su pequeña ferretería y poco a poco gracias a su empeño ha podido mejorar sus servicios y cuenta con más solicitudes y por supuesto mayor cantidad de artículos.Debido a que decidido continuar con su desarrollo profesional solicita un préstamo para mejorar su espacio de labor y así asegurar las ganancias que contribuirán con su desarrollo.

loans.use: Improve services and selection

loans.name: Rosana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosana belongs to the “Mujeres Valientes” (brave women) community bank, located in 123 Jr. Ica, district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 48 years old and has 4 children, her husband is a taxi driver, but the income is not enough. Therefore, with a first loan of $100 USD (S/.300) from Manuela Ramos, Rosana decided to invest in a business to buy and sell “motocarros” (small three-wheeled motorcycle carts).

She currently has this business and gets up at 7 am, prepares breakfast for her family and then works on her house and the business.

With the $850 USD (S/. 2,500) loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 2 second hand motocarros, motor parts, etc.

Rosana is happy for the business support given by Manuela Ramos, without them it would have been impossible to start the business and get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosana pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Ica 126, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 48 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero los ingresos económicos son muy pocos, es así que Rosana con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un negocio D. compra y venta D. motocarros.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. compra y venta D. motocarros, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, D. allí se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a su negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro 2 motocarros D. segunda, piezas para su motor, etc.

Rosana esta feliz por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio, pues sin ellos no hubiera sido posible emprender su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase second hand motorcycle carts and motor parts.

loans.name: Fatuma's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 27 years old and married with 3 children, aged 10, 7, and 3. She became a newspaper seller in 2007. She works from 6am to 4pm everyday at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $52 from her sales.

Fatuma now hopes this loan can help her buy more newspapers for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Cemira

texts.es:
Cemira tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, los mismos que son independientes y de familia, en la actualidad solo vive su esposo Angel, quien es agricultor y la apoya en lo posible.
Se dedica a la venta de fruta y abarrotes, dentro de su vivienda, actividad que la viene realizando desde hace tres años, durante casi todo el día. Ella se siente muy bien con su negocio, ya que el mismo la hace sentir útil ante la sociedad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y socializarse con las distintas personas que recurren a ella para comprar algún producto. Lo difícil es no contar con un ambiente adecuado para su negocio.
Cemira trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios y mantener activo su negocio.
Quiere mandar a ampliar y ambientar adecuadamente su tienda e implementarse de más productos.
texts.en:
Cemira is 54 years old, the mother of 2 independent children, and a family. She now lives alone with her husband Angel, who is a farmer and supports her however possible. She sells fruit and groceries inside her home, an activity that she has been performing daily for three years. She feels good about her business, since it makes it feel useful to society. What she most enjoys about her job is selling and socializing with the different people who rely on her to purchase products. The hard part is not having a proper environment for her business. Cemira works to meet her daily expenses and maintain an active business. She wants to expand her shop and her environment and to help through offering more products.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply and improve the environment of her store

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
En su casa ubicada en una zona urbana de la Ciudad de Rivas tiene instalado su negocio en su casa, jefa de  su familia integrada por 4 personas, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos que son estudiantes, el resto del día ella es la que atiende, ella realiza las compras en el mercado de mayoristas de Rivas. 

Piensa seguir siendo usuaria de ADIM para obtener créditos y así seguir creciendo en su negocio, piensa ofrecer cosméticos y ropa menor que sus clientes demandan, también mejorar el local para dar una mejor atención. 

Expresa que ella se siente empresaria y satisfecha de tener su negocio y que es capaz de salir adelante sola con el apoyo del financiamiento.
texts.en:
In her home located in the urban area of the city of Rivas, Gloria has installed her convenience store. Head of her four-member household, her children (students) help her with the business when they can and she takes care of things herself the rest of the time. Gloria makes her purchases at the city's wholesale market. She plans to continue using Kiva partner ADIM to obtain loans to help her keep growing her business. She plans to offer the cosmetics and lingerie her customers demand and also make improvements to her store for better customer service. She says she feels enterprising and satisfied having her business and that she is capable of making headway on her own with the help of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and make improvements to her store

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther Guzmán P. tiene 56 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis, es la presidenta y vive en el sector de Carata en el Caserío de Motil distrito de Agallpampa provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió Primaria completa pero por falta de apoyo de sus padres no pudo continuar estudiando.
Se casó de 17 años con el señor Víctor Córdoba Gutiérrez y tuvieron 13 hijos uno de los cuales falleció, actualmente viven con ella 2 hijos hombres y una mujer que aun son estudiantes.
La señora Esther compra leña en cantidad, lo mismo que madera, gracias al esfurzo de toda la familia compraron un camión grande con el que transportan madera y leña para vender en otros distritos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas compro leña y madera.
Con este crédito de 2000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas,  piensa comprar leña en cantidad y listones de madera.
Esther sueña con viajar a Chile y visitar a dos hijos que están allí.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esther Guzmán P. is 56 years old, belongs to and is the president of the Communal Bank “San Luis”. She lives in the Carata area of the Caserío de Motil district of Agallpampa, Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed primary school but because of lack of support from her parents she couldn’t continue studying. She married at 17 years old to Mr. Víctor Córdoba Gutiérrez and they had 13 children, one of whom passed away, and today still living with them are 2 sons and a daughter who are still students. Esther buys wood and firewood in quantity, thanks to the efforts of all the family they bought a large truck with which they transport the wood and firewood to sell in other neighborhoods. With her first loan of 300 soles which she repaid in 4 payments, she bought wood and firewood. With this loan for 2000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she plans to buy a large quantity of firewood and strips of wood. Esther dreams of traveling to Chile and visiting two children who are there.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and firewood at wholesale

loans.name: Judith Catalina

texts.es:
Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.

Es casada, tiene tres hijos y a sus 58 años D. edad ha crecido. Junto a su esposo, que es jubilado, atienD. su fuente D. soda desD. hace cuatro años y tiene a su cargo a 2 D. sus hijos, uno D. ellos, una mujer, es especial, quien llegó a ser su mayor reto, el criarla. Abastece su negocio por medio D. los agentes distribuidores. Su negocio, poco a poco, ha crecido.

El préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, abastecerá su tienda con cerveza y con otros productos que servirán para surtir su negocio.

Judith agradece el apoyo que le ha brindado Credimujer para el crecimiento D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the community bank Mujeres al Progreso from the district and province of Yungay in the department of Ancash. She is married and has three children at her age of 58. Together with her husband, who is retired, she sees after their soda fountain and grocery store and has for the past four years. Two of her children are still under her care, and one of them, a woman, is special and it has been a big challenge raising her. She supplies her business with products from distribution agents. Her business, little by little, has grown. The loan of 1500 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, will supply her store with beer and other products that she will offer to boost her business. Judith is thankful for the support that Credimujer has offered her to help her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy beer and other products.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba B. works selling shoes from her own stall inside the clothing market in the beautiful town of Istaravshan, Tajikistan. She has spent the last 11 years dedicating herself to this business. The business generates enough income in order to be able to live with dignity. lMON has provided Matluba with financial help for the last year, which has allowed her to increase her stock and ensure her three children’s sustenance. She currently has a pressing need to acquire more shoes for the winter season in order to market them, and for this reason she came to IMON looking for more support. Her goal is to continue expanding and improving her business every day, considering that her husband's job as a driver does not earn enough and her children have no steady work. So, Matluba has to work hard in order to improve their living conditions. Matluba is very grateful to everyone who is helping her. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing winter boots for men
